Combine flour and cornstarch, gradually add to butter mixture, beating at lowest speed after each addition.  Press into a 15"x10"x1" jelly roll pan.  Bake at 350° for 15 minutes.  Reduce heat to 325° and bake for 20 minutes or until top is lightly browned.  Cool in pan on wire rack for 5 minutes.  Cut shortbread into 1" squares.  Store up to 1 week or freeze for up to 3 months.

Name: Snow Ice Cream
Instructions: Combine egg and sugar.  Stir well with a wire whisk.  Add milk and vanilla, stirring well.  Place snow in a large bowl.  Gradually add milk mixture to snow, gently stirring with a wooden spoon until blended.

Name: Apple Butter Bars
Instructions: Combine flour, soda and salt in a large bowl.  Add oats and sugar.  Stir in butter and mix well.  Press half of mixture into a greased 13"x9"x2" baking pan.  Top with apple butter.  Sprinkle with remaining crumb mixture and press in gently with a spoon.  Bake at 350° for 55 minutes or until browned.  Cool and cut into bars.

Name: Chocolate Pudding
Instructions: Combine cocoa, sugar, salt and flour.  Slowly stir in milk.  Microwave for 5 minutes, stirring 1/2 way into cooking time.  Stir and cook for 1-2 minutes more until thick.  Stir in butter and vanilla.  Cool and serve or put in pie crust.

Name: Cheesecake Bars
Instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  Mix crumbs, butter and 3 Tbs. sugar.  Press onto bottom of 13"x9"x2" baking pan.  Beat cream cheese, 3/4 cups sugar and vanilla with mixer on medium speed until well blended.  Add eggs, mix just until blended.  Pour over crust.  Bake 30 minutes or until center is almost set.  Cool.  Refrigerate 3 hours or overnight.  Store leftovers in fridge.

Name: Banana Cream Pie Bars
Instructions: Preheat oven to 325°.  Mix crumbs, pecans and butter in a 13"x9"x2" baking pan.  Press frimly onto bottom.  Bake 8 minutes.  Cool for 10 minutes.  Top with banana slices.  Pour milk into large bowl.  Add dry pudding mixes.  Beat with a wire whisk for 2 minutes or until will blended.  Spoon 2 cups of pudding over banana.  Gently stir 1 cup of cool whip into remaining pudding.  Spoon over pie.  Top with remaining 1 1/2 cups cool whip.  Refrigerate at least 3 hours.

Name: Baked Custard
Instructions: In a bowl, lightly beat the egg.  Add milk, sugar, vanilla and salt.  Pour into ungreased 6 oz. custard cups.  Sprinkle with nutmeg.  Set in pan containing 1/2 to 1" of hot water.  Bake at 350° for 35 minutes or until set and a knife through center is clean.

Name: Cream Cheese Tarts
Instructions: Beat cream cheese in medium mixing bowl until soft and creamy.  Gradually add sugar, beating until light and fluffy.  Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.  Stir in vanilla.  Place a vanilla wafer in each paper-lined muffin cup.  Spoon cream cheese mixture over wafer, filling cups full.  Bake at 350° for 20 minuets.  Leave in muffin pans and refrigerate overnight.  To serve, remove paper liners and top with pie filling or whipped cream.

Name: Applesauce
Instructions: Heat apples and water to boiling over medium heat, stirring often.  Reduce heat and simmer, uncovered, until apples are tender.  Stir in remaining ingredients.  Heat to boiling.  Boil and stir for 1 minute.

Name: Apple Crisp
Instructions: Sprinkle the sugar and cinnamon over the bottom of a 9" square pan.  Dot with 1/4 cup butter.  Arrange the apple slices in the pan.  Mix the flour, brown sugar and 1/4 cup butter in bowl until crumbly.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

Name: Mandarin Orange Jello
Instructions: Mix jello and hot water until crystals are dissolved.  Add oranges and orange juice.  Refrigerate until set.  For dressing, mix sour cream, brown sugar and vanilla until combined.  Dollop on top of jello.

Name: Kringla
Instructions: Cream together sugar, butter, eggs, vanilla and baking soda.  Mix in sour cream, flour, baking powder and salt.  Chill in refrigerator.  Shape into bow knots.  Bake at 350° for 8-10 minutes till done but not brown.

Name: Chocolate Cookie Bark
Instructions: Place both chocolates in separate bowls to microwave.  Melt, following directions on package.  Add peanut butter to white chocolate.  Stir.  Crumble cookies over both cocolates.  Mix well.  Drop spoonfuls of mixtures onto wax paper-covered baking sheet alternating colors.  Cut through several times with a knive for marble effect.  Refrigerate at least 1 hour or until firm.

Name: Pumpkin Bars
Instructions:
Combine all ingredients together.  Bake at 350° for 20-25 minutes in a 13"x9"x2" baking pan. 

FROSTING--

Cream together:
4 oz. cream cheese
2 Tbs. butter
1 tsp. vanilla
2 cups powdered sugar

Name: Cranberry Shortcake
Instructions: Sift together flour, sugar, baking powder and salt.  Add milk and mix well.  Add butter and cranberries.  Mix well.  Bake in a 9" square baking dish at 375° for 30-40 minutes.  For icing, bring butter, sugar and whipping cream to a boil and simmer for 10 minutes.  Top with whipped cream and serve warm.

Name: Dutch Apple Wedges
Instructions: Heat oven to 350°.  Mix 1 cup flour and 1/3 cup sugar in medium bowl.  Cut in butter, using pastry blender or crisscrossing 2 knives, until crumbly.  Press in ungreased round pan, 9"x1-1/2".  Bake 25 minutes.  Make crumb topping (flour, brown sugar and butter) and set aside.  Mix 1/3 cup sugar, 2 Tbs. flour and cinnamon in medium bowl.  Stir in apples until coated.  Spoon over baked layer.  Sprinkle with topping.  Bake about 30 minutes or until topping is light brown and apples are tender.  Cool 30 minutes before serving.  Serve warm or cool.  Cut into 12 wedges.

Name: Peanut Brittle with Chocolate and Peanut butter
Instructions: Spray baking sheet or 15"x10"x1" pan with cooking spray.  Mix sugar and syrup in large bowl until moistened.  Microwave on high for 5 minutes.  Stir in butter and peanuts.  Microwave 3-4 minutes or until pale golden brown.  Add baking soda and vanilla (will foam).  Spread as thinkly as possible onto baking sheet.  Cool completely.  Break into pieces.  Microwave chocolate in measuring cup on high for 1-2 minutes.  Stir until melted.  Stir in peanut butter till melted.  Dip half of brittle halfway into chocolate mixture.  Scrape to remove excess.  Place on parchment paper.  Refrigerate about 20 minutes.  For heat: stir in 1 tsp. hot pepper sauce with vanilla.

Name: Chocolate Bites
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°.  Microwave chocolate and butter in large bowl on high for 2 minutes or until butter is melted.  Stir until chocolate is completely melted.  Stir in sugar.  Blend in eggs and vanilla.  Add flour.  Mix well.  Refrigerate 15 minutes or until easy to handle.  Shape into 1" balls.  Place 2" apart on greased baking sheets.  Bake 8 minutes or until set.  Let stand on sheet for 1 minute.  Transfer to wire racks.

Options: after coming out of oven, press walnut half, marshmallow half (dipped in sugar), half caramel, candy canes-chopped, melted baking chocolate

Name: Pumpkin Bars
Instructions: Sift dry ingredients together.  Add beaten eggs, oil and pumpkin.  Stir together until well mixed.  Pour into jelly-roll pan.  Bake at 350° for 25 minutes.  May need to cover edges with foil and bake a bit longer to make sure center is done.  Frost with cream cheese frosting.

Name: Apple-Pear Crumble Pie
Instructions: Preheat oven to 375°.  Mix wafer crumbs, brown sugar and butter until well blended.  Set aside.  Place crust in 9" pie plate.  Spread cream cheese on bottom.  Sprinkle with half of crumb mixture.  Set aside.  Combine fruit in large bowl.  Add sugar, flour, cinnamon.  Toss to coat.  Spoon over crumb layer in pie crust.  Sprinkle with remaining crumb mixture.  Bake 35 minutes or until fruit is tender and crust is lightly browned, covering loosely with foil after 25 minutes if necessary to prevent crust from over-browning.  Cool on wire rack.  Serve with cool whip.  Store leftovers in fridge.

Name: Lemon Treat
Instructions: Mix pie filling, sugar and egg with 1/4 cup water until smooth.  Slowly add another 1-3/4 cup water.  Cook, stirring constantly, over medium heat until mixture comes to a full boil.  Remove from heat and cool completely.  Fold in whipped topping and spoon into dessert dishes.

Name: Creamy Raspberry Dessert
Instructions: Combine crumbs, sugar and butter.  Press onto the bottom of an 8" or 9" sping form pan.  Bake at 350° for 10 minutes.  Cool.  Meanwhile, for filling, drain raspberries and reserve juice.  Set berries aside.  In a small saucepan, combine juice, cold water and gelatin.  Let stand for 5 minutes.  Cook and stir over low heat until gelatin dissolves.  Remove from the heat; cool for 10 minutes.  In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and sugar until blended.  Add berries and gelatin mixture; beat on low until thoroughly blended.  Chill until partially set.  Watch carefully, as mixture will set up quickly.  By hand, gently fold in whipped cream.  Spoon into the crust.  Chill for 6 hours or overnight.  Just before serving, run a knife around edge of pan to loosen.  Remove sides of pan.  Top with fresh raspberries and whipped cream.

Name: Flaky Apricot Pastries
Instructions:
In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and butter.  Add flour; mix well.  Divide dough into four pieces.  Cover and refrigerate for 2 hours.

On a floured surface, roll each portion of dough into a 12"x8" rectangle.  Combine sugar and cinnamon; sprinkle over dough.  Spread with preserves.  Roll up tightly, starting with a short side; pinch ends.  Place seam side down on a greased baking sheet.  Using a sharmp knife, make three slashes across the top of each roll.

Bake at 350° for 28-32 minutes or until golden brown.  Remove to wire racks to cool.  Combine glaze ingredients; drizzle over pastries.

Name: Tuna Noodle Casserole
Instructions: Stir soup, milk, peas, tuna and noodles in a 1-1/2 qt. casserole dish.  Bake at 400° for 20 minutes or until hot.  Stir.  Top with cheese.

Name: Three-Cheese Potato Bake
Instructions: In a large saucepan, combine the broth, milk, butter and pepper; bring to a boil.  Remove from heat; stir in potato flakes.  Let stand for 30 seconds.  Fluff with a fork.  Transfer to a greased 1-quart baking dish.  Top with cheeses.  Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 20 minutes or until cheese is melted.  Sprinkle with chives.  Serve with sour cream if desired.

Name: Creamy Potato Casserole
Instructions: In large bowl, combine all ingredients.  Transfer to ungreased 2 quart baking dish.  Bake, uncovered, at 350° for 1 hour or until heated through.

Name: Breakfast Bake
Instructions: Heat oven to 350°.  Unroll dough in 13"x9"x2" baking dish.  Press to cover bottom of dish, firmly pressing holes and seams together to seal.  Sprinkle ham over crust.  Beat eggs, milk and pepper with whisk until blended.  Pour over ham.  Top with cheeses.  Bake for 25 minutes or until center is set.

Name: Potato Pancakes
Instructions: Combine first 4 ingredients, stirring well.  Pour oil to a depth of 1/8" into large heavy skillet.  Drop mixture by 6 heaping tablespoons into hot oil.  Press into 3" rounds with back of fork.  Fry until golden brown, turning once.  Drain well on paper towels.

Name: Potato Frittata
Instructions: Combine eggs and milk.  Mix well, set aside.  Heat oil in a 10" nonstick skillet.  Add cubed potato, onion, salt and pepper.  Saute 8-10 minutes or until tender and lightly browned.  Add potato mixture, cheese and parsley to egg mixture, stirring constantly.  Return skillet to heat.  Add egg mixture.  Cover, reduce heat and cook 12-15 minutes or until center is set.  Cut into wedges and serve immediately.

Name: Apple Tart
Instructions: Place flour, butter and half of the cream cheese in food processor.  Cover.  Process using pulsing action until mixture is well-blended and almost a ball.  Shape dough into a ball.  Wrap tightly with plastic wrap.  Refrigerate 1 hour or until chilled.  Preheat oven to 400°.  Place pastry on lightly floured surface.  Roll out to 14"x8" rectangle.  Place on parchment paper-covered baking sheet.  Set askide.  Mix remaining cream cheese and half of the dry gelatin mix until well-blended.  Spread onto pastry to within 2" of edge.  Toss apples with remaining gelatin mix, cornstarch and cinnamon.  Spoon evenly over cream cheese filling.  Fold edge of pastry over apples toward center.  Sprinkle with almonds.  Bake in lower rack 35 minutes or until golden crust and apples are tender.  Cool.  Store in fridge.

Name: Crepes
Instructions: Beat first 3 ingredients at medium speed with an electric mixer until smooth.  Add eggs, beating well; stir in 2 Tbs. melted butter.  Cover and chill at least 1 hour.  Brush bottom of a 6" nonstick skillet with melted butter.  Place over medium heat until hot.  Pour 2 Tbs. batter into pan.  Quickly tilt in all directions so batter covers bottom of pan.  Cook 1 minute or until crepe can be shaken loose from pan.  Turn and cook about 30 seconds.  Cool.

Name: Apple Oven Pancake
Instructions:
In a bowl, combine the apples, brown sugar, honey, cinnamon and nutmeg.  Melt butter in a 12" ovenproof skillet.  Add apple mixture to skillet.  Saute for 15 minutes or until tender.

In a blender, combine the eggs, milk, flour, sugar and salt; cover and process for 10 seconds or until smooth.  Pour over apple mixture; gently lift apple mixture, letting egg mixture flow beneath.  Bake, uncovered, at 425° for 15-20 minutes or until the pancake is puffy and golden brown.  Sprinkle with lemon jice and confectioners' sugar if desired.  Cut into wedges.  Serve warm.

Name: Buttermilk Pancakes
Instructions: Combine first 4 ingredients.  Combine egg, buttermilk and oil.  Slowly stir into dry ingredients.  Make pancakes.

Name: Monkey Bread
Instructions: Cut each biscuit into quarters.  Mix sugar and cinnamon in a bag.  Shake biscuit pieces in sugar mixture.  Put pieces in a well-greased angel food pan or bundt pan.  Melt brown sugar and butter, but do not boil.  Pour over pieces in cake pan.  Bake at 400° for 50-55 minutes, covering with foil after 20 minutes to prevent overbrowning.  Cool on wire rack for 5 minutes.

Name: Oatmeal Pancakes
Instructions: In a bowl, combine oats, flour, baking soda and sugar.  Combine the egg, buttermilk and butter; stir into the dry ingredients just until moistened.  Pour batter by 1/3 cup onto a greased hot griddle.  Turn when bubbles form.  Flip and cook on other side.

Name: Cinnamon Rolls
Instructions: Stir together 1/4 cup warm water, yeast and 1/4 cup sugar; let stand 5 minutes.  Combine yeast mixture, 1-3/4 cup flour, milk, salt, egg and shortening in a large mixing bowl.  Beat at medium speed with an electric mixture until well blended.  Gradually sitr in enough remaining flour to make a soft dough.  Turn dough onto a well-floured surface.  Knead until smooth and elastic (about 5 minutes).  Place in well-greased bowl, turning to grease top.  Cover and let rise in warm place (85°) for 1-1/2 hours or until doubled in bulk.  Punch dough down and cover.  Let rise in warm place for 30 minutes or until dough is doubled.  Turn dough out onto a floured surface and roll dough to a 15"x9" rectangle.  Spread with butter and sprinkle with remaining 1/2 cup sugar and cinnamon.  Roll up starting at a long edge.  Cut dough into 1" slices.  Arrange in a lightly greased 13"x9"x2" baking pan.  Cover and let rise in a warm place for 30-40 minutes or until doubled.  Bake at 375° for 17 minutes or until done.  Stir together powdered sugar, 3-4 Tbs milk and vanilla until blended and drizzle over rolls.

Name: Brown Sugar Banana Coffee Cake
Instructions:
In a food processor or a bowl, whirl or mix 3/4 cup flour, 3/4 cup brown sugar, and 1/4 tsp salt.  Cut 1/4 cup butter into chunks and add to bowl; pulse mixture or cut in butter with a pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.  Set aside.

With a mixer on high speed, beat remaining 1/4 c. butter and remaining 1 cup brown sugar until smooth.  Beat in eggs and vanilla, scraping down sides of bowl as necessary until well blended.  Beat in mashed bananas.

In a small bowl, stir together remaining 1-1/2 cup flour, baking powder and 1/4 tsp. salt.  Stir into banana mixture.  Gently fold in sour cream until well blended.

Divide batter equally among 6 jumbo cups or 18 regular cups, filling 1/2 full.  Sprinkle streusel evenly over tops of cakes

Bake in a 350° oven until streusel is browned and toothpick comes out clean with mist crumbs attached-18-25 minutes.  Cool 5 minutes in cups, then invert pan to remove.  Serve warm or let cool completely.

Name: Drop Biscuits and Gravy
Instructions: In a bowl, combine flour, baking powder and salt.  Combine milk and butter; stir into dry ingredients just until blended.  Drop by rounded teaspoonfuls onto a greased baking sheet.  Bake at 450° for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.  Meanwhile, in a saucepan, cook the sausage over medium heat until no longer pink.  Stir in butter until melted.  Sprinkle with flour.  Gradually stir in milk, salt and pepper.  Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes.  Serve over biscuits.

Name: Pizza Crust
Instructions: Blend flour and salt in mixing bowl.  Heat water to 105°-110°.  Add yeast to water and stir to hydrate and let stand for 5 minutes.  Add oil and yeast to flour mixture.  Mix until flour is moist and mixture is a ball.  Put in dough hook and beat for 6-7 minutes on medium or knead on counter for 8-10 minutes.  Place in bowl.  Microwave 2 cups water for 4 minutes.  Put dough in microwave for 2 hours.

Name: Banana Bread
Description: Makes one large and one small loaf
Instructions: Mix butter, buttermilk and bananas.  Beat for 2 minutes.  Combine flour, sugar, baking soda, baking powder and salt.  Add to banana mixture and mix for 2 minutes.  Add buttermilk and eggs and mix until combined.  Bake at 350°.  Makes 1 large loaf and one small loaf (large-50 minutes, small-40 minutes)

Name: Rolls
Instructions: In a small bowl, combine all of the ingredients.  Spoon into 6 muffin cups coated with nonstick cooking spray.  Bake at 450° for 8-10 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool for 5 minutes before removing from pan to wire rack.  Serve warm.

Name: Apple Butter Bread
Instructions: Combine flour, sugar and cinnamon.  Set aside.  Combine eggs, butter, apple butter and milk.  Beat well.  Stir in pecans and raisins.  Add flour mixture stirring just until moistened.  Spoon batter into a greased and floured 9"x5"x3" loaf pan.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour and 5 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool in pan 10 minutes.  Remove to a wire rack and cool completely.

Name: Strawberry Bread
Instructions: Combine first 4 ingredients.  Set aside.  Combine oil, eggs and sugar in large bowl of electric mixer.  Mix well.  Gradually add dry ingredients to creamed mixture, stirring just until all ingredients are moistened.  Stir in strawberries and pecans.  Spoon mixture into 2 greased and floured 8-1/2"x4-1/2"x3" loaf pans.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool in pans for 10 minutes.  Remove to wire rack and cool completely.

Name: Mayonnaise Bread
Instructions: Combine flour, milk and mayonnaise in a bowl, stirring just until dry ingredients are moistened.  Grease a 10" cast-iron skillet with oil.  Place in a 400° oven for 4 minutes or until hot.  Remove from oven.  Sprinkle with cornmeal.  Spoon batter evenly into skillet.  Bake at 400° for 25 minutes or until lightly browned.

Name: Tea Cakes
Instructions: Combine all ingredients and pour into greased mini-muffin cups.  Bake at 375° for 10-15 minutes.

Name: Cream Cheese Biscuits
Instructions: In a mixer, beat cream cheese and butter together.  Add flour, mixing well.  Roll out to 1/2" thickness and cut with a small biscuit cutter.  Place on a greased baking sheet and bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until lightly browned.

Name: Easy Biscuits
Instructions: Mix all ingredients and drop by spoonfuls on a baking sheet.  Bake at 425° until biscuits are golden brown.  Serve with butter.

Name: Quick Whipping Cream Biscuits
Instructions: Cut 1/2 cup butter into flour with a pastry blender or fork until crumbly.  Add whipping cream, stirring just until dry ingredients are moistened.  Turn dough out onto a lightly floured surface.  Knead lightly 3 or 4 times.  Roll or pat dough to 3/4" thickness.  Cut out 2" round pieces.  Place biscuits on a lightly greased baking sheet.  Bake at 400° for 13-15 minutes.  Brush biscuits with 1/4 cup melted butter.

Name: Shortnin' Bread
Instructions: Mix all ingredients together.  Knead with your fingers until it is mixed together.  Press into an ungreased cookie sheet or pan.  Bake at 325° for 20 minutes until light brown.  Cut into wedges or break apart.

Name: Baking Powder Biscuits
Instructions: Combine flour, baking powder and salt.  Cut in shortening with a pastry blender until mixture resembles coarse meal.  Add milk, stirring until dry ingredients are moistened.  Turn dough out onto a floured surface and knead lightly 4 or 5 times.  Roll dough to 1/2" thickness.  Cut with a 2" biscuit cutter.  Place on a lightly greased baking sheet.  Bake at 400° for 12-14 minutes or until lightly browned.

Name: Flour Tortillas
Instructions: Mix dry ingredients together.  Add shortening and water.  Use fork or hands to mix.  Knead several minutes.  Form 12 small balls.  Let rest for 10 minutes.  Heat pan at medium-high.  Lightly coat with cooking spray.  Roll out dough-fairly thin.  Cook on both sides.

Name: Sweet Cinnamon Biscuits
Instructions: Combine flour, baking powder, salt and baking soda in a medium bowl and mix well.  Stir in oil.  Add buttermilk and stir until blended.  Knead the dough on a lightly floured surface until smooth.  Roll dough into a 15"x8" rectangle.  Preheat the oven to 400°.  Grease a 9" round baking pan lightly.  Spread butter over the dough.  Combine sugar and cinnamon in a small bowl and mix well.  Sprinkle over butter.  Roll up rectangle jelly-roll fashion, starting from one long side.  Pinch seam to seal.  Cut the roll into 1-1/2" slices.  Arrange the slices, cut side up, in prepared baking pan.  Bake until lightly browned, about 15-20 minutes.  Remove from oven.  Pour milk over the top, if desired.  Serve hot.

Name: Pumpkin Bread
Instructions: In a large mixing bowl, beat together sugar, eggs, water, pumpkin and oil. Stir dry ingredeints together and add to the wet mixture.  Beat or stir just enough to get dry ingredients moistened.  Pour into a well greased loaf pan.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool before cutting.

Name: Chex Party Mix
Instructions:
Heat oven to 250°.  Melt butter in large roasting pan in oven.  Stir in seasonings.  Gradually stir in remaining ingredients until evenly coated.  Bake 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes.  Spread on paper towels to cool.  Store in airtight container

To Microwave:  Microwave, uncovered, on high for 5-6 minutes, thoroughly stirring every 2 minutes.  Follow other directions above.

Name: Cheesy Chicken and Rice Casserole
Instructions:
Stir soup, water, rice, onion powder, pepper and vegetalbes in 11"x8" shallow baking dish.  Top with chicken.  Season chicken as desired.  Cover.

Bake at 375° for 50 minutes or unitl chicken and rice are done.  Top with cheese.  Let casserole stand for 10 minutes.  Stir rice before serving.

Name: Taco Tidbits
Instructions: Place butter in an 11"x7"x2" microwave-safe dish.  Cover and microwave on high for 60-70 seconds or until melted.  Add taco seasoning.  Stir in the cereal until evenly coated.  Microwave on high for 1 minute.  Stir.  Heat 1 to 1-1/2 minutes longer.  Stir.  Sprinkle with parmesan cheese; microwave for 1 minute.  Heat 1 minute.  Cool.

Name: Buttery Cereal Bites
Instructions: Melt butter in skillet; stir in salt.  Add crispy rice cereal, stirring to coat.  Cook over low heat until cereal is lightly toasted, stirring constantly.  Sprinkle with cheese.  Toss to coat.  Spread mixture on paper towels and let cool completely.

Name: The Ultimate Grilled Cheese
Description: Great way to use leftover shredded cheese!
Instructions: In a mixing bowl, beat cream cheese and mayonnaise until smooth.  Stir in cheese, garlic powder and seasoned salt.  Spread five slices of bread with the cheese mixture-about 1/3 cup on each.  Top with remaining bread.  Butter the outsides of sandwiches.  Cook in a large skillet over medium heat until golden brown on both sides.

Name: Cheeseburger Buns
Instructions:
In a mixing bowl, dissolve yeast in warm water.  Add milk, sugar, shortening, egg, salt and 2 cups flour.  Beat until smooth.  Stir in enough remaining flour to form a soft dough.  Turn onto a floured surface; knead until smooth and elastic, about 4-6 minutes.  Place in a greased bowl, turning once to grease top cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled, about 30 minutes. 

In a skillet, cook beef and onion until meat is no longer pink; drain.  Stir in tomato sauce.  Remove from the heat; set aside.  Punch down dough; divide into 16 pieces.  On a lightly floured surface, gently roll out and stretch each piece into a 5" circle.  Top each circle with 2 pieces of cheese and about 3 Tbs. beef mixture.  Bring dough over filling to center; pinch edges to seal.

Place seam-side down on a greased baking sheet.  Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled, about 20 minutes.  Bake at 400° for 8-12 minutes or until golden brown.  Serve immediately.  Refrigerate leftovers.

Name: Crab and Red Pepper Spread
Instructions: Reserve 2 Tbs. onions.  Mix remaining ingredients.  Cover.  Refrigerate at least 1 hour.  Sprinkle with remaining onions.  Serve with crackers.

Name: Hot Spinach Dip
Instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  Mix spinach, mayo, cheese and garlic until well blended.  Spoon into a 9" pie plate or quiche dish.  Bake for 20 minutes or until heated through.  Sprinkle with peppers.  Serve with Wheat Thins.

Name: Holiday Cheese Spread
Instructions: Combine all ingredients in a large mixing bowl.  Beat at medium speed with electric mixer until smooth.  Cover and chill.

Name: Baked Artichoke Dip
Instructions: Combine all ingredients.  Spoon into a lightly greased 1-qt. casserole dish.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until bubbly.  Serve with melba toast.

Name: Pumpkin Pie Dip
Instructions: Beat cream cheese and sugar at medium speed with an electric mixer until smooth.  Add pie filling, 1 tsp cinnamon and ginger, beating well.  Cover and chill for 8 hours.  Serve with gingersnaps, apples and/or pear slices

Name: Tomato-Cheddar Spread
Instructions: Stir together first 4 ingredients in a large bowl.  Stir in cheese and pimiento.  Serve with crackers or on sandwiches.

Name: Fruit Dip
Instructions: Mix together and serve with fruits.

Name: Creamy Dip
Instructions: Combine cream cheese and mayonnaise and beat until creamy.  Stir in salad dressing mix and onion.  Chill and serve with fresh vegetables.

Name: Cheese Ball
Instructions: In processor, add first 4 ingredients.  Process until smooth.  Cover and chill for at least 3 hours.  Shape into a ball and roll in nuts, pressing gently.  Chill.

Name: Spicy Cheese Spread
Instructions: Combine first 6 ingredients.  Spoon into 1/2 cup containers and sprinkle with paprika.  Cover and chill at least 8 hours.

Name: Pita Chips
Instructions: Separate each bread round into 2 pieces.  Cut each piece into 8 wedges.  Place in a large heavy-duty ziploc bag.  Combine butter and other ingredients.  Drizzle over wedges.  Close bag and shake.  Place wedges on ungreased baking sheets.  Bake at 300° for 30 minutes or until crisp.  Cool completely.

Name: Lump Soup
Instructions: Add potatoes, onions, salt and celery in a dutch oven.  Cover with water and cook until tender.  Mix together flour, salt and egg.  Drop lumps on potatoes and simmer.  Add butter and milk.  Heat through.

Name: Vegetable Cheese Soup
Instructions: Place veggies and broth in a large sauce pan.  Cover and bring to a boil on medium-high heat.  Reduce heat to low and simmer for 10 minutes or until vegetables are tender.  Mash veggies with potato masher to desired consistency.  Stir in cheese.  Cook for 5 minutes or until cheese is melted and soup is heated through, stirring frequently.

Name: Carrot Soup
Instructions: Saute onion in butter in a Dutch oven until tender.  Add remaining ingredients.  Bring to a boil.  Reduce heat, cover and simmer for 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Remove from heat.  Cool for 10 minutes.  Pour half of soup into electric blender.  Blend until smooth.  Repeat with remaining soup.

Name: Tortellini Alfredo
Instructions: Pour broth and water into large saucepan.  Stir.  Bring to boil on medium-high heat.  Add tortellini.  Reduce heat to medium-low.  Cover.  Simmer for 8-9 minutes or until tortellini is tender.  Add cream cheese and peas.  Stir.  Heat for 2-3 minutes or until cheese is completely melted, stirring occasionally.  Stir in shredded cheese and bacon.

Name: Artichoke Soup
Instructions: Saute onions in butter in a large saucepan until tender.  Add flour and cook 1 minute, stirring constantly.  Gradually stir in chicken broth and cook until thickened, stirring constantly.  Stir in artichoke hearts with liquid and white pepper.  Cook until thoroughly heated.  Sprinkle with fresh parsley.

Name: Bacon, Cheese and Potato Chowder
Instructions: Mix milk and soup in large saucepan.  Stir in hash browns.  Bring to a boil on high heat, stirring occasionally.  Reduce heat to medium-low.  Simmer 10 minutes stirring frequently.  Ladle into 6 bowls.  Top evenly with cheese, bacon and onions.

Name: Baked Potato Soup
Instructions: Bake potatoes at 350° for 65-75 minutes or until tender; cool completely.  Peel and cube.  In a large saucepan, melt butter; stir in flour, salt and pepper until smooth.  Gradually add milk.  Bring to a boil; cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.  Remove from the heat; whisk in sour cream.  Add potatoes and green onions.  Garnish with bacon and cheese.

Name: Chocolate Glaze
Instructions: Microwave cool whip and chocolate in medium bowl on high for 1 minute.  Stir.  Microwave for 30 seconds to 1 minute more until chocolate is melted and mixture is shiny and smooth.  Store in fridge.  Reheat for 1-2 minutes.

Name: Cream Cheese Frosting
Instructions: Blend all ingredients together until smooth.  Spread on cooled bars.

Name: Coca-Cola Cake
Instructions: Combine coca-cola and buttermilk; set aside.  Beat butter at low speed with an electric mixer until creamy.  Gradually add sugar; beat until blended.  Add egg and vanilla' beat at low speed until blended.  Combine flour, cocoa and soda.  Add to butter mixture alternately with cola mixture; begin and end with flour mixture.  Beat at low speed just until blended.  Stir in marshmallows.  Pour batter into a greased and floured 13"x9"x2" baking dish.  Bake at 350° for 30-35 minutes.  Remove from oven.  Cool 10 minutes.  Pour coca-cola frosting over warm cake.

Name: Coca-Cola Frosting
Instructions: Bring butter, cola and cocoa to a boil in a large saucepan over medium heat, stirring until butter melts.  Remove from heat.  Whisk in sugar and vanilla.

Name: Orange Chicken
Instructions: Toss chicken with flour in slow cooker.  Stir in all remaining ingredients.  Cover with lid.  Cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or 3 to 4 on high.

Name: Barbecue Pork Sandwiches
Instructions: Place meat in slow cooker.  Top with onions and sauce.  Cover with lid.  Cook on low for 8-10 hours (or high for 4-5).  Remove meat from slow cooker.  Cut off and discard fat.  Shred meat using 2 forks.  Return meat to slow cooker.  Stir until evenly coated with sauce.  Fill rolls with meat and cheese just before serving.

Name: Slow-Cooker Spaghetti Sauce
Instructions: In a skillet, cook beef and onion over medium heat until meat is no longer pink; drain.  Transfer to a slow cooker.  Add next 10 ingredients.  Cover and cook on low for 7 to 8 hours or until heated through.  Discard bay leaf.  Serve over spaghetti.

Name: Baked Potato Bar
Instructions: Pierce potatoes with fork.  Place potatoes and oil in large plastic food-storage bag; toss to coat with oil.  Sprinkle with salt and pepper.  Wrap potatoes individually in aluminum foil.  Place in 5 to 6-quart slow cooker.  Cover and cook on low heat setting for 6-8 hours or until potatoes are tender.  Serve with toppings.

Name: Barbecue Short Ribs
Instructions: Place ribs in slow cooker.  Top with onions.  Mix remaining ingredients.  Pour over meat.  Cover with lid.  Cook on low for 6-8 hours (or high for 3-4 hours).  Remove ribs.  Cover to keep warm.  Skim excess fat from sauce.  Return ribs.  Stir gentrly until evenly coated.

Name: Wild Rice Soup
Instructions: Heat oil in 10" skillet over medium heat.  Cook onion in oil about 4 minutes, stirring occasionally until tender.  Place onion, carrots, turkey, rice, tarragon and pepper in 3-1/2 to 6 quart slow cooker.  Pour broth over top.  Cover and cook on low heat setting for 6-8 hours or until rice and vegetables are tender.  Mix milk and flour; stir into soup.  Cover and cook about 20 minutes or until thickened.  Stir in peas during the last 15 minutes of cooking.

Name: Chili
Instructions: Cook beef in 12" skillet over medium heat, stirring occasionally until brown; drain.  Mix beef and remaining ingredients except beans in 3-1/2 to 6 quart slow cooker.  Cover and cook on low heat setting for 6 to 8 hours (or high heat for 3-4 hours) or until onion is tender.  Stir in beans.  Cover and cook on high heat setting for 15-20 minutes or until slightly thickened.

Name: Steak and Potato Soup
Instructions: Remove excess fat from beef.  Cut beef into 1"x1/4" pieces.  Mix beef and remaining ingredients except water and flour in 5 quart slow cooker.  Cover and cook on low heat setting 8-9 hours or until beef and vegetables are tender.  Mix water and flour; gradually stir into soup until blended.  Cover and cook on high heat setting about 30 minutes or until slightly thickened.

Name: Vegetable Beef Soup
Instructions: Combine all ingredients in slow cooker.  Cover.  Cook on high for 3 hours and then on low for 3 to 4 hours.

Name: Pork Chops in Gravy
Instructions: Put chops in slow cooker.  Combine remaining ingredients.  Pour over chops.  Cover.  Cook on high for 3-4 hours or on low for 8-10 hours.

Name: Pot Roast
Instructions: Heat oil in 12" skillet over medium heat.  Cook beef in oil until brown on all sides.  Place potatoes, carrots and onions in 4-6 quart slow cooker.  Place beef on vegetables.  Mix horseradish, salt, pepper and water; pour over beef.  Cover and cook on low heat setting for 8-10 hours or until beef and vegetables are tender.  Remove beef and vegetables to warm platter; keep warm.  Make gravy.

Name: Pork Chops and Gravy
Instructions:
Season pork chops with salt and pepper.  Brown in oil.  Drain.  Transfer to slow cooker.  In spearate bowl, whisk together mushroom soup, onion and evaporated milk until smooth.  Pour over chops.  Cook on high for 3-4 hours or low for 6-8 hours.

Can add 1/2-1 cup sour cream for increased flavor during last 30 minutes of cooking time.

Name: Kraut and Sausage
Instructions: Combine sauerkraut and brown sugar.  Place in slow cooker.  Add enough water to cover half of sausage.  Cover.  Cook on low for 5-6 hours or high for 3 hours.

Name: Easy Teriyaki Chicken
Instructions: Place chicken in slow cooker.  Pour remaining ingredients over chicken.  Cover.  Cook on low for 6-8 hours or high for 4-6 hours.

Name: Easy Barbecue Chicken
Instructions: Place water in bottom of slow cooker.  Add chicken.  Pour barbecue sauce over top.  Cover.  Cook on low 8 hours.

Name: Cherry Delight
Instructions: Place pie filling in greased slow cooker.  Combine dry cake mix and butter (mixture will be crumbly).  Sprinkle over filling.  Cover and cook on low for 4 hours or high for 2 hours.  Allow to cool.  Serve in bowls with ice cream.

Name: Spiced Cider
Instructions: Place cloves in cheese cloth bag or tea ball.  Combine all ingredients in slow cooker.  Cover.  Cook on low 3-4 hours.  Serve hot.

Name: Baked Chicken Nuggets
Instructions: Combine first 5 ingredients in a plastic bag, shake well.  Cut chiken into 1" pieces.  Dip chicken pieces in butter and shake a few at a time in bread crumb mixture.  Place on a lightly greased baking sheet.  Bake at 400° for 20 minutes or until tender.

Name: Tuna Noodle Casserole
Instructions: Place half the noodles in a 2-quart buttered casserole dish.  In a saucepan, combine the tuna, soup and milk.  Heat just enough to mix well.  Pour half of the mixture over noodles.  Repeat layers.  Cover and bake at 300° for 20 minutes.

Name: Smothered Chicken and Grean Bean Skillet
Instructions: Heat large nonstick skillet on medium-high heat.  Add chiken.  Cover.  Cook for 5-7 minutes on each side or until done (165°).  Remove from skillet.  Add beans, soup, 1/2 cup water and thyme to skillet.  Cover.  Cook for 6 minutes, stirring often.  Return chicken to skillet.  Cook 1 minute or until hot.  Top with cheese.

Name: Cheesy Chicken and Rice
Instructions: Stir soup, water, rice, onion powder, pepper and veggies in an 11"x8" (2 quart) shallow baking dish.  Top with chicken.  Season chicken as desired.  Cover.  Bake at 375° for 50 minutes or until chicken and rice are done.  Top with cheese.  Let casserole stand.  Stir rice before serving.

Name: Tuna Melts
Instructions: Assemble tuna melts.  Wrap in foil.  Bake on cookie sheet at 350° for 7 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Name: Almond Chicken Dijon
Instructions: Preheat oven to 375°.  Place chicken in lightly greased 13"x9"x2" baking dish.  Set aside.  Mix mayo and mustard until well blended.  Spread top side of each chicken breast with 1 Tbs. of mixture.  Sprinkle evenly with almonds.  Bake for 20-25 minutes or until chicken is cooked through (165°).

Name: Cheesy Broccoli Rice and Turkey
Instructions: Combine broth, turkey and broccoli in large skillet.  Bring to a boil.  Reduce heat to low.  Cover and simmer for 5 minutes.  Add rice and velveeta.  Cover.  Remove from heat.  Let stand for 5 minutes or until rice is tender and cheese is melted.  Stir.

Name: Parmesan Chicken with Cream Sauce
Instructions: Cook rice as directed using 1-1/4 cup of broth and 1/2 cup water.  Meanwhile, mix cracker curmbs and parmesan cheese on plate.  Rinse chicken with cold water.  Shake off excess water.  Dip chicken in mixture to coat.  Heat oil in large skillet on medium heat.  Add chicken.  Cook 5-6 minutes on each side or until chicken is golden brown and cooked through (165°).  Place chicken on serving plate.  Set aside and keep warm.  Add remaining broth and cream cheese to same skillet.  Cook on medium heat until mixture comes to a boil; stirring constantly.  Simmer 3 minutes or until sauce thickens.  Spoon over chicken and serve with rice and asparagus.

Name: Cheesy Chicken
Instructions: Heat oil in large skillet on medium-high heat.  Add chicken.  Cook 7 minutes, turning 1/2 way through.  Add broccoli, stirr.  Stir in soup and velveeta until well-blended.  Reduce heat to medium.  Simmer for 7 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.  Serve on rice.

Name: Easy Chicken Bake
Instructions: Preheat oven to 400°.  Prepare stuffing as directed.  Set aside.  Mix chicken, soup, sour cream and vegetables in 13"x9"x2" baking dish.  Top with stuffing.  Bake for 30 minutes or until chicken is cooked through.

Name: Cheesy Ham and Rice Bake
Instructions: Preheat oven to 425°.  Mix rice, soup, milk, dressing, ham and peas in 2-quart baking dish; cover with foil.  Bake for 20 minutes.  Uncover and sprinkle with cheese.  Bake, uncovered, for 10 minutes or until rice is tender and cheese is melted.  Stand 5 minutes.

Name: Pumpkin Cupcakes
Instructions: Blend cake mix, pumpkin, eggs, oil and watter in a large mixer bowl until moistened.  Beat on medium speed for 2 minutes.  Pour batter into 24 muffin cups.  Bake at 350° for 16-21 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool in pans for 10 minutes.  Remove to a wire rack to cool completely.  Spread cupcakes with frosting.

Name: Chocolate Peanut Butter Cupcakes
Instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  Prepare cake mix and bake in 24 muffin cups as directed on package.  Cool for 30 minutes only (to be filled, cupcakes must be warm).  Pour milk into medium bowl.  Add dry pudding mix.  Beat with wire whisk for 2 minutes or until well blended.  Add peanut butter.  Beat well.  Spoon into small strong plastic bag.  Seal bag.  Snip off corner.  Pipe about 1 Tbs. of filling.  Microwave cool whip and chocolate in small bowl on high for 1-1/2 minutes or until chocolate is melted, stirring after 1 minute.  Dip the top of each cupcake into glaze.  Sprinkle with peanuts.  Store in fridge.

Name: Applesauce Snack Cakes
Instructions:
Cream butter, gradually add sugar, beating well at medium speed of an electric mixer.  Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.  Stir soda and vanilla into applesauce.  Combine flour and spices.  Add to creamed mixture alternately with applesauce mixture, mixing after each addition.  Cover batter and store in refrigerator up to 2 weeks.

To bake:
Spoon into muffin pans.  Bake at 400° for 17-19 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool on wire racks.

Name: Cheddar Muffins
Instructions: Combine first 5 ingredients in a large bowl.  Make a well in center of mixture.  Combine egg, milk and butter.  Add to dry ingredients, stirring until moistened.  Spoon into greased muffin pans.  Bake at 425° for 20 minutes.  Remove from pans immediately.

Name: Cranberry Delight Muffins
Instructions: Mix first 8 ingredients thoroughly and bake 30 minutes at 350° in well-greased muffin tins. Mix sauce ingredients together.  Bring to a boil and serve over muffins.

Name: Cinnamon Muffins
Instructions: In a bowl, cream shortening and sugar.  Add egg; beat well.  Combine the flour, baking powder, salt and nutmeg; add to creamed mixture alternately with milk and mix well.  Fill greased muffin cups to 1/2 full.  Bake at 350° for 15-20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  In a shallow bowl, combine sugar and cinnamon.  Dip muffin tops in butter, then in cinnamon-sugar mixture.  Serve warm.

Name: All-Bran Muffins (original recipe)
Instructions: Stir together flour, sugar, baking powder and salt.  Set aside.  In a large bowl, combine cereal and milk.  Let stand for 2 minutes.  Add egg and oil.  Beat well.  Add flour mixture until combined.  Add pecans and cranberries.  Put into muffin cups.  Bake at 400° for 20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.

Name: Creamed Corn
Instructions: Heat corn through.  Mix warm corn and other ingredients.  Cook slowly until thickened.  Add pepper.

Name: Spinach and Bacon Pasta
Instructions: Cook noodles as directed.  Drain, reserving 1/2 cup of cooking water.  Meanwhile, heat dressing in a large skillet on medium heat.  Add chiken.  Cook and stir for 5-7 minutes or until cooked through.  Add tomatoes.  Cook 1 minute, stirring occasionally.  Stir in noodles and reserved 1/2 cup cooking water.  Remove from heat.  Add spinach, 1/2 cup of cheese and bacon.  Toss lightly to combine.  Sprinkle with remaining cheese.

Name: Scalloped Potatoes
Instructions: In a small saucepan, melt butter over medium heat.  Stir in flour until smooth.  Gradually add milk.  Bring to a boil.  Cook and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.  Reduce heat.  Add cheese, salt, sauce and pepper.  Cook and stir until cheese is melted.  Place potatoes in greased 1-quart baking dish.  Top with sauce.  Cover and bake at 350° for 25 minutes.  Uncover.  Bake 20 minutes longer or until potatoes are tender.

Name: Broccoli Salad
Instructions: Mix dressing, sugar and vinegar in large bowl.  Add remaining ingredients.  Mix lightly.  Cover.  Refrigerate at least 1 hour before serving.

Name: Corn Souffle
Instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  Microwave butter in medium bowl on high for 30 seconds or until melted.  Add cream cheese, continue microwaving 15 seconds or until cream cheese is softened.  Stir until well-blended.  Add both corns, mix and eggs.  Mix well.  Pour into greased 13"x9"x2" baking pan.  Sprinkle with cheese.  Bake 40 minutes or until golden brown.  Cool slightly.

Name: Dilled Macaroni Salad
Instructions: Cook macaroni.  Drain.  Rinse with cold water.  Drain again.  Add onion, green pepper and carrot.  Toss well.  Combine mayo and remaining ingredients.  Gently stir mixture into macaroni.  Chill for at least 1 hour.

Name: Broccoli-Potato Pancakes
Instructions: In a bowl, combine broccoli and boiling water.  Let stand 5 minutes.  Drain thoroughly.  In another bowl, beat eggs.  Add onions, flour, salt and pepper.  Mix well.  Add broccoli.  Just before cooking, finely shred potato.  Add to broccoli mixture.  In a large skillet, heat about 1/4" of oil over medium-high heat.  Pour batter by 1/2 cupfuls into skillet.  Fry over medium heat for 3-4 minutes on each side or until lightly browned.

Name: Macaroni and Cheese
Instructions: In a medium bowl, combine macaroni, cheese, milk, egg and salt.  Mix well.  Pour into a greased 1-quart shallow baking dish.  Dot with butter.  Bake, uncovered at 350° for 30-35 minutes or until a knife in center comes out clean.

Name: Jello Pastel Cookies
Instructions: Preheat oven to 400°.  Mix flour and baking powder.  Set aside.  Beat butter in large bowl with mixer on medium speed until creamy.  Gradually add sugar and 1 pkg of dry gelatin, beating until light and fluffy.  Add egg and vanilla.  Mix well.  Gradually add flour mixture, beating until well blended after each addition.  Shape dough into 1" balls.  Place cookies 2" apart on ungreased baking sheets.  Flatten with bottom of clean glass.  Sprinkle lightly with remaining dry gelatin.  Bake 8-10 minutes or until edges are lightly browned.  Remove from baking sheets to wire racks.  Cool completely.

Name: Sour Cream Cutouts
Instructions:
Cream butter and sugar.  Beat in eggs.  Add sour cream and vanilla; mix well.  Combine flour, baking powder and soda; add to creamed mixture and mix well.  Chill dough at least 2 hours or overnight.  Roll on a heavily floured board to 1/4" thickness.  Cut with a 3" cutter.  Place on lightly greased cookie sheets.  Bake at 350° for 10-12 minutes.  Cool.

Frosting:
1/3 cup butter, softened
2 cups powdered sugar
2-3 Tbs milk
1-1/2 tsp vanilla
1/4 tsp. salt

Mix until smooth

Name: Cinnamon Sugar Cookies
Instructions: Cream butter.  Gradually add 1 cup sugar, beating well.  Add eggs and lemon rind, beating well.  Combine flour, baking powder, soda and salt.  Stir into creamed mixture.  Chill 2 hours.  Combine 1/4 cup sugar and cinnamon.  Roll dough into 1" balls.  Roll in mixutre.  Place on lightly greased cookie sheets.  Bake at 375° for 8-10 minutes or until lightly browned.  Cool on wire racks.

Name: Drop Sugar Cookies
Instructions: Sift flour, baking powder and salt into a medium bowl and mix well.  Whisk eggs in a large bowl until blended.  Add sugar, oil, vanilla and lemon zest and mix well.  Stir the dry ingredients into egg mixture until blended.  Chill, covered, for 30 minutes or longer.  Preheat oven to 400°.  Drop the cookie dough by rounded teaspoonfuls 2" apart on an ungreased baking sheet.  Mist the bottom of a 3" flat bottom glass with water and dip glass in additional sugar.  Press the top of each cookie lightly with the glass to flatten.  Mist and sugar coat each time.  Bake until light brown (about 8 minutes).  Cool on baking sheet for 2 minutes then remove to wire racks.

Name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
Instructions: Preheat oven to 375°.  Combine flour, bakind soda and salt in small bowl.  Beat butter, sugar, brown sugar and vanilla in large mixer bowl until creamy.  Add eggs, one at a time, beating well after each addition.  Beat in flour mixture.  Stir in chocolate chips.  Drop by rounded Tablespoonfuls onto ungreased baking sheets.  Bake for 9-11 minutes.

Name: Tea Cookies
Instructions:
In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar.  Beat in egg and vanilla.  Gradually add flour.  Roll dough into 1" balls.  Place 2" apart on ungreased baking sheets; flatten slightly with fingers.  Bake at 325° for 17-20 minutes or until edges are golden brown.  Cool for 2 minutes before removing to wire racks to cool completely.  Dust with confectioners' sugar.


***To substitute self-rising flour (for 1 cup); place 1-1/2 tsp. baking powder and 1/2 tsp. salt in a 1-cup measuring cup.  Add flour to measure 1 cup.  For 1/2 cup: 3/4 tsp. baking powder and 1/4 tsp. salt.

Name: Snow Balls
Instructions: Heat oven to 400°.  Mix butter, sugar and vanilla.  Work in flour, salt until dough holds together.  Shape into 1" balls.  Place on ungreased cookie sheet.  Bake 10-12 minutes until set.   While still warm, roll in powdered sugar.

Name: Lemon Cookies
Instructions: Mix together, chill, roll into balls, roll in powdered sugar.  Bake at 350°.  Watch closely and take out before they look done.

Name: Banana Sour Cream Cake
Instructions: Heat oven to 350°.  Beat cake mix, eggs, bananas, sour cream and oil with mixer on low til moistened.  Beat on medium for 2 minutes.  Pour into greased and floured 13"x9"x2" baking pan.  Bake for 35 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool completely in pan on a wire rack.  Beat cream cheese and butter with mixer on medium speed until blended.  Gradually add sugar, beating well as you add.  Remove cake from pan.  Cut cake crosswise in half.  Place 1 cake half, top-side down on a plate.  Spread top with frosting.  Top with remaining half top-side up.  Frost top and sides.  Press nuts into sides.  Refrigerate leftovers.

Name: Pumpkin Spice Frosted Snack Cake
Instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  Grease 13"x9"x2" pan.  Beat cake mix, pumpkin, dressing and eggs in a large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed until blended.  Pour into pan.  Bake 32-35 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool completely in pan on a wire rack.  Beat cream cheese, butter, milk and vanilla in large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed until well-blended.  Gradually add sugar, beating after each addition until well blended.  Spread over cooled cake.  Cut into pieces to serve.  Store leftovers in fridge.

Name: Warm Lemon Cake
Instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  Prepare cake batter as directed on package.  Pour into greased 13"x9"x2" baking dish.  Set aside.  Pour milk and water into large bowl.  Add pudding mixes and sugar.  Beat with wire whisk for 2 minutes or until welll blended.  Pour over batter.  Place baking dish on baking sheet.  Bake 55 minutes to 1 hour or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool for 20 minutes.  Sprinkle with powdered sugar.  Spoon into serving dishes warm.  Store leftovers in fridge.

Name: Lemon Cake Roll
Instructions: In a mixing bowl, beat eggs and sugar until thickened and smooth.  Add water.  Combine flour, baking powder and salt; stir into egg mixture just until moistened.  Line a greased 15"x10"x1" baking pan with waxed paper; grease the paper.  Spread batter evenly in pan.  Bake at 375° for 12-14 minutes or until cake springs back when lightly touched in center.  Cool cake in pan on a wire rack for 5 minutes.  Turn cake out onto a kitchen towl.  Gently peel off the waxed paper.  Beginning with short side, roll up cake, jelly-roll style.  Cool completely on a wire rack.  For filling, in a saucepan, combine sugar, flour, egg, water and lemon juice.  Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil.  Cook and stir for 1 minute longer until thickened.  Remove from the heat; cool to room temperature.  Unroll cake; spread cooled filling to within 1" of edges.  Roll up again.  Cover and chill for 1-2 hours before serving.  Store in the refrigerator.

Name: Tropical Cake
Instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  Drain pineapple, reserving 1 cup of juice.  Set pineapple aside.  Prepare cake batter as directed on package substituting 1 cup reserved juice for 1 cup of water.  Pour batter into greased 15"x10"x1" baking pan.  Bake 15-18 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool completely in pan on wire rack.  Add milk to pudding mix.  Beat with wire whisk 2 minutes or until well-blended.  Stir in pineapple.  Spread over cake, cover with cool whip.  Sprinkle with coconut and pecans.  Store in fridge.

Name: Triple Chocolate Bliss Cake
Instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  Lightly grease 12-cup fluted tube pan or 10" tube pan.  Beat all ingredients except cool whip, chocolate and raspberries in large bowl with electric mixer on low just until moistened.  Beat on medium for 2 minutes scraping bowl.  Pour into pan.  Bake 50 minutes to 1 hour or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool 10 minutes.  Loosen from side of pan with knife and gently remove cake.  Cool completely on wire rack.  Place on serving plate.  Reserve 2 Tbs. Cool Whip.  Microwave remaining cool whip and chocolate on high 1-1/2 to 2 minutes to melt.  Stir each minute.  Drizzle over cake.  Create stares with cool whip.  Spoon raspberries into center of cake.

Name: Apple Cake
Instructions:
In a mixing bowl, cream butter and sugar.  Beat in egg and vanilla.  Combine the flour, baking soda, cinnamon, salt and nutmeg; gradually add to creamed mixture.  Stir in apples.  Pour into a greased 8" square baking dish.  Bake at 350° for 40-45 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.

Meanwhile, in a saucepan, melt butter.  Stir in sugars and cream.  Bring to a boil over medium heat, stirring constantly.  Reduce heat.  Simmer, uncovered, for 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Serve over warm cake.

Name: Pineapple Cake
Instructions: Grease and lightly flour two 9"x1-1/2" round cake pans or grease one 13"x9"x2" baking dish.  Set aside.  In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, sugar and baking soda.  Add pineapple, oil, eggs and vanilla.  Beat with an electric mixer till combined.  Pour batter into pans.  Bake at 350° for 25-30 minutes (round) or 35-40 minutes (13"x9") or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool on racks for 10 minutes.  Remove from pan and cool completely (if in round pans).  Prepare frosting.  Frost.  Store covered in fridge.

Name: Lemon Sheet Cake
Instructions:
In a large mixing bowl, beat the cake mix and eggs until well-blended.  Fold in pie filling.  Spread into a greased 15"x10"x1" baking pan.  Bake at 350° for 18-20 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool on a wire rack.

In a small bowl, beat cream cheese, butter and confectioners' sugar until smooth.  Stir in vanilla.  Spread over cake.  Store leftovers in fridge.

Name: Cream Cheese Pound Cake
Instructions: Beat butter and cream cheese at medium speed with an electric mixer until creamy.  Gradually add sugar, beating well.  Add eggs, one at a time, beating until combined.  Combine flour and salt; gradually add to butter mixture, beating at low speed just until blended after each addition.  Stir in vanilla.  Pour batter into a greased and floured 10" bundt pan.  Bake at 300° for 1 hour and 40 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool in pan on a wire rack for 10-15 minutes.  Remove from pan and let cool completely on wire rack.

Name: Miracle Cake
Instructions: In a mixing bowl, combine all ingredients.  Blend on low speed then beat on medium for 2 minutes.  Pour batter into a greased and floured 9"x13"x2" baking dish.  Bake at temperature on cake mix box for 30-35 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Mix milk, lemon juice and cool whip well.  Spread frosting on cake after it is cooled.  Refrigerate.

Name: Lemon Cake
Instructions:
Beat first four ingredients for 2 minutes.  Add oil, beat one minute.  Bake in greased and floured bundt cake pan for 45 minutes at 325° or until a toothpick comes out clean.  

While hot, pour mix of lemon juic and powdered sugar.  Let cool for 15-20 minutes.

Name: Carrot Cake
Instructions:
Sift together flour, salt, soda and cinnamon.  Add oil.  Add eggs one at a time.  Mix well after each addition.  Add carrots and mix.  Bake in 3 greased and floured 8" or 9" layer pans (or 1-13"x9"x2" pan) at 350° for 30 minutes.

Combine frosting ingredients and frost cake.

Name: Strawberry Pie
Instructions:
Stir boiling water into jellow in large bowl and stir for at least 2 minutes until completely dissolved.  Mix cold water and ice to make 1 cup.  Add to gelatin, stirring until slightly thickened.  Remove any remaining ice.  Stir in cool whip with wire whisk until smooth.  Mix in strawberries.  Refrigerate for 15-20 minutes or until mixture is very thick and will mound.  Spoon into crust.  Refrigerate at least 4 hours or overnight.  Garnish with strawberries if desired

Substitute: Can use raspberry jello and fresh raspberries

Name: Chocolate Oatmeal Cake
Instructions: Mix oats and water.  Let cool.  Cream shortening with sugar and eggs.  Add dry ingredients and oatmeal.  Pour into a 13"x9"x2" baking pan.  Bake at 350° for 35 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.

Name: Birthday Butter Frosting
Instructions: Cream butter and sugar together.  Stir in salt and vanilla.  Beat in corn syrup.  Add enough milk to make a good spreading consistency.

Name: Herb Bread
Instructions: Combine butter and herbs.  Spread on bread.  Wrap bread in foil.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.

Name: Chocolate Chip Cookies
Instructions: Preheat oven to 375°.  Mix shortening, butter, sugar (both), eggs and vanilla in blender (yes....a blender).  Mix in soda and salt.  Slowly mix in the flour gradually.  Drop by rounded spoonful onto foil covered pans.  Cook for 5 minute periods checking periodically to make sure they do not burn.  Cool for 10 minutes.

Name: Drop Biscuits (Rolled Biscuits)
Instructions: Heat oven to 450°.  Grease a baking sheet.  Stir together flour, baking powder and salt in a bowl.  Cut in shortening into flour mixture- should be crumbly.  Stir milk in with a fork.  Stir just until mixture holds together and forms a ball.  Drop by spoonful onto baking sheet.  Leave 2" between each one.  Bake for 10-12 minutes or until golden brown.  For rolled biscuits, knead dough 20 times to smooth dough, then roll and cut.

Name: Hot Cross Buns
Instructions:
In a mixing bowl, dissolve yeast in water.  Add milk, sugar, butter, vanilla, salt, nutmeg and 3 cups flour.  Beat until smooth.  Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition.  Stir in currants, raisins and enough remaining flour to form a soft dough.  Turn onto a floured board; knead until smooth and elastic (6-8 minutes). Place in a greased bowl; turn once to grease top.  Cover and let rise in a warm place until doubled (about 1 hour).  Punch dough down.  Shape into 30 balls.

Place on greased baking sheets.  Cut a cross on top of each roll with a sharp knife.  Cover and let rise until doubled, about 30 minutes.  Beat water and egg yolk.  Brush over rolls.  Bake at 375° for 12-15 minutes.  Cool on wire racks.

For icing, combine sugar, milk and vanilla until smooth.  Drizzle over rolls.

Name: Two-Cheese Linguine
Instructions: Cook linguine according to package directions. Meanwhile, in a skillet over low heat, melt butter.  Stir in flour, salt and pepper until smooth.  Gradually stir in milk.  Bring to a boil; boil and stir for 2 minutes or until thickened.  Remove from the heat.  Combine cheeses; toss with lemon juice.  Add to the sauce; stir until cheese begins to melt.  Drain linguine; add the cheese sauce and toss to coat.

Name: Scalloped Potatoes with Ham
Instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  Butter a baking dish.  In a saucepan, melt 2 Tbs. butter over medium-high heat.  Stir in flour and cook for 1 minute.  Remove saucepan from heat and whisk in milk.  Return pan to heat and bring to a simmer while stirring.  When sauce has thickened, remove from heat.  Season with salt and pepper and set aside.  In a skillet, cook onions in melted butter until golden brown.  Season with salt and pepper.  Spread 1/3 of white sauce in bottom of bakiing dish and top with half of potatoes.  Spread half of onions, ham and cheese.  Add another third of sauce.  Season with salt and pepper.  Continue layering ingredients ending with remaining cheese on top.  Bake for 45 minutes or until golden and bubbly.

Name: Carmel Pops
Instructions: Place corn pops in a large bowl.  Combine butter, brown sugar and karo syrup in a saucepan on the stove.  Bring to a boil and boil for 4-5 minutes without stirring.  Add milk and boil for additional 2 minutes while stirring.  Pour over corn pops.  Let cool.  Store in an airtight container

Name: Biscuit Mix
Description: Use to make biscuits, muffins, pancakes or waffles.
Instructions:
Mix flour, baking powder, salt, cream of tartar, baking soda, nonfat milk and shortening together in a large bowl.  Cut in shortening until crumbly.  Put in air-tight container and stor either in refrigerator or at room temperature.  Use in 3 months.

Biscuits: 2 cups mix plus 1/2 cup water.  Bake at 450° for 8-10 minutes

Muffins: 2 cups mix plus 2 Tbs. sugar, 1 beaten egg and 2/3 cup milk.  Bake at 400° for 15 minutes.

Pancakes: 2 cups mix plus 1 beaten egg and 1-1/3 cup milk

Waffles: 2 cups mix plus 1 beaten egg, 2 Tbs. oil and 1-1/3 cup milk.

Name: Broccoli and Cheese Casserole
Instructions:
Stir soup, milk, mustard, broccoli and cheese in a 1-1/2 quart casserole dish.  Mix the bread crumbs with butter and sprinkle over broccoli mixture.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes or until hot.

Could use 2 cups cooked rice in broccoli mixture.

Name: Chicken and Rice Dinner
Instructions: Heat oil in skillet.  Cook chicken for 10 minutes or until browned.  Remove chicken.  Add soup, water, paprika and pepper.  Heat to a boil.  Stir in rice and broccoli.  Return chicken to pan.  Sprinkle additional paprika and pepper over chicken.  Cover and cook on low for 5 minutes or until chicken is done.

Name: Cheesy Chicken and Rice Casserole
Instructions:
Heat oven to 375°.  Stir soup, water, rice, onion powder, pepper and vegetables in a 2-quart shallow baking dish.  Top with chicken.  Season chicken as desired.  Cover baking dish.  Bake for 50 minutes or until chicken is cooked through and rice is tender.  Top with cheese.  Let casserole stand for 10 minutes.  Stir rice before serving.

Try it Alfredo: substitute broccoli for vegetables, 1/4 cup grated Parmesan for cheddar.  Add 2 Tbs. Parmesan to soup and sprinkle chicken with Parmesan.

Mexican: Replace onion powder and pepper with 1 tsp. chili powder and cheddar cheese with Mexican blend.

Italian: Replace onion powder and pepper with 1 tsp. Italian seasoning (crushed) and cheddar with 1/3 cup shredded Parmesan.

Name: Chicken and Noodle Casserole
Instructions: Stir soup, milk, peas, chicken and noodles in 1-1/2 quart casserole dish.  Bake at 400° for 20 minutes.  Stir.  Mix bread crumbs and butter.  Sprinkle on top.  Bake for 5 minutes more.

Name: Chicken and Stuffin Skillet
Instructions:
Heat butter in a 10" skillet over medium-high heat.  Add the chicken and cook for 15 minutes or until its well-browned on both sides and cooked through.  Remove the chicken from the skillet.  Prepare the stuffing in the skillet according to package directions except let stand for 2 minutes.

Return the chicken to the skillet.  Stir the soup and milk in a small bowl.  Pour the soup mixture over the chicken.  Sprinkle with the cheese.  Cover and cook over medium heat until the mixture is hot and the cheese is melted.

Name: Chicken Noodle Casserole
Instructions: In a large saucepan, mix soup, milk, pepper, cheese, chicken and noodles.  Over medium heat, heat through, stirring occasionally.

Name: Chicken Quesadillas
Instructions: Preheat oven to 425°.  Mix soup, chili powder, cheese and chicken.  Spread about 1/4 cup soup mixture on half of each tortilla to within 1/2" of edge.  Moisten edge with water.  Fold over and seal.  Place on 2 baking sheets.  Bake 10 minutes or until hot.

Name: Herbed Chicken
Instructions: Place chicken in slow cooker.  Combine remaining ingredients in a bowl.  Pour over chicken.  Cover and cook on high for 1 hour, then on low for 3 hours.

Name: Chicken with Rosemary
Instructions: Place chicken in slow cooker.  Combine vinegar and next 5 ingredients in a bowl.  Pour over chicken.  Cover and cook on high for 3 hours or cook on high 1 hour and then low for 3-1/2 hours.  Stir in rosemary and tomato just before serving.

Name: Chocolate Drops
Instructions: Heat oven to 350°.  Microwave unsweetened chocolate and butter in large microwaveable bowl on high for 2 minutes or until butter is melted.  Stir until chocolate is completely melted.  Add sugar; mix well.  Blend in eggs and vanilla.  Stir in flour (do not overmix).  Refrigerate 1 hour or until dough is easy to handle.  Shape into 1" balls; place 2" apart on lightly greased baking sheets.  Bake for 8 minutes or just until set (do not overbake).  Let stand on baking sheet for 1 minute and transfer to wire racks.  Cool completely.  Microwave cool whip and semi-sweet choclate in bowl on high for 1-1/2 minutes or until choclate is completely melted, stirring after 1 minute.  Let stand for 15 minutes to thicken.  Spread over cookies.  Let stand until firm.

Name: French Onion Soup
Instructions: Heat butter in skillet over medium heat.  Add onion; saute until crisp-tender.  Transfer to slow cooker.  Add beef broth, water and bouillon powder.  Mix well.  Add Worcestershire sauce and bay leaves.  Cover and cook on low for 5-7 hours or until onions are tender.  Discard bay leaves.  Ladle into bowls.  Top each with a slice of bread.

Name: Mexican Corn Bread
Instructions: Brown beef in non-stick skillet.  Drain well.  While meat is browning, combine corn, cornmeal, salt, baking soda, oil, milk eggs and taco sauce in a bowl.  Pour half of mixture into slow cooker.  Layer cheese, onion, garlic, green chilies and ground beef on top of cornmeal mixture.  Cover with remaining cornmeal mixture.  Cover and cook on high for 1 hour and then on low for 4-1/2 to 4 hours or cook on low for 6 hours.

Name: Slow-Cooker Lasagna
Instructions: Combine ground beef and spaghetti sauce in a bowl.  Combine cottage cheese and egg in a bowl.  Layer half each of the ground beef mixture, the uncooked noodles, the cottage cheese mixture and the mozzarella cheese in slow cooker.  Repeat layers.  Cover and cook on high for 4-5 hours or low for 6-8 hours.

Name: Cheesy Potatoes and Ham
Instructions: Layer one-third each of potatoes, ham and cheese in slow cooker.  Repeat layers twice.  Combine soup and milk in a bowl.  Pour over ingredients in slow cooker.  Cover and cook on high for 1 hour and then on low for 3 hours or just until potatoes are soft.

Name: Ham and Cheese Soup
Instructions: Combine all ingredients except cheese and broccoli in slow cooker.  Cook lon low for 6-8 hours.  Add cheese and broccoli.  Stir well.  Cook 15 minutes more or until cheese is melted and broccoli is warm.

Name: Tater Tot Casserole
Instructions: Brown ground beef and onion in a non-stick skillet until crumbly.  Drain.  Place beef and onion in slow cooker.  Top with soup and then tater tots.  Cover and cook on low for 2 to 3 hours.  Sprinkle with cheese and continue to cook on low for 15 minutes or until cheese is melted.

Name: Breakfast Casserole
Instructions: Combine all ingredients except mozzarella cheese in a large bowl.  Pour into greased slow cooker.  Sprinkle mozzarella cheese over top.  Cover and cook on high for 2 hours and low for 1 hour.

Name: Applesauce
Instructions: Combine all ingredients in slow cooker.  Cover and cook on low for 8-10 hours.

Name: Snack Mix
Instructions: Combine first 2 ingredeitns in slow cooker.  Combine butter and remaining ingredients in a bowl.  Pour over dry mixture.  Toss until well mixed.  Cover and cook on low for 2 hours, stirring every 30 minutes.

Name: Cheesy Chicken Casserole
Instructions: Stir together first 4 ingredients and 1-1/2 cups cheese in a large bowl; spoon into lightly greased slow cooker.  Cover and cook on low for 2 hours.  Combine remaining cheese and cracker crumbs.  Sprinkle over casserole.  Cover and cook on low for 30 minutes more.  Let stand 5 minutes before serving.

Name: Macaroni and Cheese
Instructions: Cook macaroni with salt according to package directions.  In slow cooker, combine lightly cooked macaroni, evaporated milk, half and half, melted butter, eggs, 1 cup cheddar cheese and pepper.  Top with remaining cheddar and Parmesan cheese.  Cover and cook on low for 2-1/2 hours.

Name: Fruit Crisp
Instructions: Place fruit in slow cooker.  Combine sugar, water and cornstarch in a bowl.  Pour over fruit.  In a separate bowl, combine remaining ingredients until crumbly.  Sprinkle over top.  Cover and cook on low for 3 hours.  Top with ice cream if desired.

Name: Hot Caramel Dip
Instructions: Mix together all ingredients in saucepan.  Bring to a boil.  Pour into slow cooker.  Turn heat to warm setting to serve.  Serve over pound cake or with fresh apples.

Name: Peaches and Cream Tapioca
Instructions: Stir together first 7 ingredients in slow cooker.  Cover and cook on low for 4 hours.  Stir well.  Spoon into dessert dishes and top evely with granola.

Name: Chocolate Peanut Butter Cake
Instructions: Combine first 5 ingredients in a mixing bowl.  Beat 2 minutes with an electric mixer.  Pour into greased and floured 3-lb. shortening can.  Place in slow cooker.  Cover top of can with 8 paper towels.  Cover cooker and cook on high for 3 hours.  Allow to cool for 10 minutes.  Run knife around edge and invert cake onto serving plate.  Cool completely before slicing and serving.  Top with ice cream and chopped peanut butter cups if desired.

Name: Chocolate Rice Pudding
Instructions: Combine first 6 ingredients in greased slow cooker.  Cover and cook on low for 2-1/2 to 3-1/2 hours or until liquid is absorbed.  Serve warm or chilled.  Top individual servings with whipped cream and toasted almonds.

Name: Haystacks
Instructions: Turn slow cooker to high.  Place morsels in slow cooker.  Stir every few minutes until melted.  When morsels are completely melted, gently stir in almonds and noodles.  When well mixed, drop by teaspoonfuls onto waxed paper.  Let stand until haystacks are set or speed up by placing them in fridge.  Serve immediately or store in covered container, placing waxed paper between layers.  Keep in cool, dry place.

Name: Chicken and Noodle Casserole
Instructions:
Stir the soup, milk, pepper, vegetables, chicken, noodles and parmesan cheese in a 1j-1/2 quart casserole dish.  Bake at 400° for 25 minutes or until the vegetables are tender.  Stir the chicken mixture.  Top with cheddar cheese.

Options:  Replace 1/2 cup cheddar cheese with crushed french fried onions

Name: Chicken Casserole
Instructions: Preheat oven to 400°.  Mix soup, milk, mozzarella cheese, garlic powder and pepper in 2-qt. baking dish.  Stir in pasta, chicken and peas and carrots.  Bake for 20 minutes.  Stir.  Mix stuffing, Parmesan cheese and butter.  Sprinkle on top.  Bake 5 minutes or until hot.

Name: Tuna Noodle Casserole
Instructions: Mix soup, milk, pimiento, peas, tuna and noodles in 1-1/2 quart casserole.  Bake at 400° for 20 minutes or until hot.  Stir.  Mix bread crumbs with butter and sprinkle on top.  Bake for 5 minutes.

Name: Oatmeal Cookies
Instructions: Heat oven to 375°.  Lightly grease a baking sheet.  Stir together the first five items.  Add brown sugar and oats.  Mix in rest of ingredients.  Drop dough by teaspoonful about 2" apart on sheet.  Bake about 10 minutes.  Cool on wire rack.

Name: Mississippi Mud Cake
Instructions: Mix first 3 ingredeints.  Blend eggs, sugar and melted butter and add to dry ingredients.  Add coconut and/or nuts and vanilla.  Bake at 350° for 25-30 minutes.  Cover with miniature marshmallows and return to oven for five minutes.  Cool and spread on icing.  For icing, mix cocoa, butter and milk.  Cook till butter melts but do not boil.  Remove from heat and add sugar and vanilla.  Pour on cake.

Name: Boston Braised Pork Ribs
Instructions: Toss ribs in olive oil to coat.  Heat a grill pan to hot.  Grill ribs on hot grill pan to sear and impart grill marks.  Combine remaining ingredients in a large pot and heat to a high simmer.  Place seared ribs into pot.  Cover and allow liquid to come to a boil.  Remove cover and reduce heat to a simmer.  Cook until ribs are tender, 45 minutes to 1 hour.  When ribs are tender, remove to a baking sheet and keep warm until service.  While ribs are cooking, prepare barbecue sauce.

Name: Boston Barbecue Sauce
Instructions: Saute onion in butter until brown.  Add remaining ingredients and simmer for 15-20 minutes.  Taste and adjust seasoning to your liking.

Name: Minnesota Wild Rice Slaw
Instructions: Prepare wild rice according to package directions.  Core cabbage and cut into thinnest shreds possible.  Peel and grate carrots.  Core apple and dice.  Toss together the cabbage, carrots, wild rice and apple.  Whisk together dressing ingredients.  Taste and adjust seasonings as needed.  Dress salad and allow to sit, refrigerated, for 1 hour.

Name: Flour Tortillas
Instructions: Mix dry ingredients together.  Add shortening and water.  Use fork or hands to mix in shortening.  Knead several minutes.  Form 12 small balls.  Let rest for 10 minutes.  Heat pan at medium-high heat and lightly coat with cooking spray.  Roll out balls.  Cook for a few seconds.

Name: Oven Caramel Corn
Instructions:
Heat oven to 200°.  Place popcorn in very large roasting pan, very large bowl or divide popcorn between 2 ungreased rectangular pans (13"x9"x2" pans).  Heat brown sugar, butter, corn syrup and salt in 2-quart saucepan over medium heat, stirring occasionally, until bubbly around edges.  Continue cooking for 5 minutes without stirring; remove from heat.  Stir in baking soda until foamy.

Pour sugar mixture over popcorn; toss until evely coated.  If using bowl, transfer mixture to 2 ungreased 13"x9"x2" pans.  Bake for 1 hour, stirring every 15 minutes.  Spread on aluminum foil or cooking parchment paper.  Cool completely, about 30 minutes.  Store tightly covered.

Name: Cinnamon-Sugared Nuts
Instructions:
Heat oven to 300°.  Mix egg white and nuts in medium bowl until nuts are coated and sticky.  Mix remaining ingredients; sprinkle over nuts.  Stir until nuts are completely coated.  Spread nuts in single layer in ungreased jelly roll pan (15.5"x10.5"x1").  

Bake, uncovered, for around 30 minutes or until toasted.  Cool completely or serve slightly warm.  Store in airtight container at room temperature up to 3 weeks.

Name: Lemonade
Instructions: Mix water, lemon juice and sugar until sugar is dissolved.  Serve over ice.  Garnish with lemon or orange slices if desired.

Name: Bran Muffins
Instructions:
Heat oven to 400°.  Mix cereal, milk, raisins and vanilla in medium bowl.  Let stand about 5 minutes or until cereal has softened.  Beat in oil and egg with fork.  Mix remaining ingredients; stir into cereal mixture just until moistened.  Divide batter evenly among muffin cups.  

Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Let stand 5 minutes, then remove to wire rack.  Serve warm if desired.

Name: Chocolate Chip Muffins
Instructions:
Heat oven to 400°.  Beat milk, butter and egg in large bowl with fork or wire whisk.  Stir in remaining ingredients just unitl flour is moistened.  Divide batter evenly among muffin cups (about 2/3 full).  

Bake for 18-20 minutes or until golden brown.  Let stand for 5 minutes in pan then remove to wire rack.  Serve warm if desired.

Name: Blueberry Muffins
Instructions:
Heat oven to 400°.  Make Struesel Topping and set askide.  Beat milk, oil and egg in large bowl with fork or wire whisk.  Stir in flour, sugar, baking powder and salt all at once just until flour is moistened (batter will be lumpy).  Fold in blueberries.  Divide batter evenlyamong muffin cups.  Sprinkle each with about 1 Tbs. topping.

Bake for 20-25 minutes or until golden brown.  Let stand for 5 minutes then remove to wire rack.  Serve warm if desired.

For Apple-Cinnamon: Omit blueberries.  Beat in 1 cup chopped peeled apple with the milk.  Stir in 1/2 tsp. ground cinnamon with flour.  Bake 25-30 minutes.

Banana Muffins: Omit blueberries.  Decrease milk to 1/3 cup.  Beat in 1 cup mashed very rip bananas with the milk.  Use packed brown sugar for the sugar.

Name: Struesel Topping
Instructions: Mix flour, brown sugar and cinnamon in medium bowl.  Cut in butter, using pastry blender or crisscrossing 2 knives, until crumbly.

Name: Zucchini Bread
Instructions:
Move oven rack to low position so that tops of pans will be in center of oven.  Heat oven to 350°.  Grease bottoms only of 2 loaf pans, 8.5"x4.5"x2.5" or 1 loaf pan, 9"x5"x3".  Mix zucchini, sugar, oil, vanilla and eggs in large bowl.  Stir in remaining ingredients except nuts and raisins.  Stir in nuts and raisins.  Divid batter evenly between pans.

Bake 8" loaves for 50-60 minutes, 9" loaf for 1 hour 10 minutes or or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool for 10 minutes in pans on wire rack.  Loosen sides of loaves from pans; remove from pans and place top side up on wire rack.  Cool completely, about 2 hours, before slicing.  Wrap tightly and store at room temperature for up to 4 days or refrigerate up to 10 days.

Cranberry Bread:  Omit zucchini, cinnamon, cloves and raisins.  Stir in 1/2 cup milk and 2 tsp grated orange peel with the oil.  Stir 3 cups fresh or frozen (thawed and drained) cranberries into batter.  Bake 1 hour to 1 hour 10 minutes.

Pumpkin Bread: Substitute 1 can (15 oz) pumpkin for zucchini

Name: Banana Bread
Instructions:
Move oven rack to low position so that tops of pans will be in center of oven.  Heat oven to 350°.  Grease bottoms only of 2 loaf pans (8.5"x4.5"x2.5") or 1 loaf pan (9"x5"x3").  Mix sugar and butter in large bowl.  Stir in eggs until well blended.  Stir in bananas, buttermilk and vanilla; beat until smooth.  Stir in flour, baking soda and salt just until moistened.  Stir in nuts.  Divide batter evenly between pans. 

Bake 8" loaves about 1 hour, 9" loaf about 1 hour 15 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool 10 minutes in pans on wire rack.  Loosen sides of loaves from pans; remove from pans and place top side up on wire rack.  Cool completely, about 2 hours, before slicing.  Wrap tightly and store at room temperature up to 4 days or refrigerate up to 10 days.

Name: Sour Cream Coffee Cake
Description: Uses Brown Sugar Filling and Vanilla Glaze
Instructions:
Heat oven to 350°.  Grease bottom and side of angel food cake pan (tube pan), 10"x4" , 12-cup bundt cake pan or 2 loaf pans (9"x5"x3").  Make Brown Sugar Filling; set aside.  Mix flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt; set aside.  Beat sugar, butter, vanilla and eggs in large bowl with electric mixer on medium speed 2 minutes, scraping bowl occasionally.  Beat about 1/4 of the flour mixture and sour cream at a time alternately into sugar mixture on low speed until blended. 

For angel food or bundt cake pan, spread 1/3 of batter (about 2 cups) in pan, then sprinkle with one-third of filling; repeat twice.  For loaf pans, spread 1/4 of the batter in each pan then sprinkle each with 1/4 of the filling; repeat once.

Bake angel food or bundt cake pan about 1 hour, loaf pans about 45 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool for 10 minutes in pan on wire rack.  Remove from pan to wire rack.  Cool 20 minutes.  Drizzle with Vanilla Glaze.  Serve warm or cool.

Name: Brown Sugar Filling
Description: Goes with Sour Cream Coffee Cake
Instructions: Mix all ingredients

Name: Vanilla Glaze
Description: Use with Sour Cream Coffee Cake
Instructions: Mix all ingredients until smooth and thin enough to drizzle.

Name: Danish Puff
Instructions:
Heat oven to 350°.  Place 1 cup of the flour in small bowl.  Cut in 1/2 cup butter, using pastry blender or 2 knives until mixture looks like small peas.
