When brown bits start to stick to bottom of skillet, add broth, vinegar, carrots, peas and onions.  Simmer, covered, 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Meanwhile, cook noodles in boiling salted water according to package directions.  Drain, rinse briefly and set aside covering to keep warm.  When beef is cooked through and carrots are tender, stir in parsley and season with salt.  Serve beef mixture over warm noodles.

Name: Beef Stroganoff
Instructions:
Cook egg noodles in boiling salted water according to package directions.  Drain and keep warm.  Meanwhile, in a large skillet over meidum heat, brown ground beef.  Drain leaving just a Tbs or so fat to cook mushrooms.  If you're using mushrooms, add them to skillet and cook 1 to 2 minutes.  Remove them to the bowl with beef. 

Again, in same skillet, melt butter over medium-high heat.  Add garlic and cook, stirring, 1 minute.  Add flour.  Whisk well to break up any clumps.  Slowly add milk, whisking and heat until bubbly and sauce starts to thicken.  Add ketchup, cream cheese and sour cream.  Whisk until smooth and heated through.  Return beef and mushrooms and skillet.  Add drained pasta and stir until well combined.  Season with salt and pepper and serve.

Name: Summer Spaghettini
Instructions: Cook pasta in boiling salted water according to package directions.  Drain, reserving cooking water; keep warm.  Meanwhile, heat olive oil in a medium-size skillet over medium heat until hot.  Add green onions, tomatoes and garlic and cook until heated through, 2 to 4 minutes.  Add basil and season with salt and pepper.  Add 1/2 cup reserved cooking water to veggies.  Add both cheese, stir to combine and remove from heat.  Serve immediately over warm pasta.

Name: Macaroni and Cheese
Instructions: Cook macaroni in boiling salted water according to package directions.  Drain and keep warm.  Meanwhile, in a large saucepan, melt butter over medium heat.  Add flour and mix with a wire whisk until smooth.  Add milk, whisking as you pour it in to smoothly incorporate it into flour mixture.  Heat until mixture thickens, stirring frequently.  Add mustard, garlic powder, salt and pepper to white sauce.  Let simmer over medium heat, stirring frequently.  Gradually add Cheddar, cream cheese and 1/2 cup Parmesan.  The sauce is done when cheeses are well combined, smooth and melted.  Add macaroni to sauce and stir until well blended with sauce.  Sprinkle with a little more Parmesan and a bit of paprika for color, if using.

Name: Chicken Noodle Soup
Instructions: Bring water to a boil in a soup ot.  While water comes to a boil, heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat until hot.  Saute chicken until browned on all sides and cooked through.  Once water comes to a boil, add sauteed chicken, carrot, cabbage, garlic and ginger to pot.  Cook 2 minutes, then add ramen noodles along with only 2 of the flavor packets that come with the noodles.  Cook 3 minutes and not a second longer-ramen is best when not cooked too long.  Taste, than add soy sauce if you like.

Name: Chicken-Barley Stew
Instructions: Bring broth to a boil in a soup pot.  When broth is boiling, add all ingredients to the pot, except parsley.  Return broth to a boil, then partially cover pot and reduce heat to medium-low.  Let stew simmer1 hour, stirring occasionally.  Ladle stew into individual bowls.  Garnish each with a sprinkling of parsley before serving.

Name: Ethiopian Chicken Stew
Instructions:
Hard-boil eggs; drain, let cool and peel.  Meanwhile, combine water and lemon juice in a large bowl.  Add chicken to bowl and let soak 10 minutes.  Remove chicken from water and let drain.  Cut into bite-size pieces.  Heat oil in a large heavy skillet over medium-high heat until hot.  Add chicken and cook until it is opaque.  Remove chicken to a plate.

Add onions to skillet.  Over medium heat, cook, stirring frequently, until liquid steams off and onions start to look dry and get some browned bits.  Add butter.  Continue to cook over meidum heat, stirring and watching carefully, 7 to 10 minutes or until onions are well browned.

Add ginger, paprika, cayenne, pepper and tumeric.  Add chicken, tomatoes and water.  Stir well.  Cover and simmer over medium-low heat, stirring every 10 minutes for a half an hour.  Five minutes before serving, set whole, peeled, hard boiled eggs on top of the stew, one for each person.  This stew can be served with pita bread, tortillas or over hot rice.

Name: Beef Dumpling Stew
Instructions:
In a soup pot, bring broth and tomatoes to a simmer.  When broth is simmering, add potatoes and continue to simmer.  Heat a large skillet over high heat until hot.  Add beef and brown.  Be careful not to overstir it.  Once meat is browned, remove from pan.  Drain off all but 1 Tbs. rendered fat.  Add olive oil to the same skillet then add carrots, onion and garlic and cook over medium heat, stirring a few times, until onion is translucent.  Sprinkle vegetables with flour and paprika.  Stir until combined.  Add beef and cooked vegetables to simmering broth.  Add milk and corn and season with salt and pepper.  Bring to a simmer and cook 10 minutes or so, while you mix batter for dumplings.

To make dumplings, combine flour, baking powder, paprika and salt in a large bowl.  Warm milk and butter together in microwave until butter is just melted.  Pour milk mixture over flour mixture and stir together until just barely combined.  Spoon dumpling mixture on top of simmering soup by heaping tablespoonfuls.  Dumplings will sink down into stew at first, but float back to surface as they cook.  Once dumplings have bobbed back to top, take a pinch of paprika and sprinkle across the tops of the dumplings for a touch of extra color.  Cover with a lid and let dumplings simmer over medium-low heat 7 to 8 minutes.  When dumplings are fluffy and biscuit-like in the middle, they are done.  Serve.

Name: Cheesy Corn and Potato Chowder
Instructions:
Cook bacon in a soup pot until nicely browned.  Using a fork or slotted spoon, remove bacon bits from skillet, leaving drippings in pan.  Add onion, celery, garlic, thyme, parsley, salt and pepper; cook, stirring frequently, 2 to 3 minutes.  Sprinkle flour into pan; stir well.  Gradually whisk in broth.  Stir in potatoes; cook 15 minutes over medium to low heat, stirring occasionally.  Add corn and milk; simmer 10 more minutes.  Add cheese and stir until cheese is melted.  Ladle into individual bowls and serve topped with crumbled bacon.

Clam Chowder: omit corn, substitute half of milk with heavy cream, add 1 cup canned chopped clams.

Name: Tuna Cheddar Chowder
Instructions:
Melt butter in a soup pot over medium heat.  Add carrots, onion and garlic; cook, stirring, until carrots begin to soften, 4 to 6 minutes.  Add flour and celery seeds and whisk well.  Add broth, whisking well until clumps of flour dissolve, then bring to a boil over high heat. 

When soup is boiling, add egg noodles, tuna and peas.  When soup comes to a boil again, reduce heat to medium and cook 6 to 7 minutes, stirring often.  Add milk and bring to a gentle simmer.  Sprinkle with cheese, stirring well.  Season with salt and pepper and serve immediately.

Name: Salmon Chowder
Instructions: Melt butter in a soup pot over medium heat and cook onion, celery and bell pepper, stirring.  Add garlic after vegetables start to get soft, 3 to 5 minutes, and cook 1 minute.  Add flour and stir until it is evenly dispersed.  Add potato, carrots, broth, dill, salt and black pepper.  Stir and bring to a boil over high heat.  Reduce heat to medium-low and simmer until potatoes are fork tender, about 20 minutes.  Add milk, corn and salmon.  Heat 5 minutes.  Ladle into bowls and serve with a little grated cheese on top.

Name: Ethiopian-Style Home Fries
Instructions: Preheat oven to 500°.  Coat a large baking sheet with nonstick cooking spray.  Slice potatoes thickly, french-fry style.  In a plastic bag, toss potatoes with oil, berbere and salt.  Spread fries over baking sheet in a single layer.  Bake until browned and tender, 10 to 15 minutes.  Serve with lots of ketchup.

Name: Oven-Baked Breaded Zucchini
Instructions: Preheat oven to 475°.  Grease a large baking sheet.  Peel zucchini; cut in half lengthwise.  Cut each half into 8 lengthwise strips.  Combine cracker crumbs and cheese on a plate.  Pour dressing in a large shallow dish.  Dip each zucchini strip into dressing, then dredge in crumbs.  Place on prepared baking sheet.  Bake 5 minutes, then turn strips over and bake until crumbs are lightly browned, about 5 minutes more.

Name: Buttery Garlic-Cheese Biscuits
Instructions: Preheat oven to 375°.  Grease a 12-cup muffin tin.  In a large bowl, mix together flour, sugar, baking powder and salt.  Add milk and cheese; stir just until combined.  Divide batter among 12 muffin cups.  Mix together melted butter and garlic; drizzle over biscuits.  Bake until golden brown, about 15 minutes.  Serve hot.

Name: Biscuits
Instructions: Preheat oven to 425°.  In a large bowl, whisk together flour, baking powder, sugar and salt.  Using a box grater, shred cold butter into mixture and stir to distribute evenly through dry mixture.  Add milk gradually, stirring just until dough pulls away from the side of the bowl.  Turn dough out onto a floured surface and knead 15 times.  Pat or roll dough out to a 1" thickness.  Cut biscuits using a large glass dipped in flour.  Keep patting remnants of dough together and cutting biscuits until all dough is used.  Brush excess flour off biscuits and place them on an ungreased baking sheet.  Bake until edges begin to brown, 13 to 15 minutes.  Serve hot.

Name: Tortillas
Instructions:
Combine 3 cups flour, baking powder and salt in a large bowl.  Work in shortening until mixture is crumbly.  Slowly add water to mixture while tossing with a fork.  With your hands, knead dough vigorously in a bowl until it forms a nice dough ball, about 2 minutes.  Add a little more water if needed to collect any loose flour.  Cover bowl with a clean dish towel and let stand for 15 minutes.

Divide dough into 12 balls. Take a dough ball, roll it in flour, then place on a floured surface.  Roll out very thin and evenly with a rolling pin.  Place a large cast-iron skillet over medium heat until hot.  Add a tortilla and cook for 1 to 2 minutes per side, until it gets brown spots and no longer looks doughy.

Leftover tortillas can be stored in plastic bag in fridge or freezer.  Dough can be stored for a day or two.  Let sit on counter for half an hour before rolling any leftover dough.

Name: Zucchini Bread
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 325°.  Grease and flour two 4"x8" loaf pans.  Combine flour, wheat germ, baking powder, baking soda, salt, cinnamon and cloves in a medium bowl with a fork.  Beat eggs, oil, vanilla and sugar together in a large bowl.  Add dry ingredients to creamed mixture and beat well.  Stir in zucchini and nuts until well combined.

Pour batter into prepared pans.  Bake until a tester comes out clean, 50 to 60 minutes.  Remove bread from pans and completely cool before slicing.

Name: Honey-Granola Bars
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°.  Grease a 9"x13" baking pan.  Combine granola, oats, flour, cinnamon and baking powder in a large bowl.  Beat butter, honey, brown sugar, eggs and vanilla together in a medium bowl.  Fold butter mixture into flour mixture just until combined.  Mix in raisins.

Press dough firmly into prepared baking pan and bake until medium brown, 25 to 30 minutes.  Cool in pan on a wire rack for 10 minutes.  The bars will firm up as they cool.  Carefully cut into 18 rectangular bars.  Cool completely.  Wrap individually and store at room temperature.

Name: Pumpkin Muffins with Streusal Topping
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 400°.  Grease and flour a 12-cup muffin tin.  Combine flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, cinnamon and nutmeg in a large bowl.  Cut in butter with a fork until butter is evenly dispersed and mixture looks crumbly.  Stir in raisins.

In another large bowl, whisk together pumpkin, eggs and milk until well combined.  Add to flour mixture and mix lighly just until combined.  Spoon into prepared muffin cups, filling each 3/4 full.  Combine streusal topping ingredients in a small bowl.  With hands, rub butter into ther ingredients until mixture is crumbly.  Sprinkle each muffin with about 1 Tbs steusel topping.  Bake until set when touched, 20 to 25 minutes.  Repeat with remaining batter and streusel.

Name: Baked Apple "Donuts"
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°.  Grease and flour a 12-cup muffin tin.  In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, salt and nutmeg using a fork.  Add shortening and work until mixture looks like coarse crumbs.  Combine eggs, milk and apples.  Add to flour mixture; stir just until blended.  Spoon batter into prepared muffin cups, filling each 3/4 full.  Bake until donuts are light to medium brown, about 20 to 25 minutes.

While donuts bake, melt butter for topping.  Set aside.  In a small bowl, combine sugar and cinnamon.  When donuts are done and before they have a chance to cool, remove from pan and dip in butter then in sugar.  Repeat with remaining batter and topping.  Any leftover donuts can be frozen.

Name: Chocolate-Peanut Butter Cookie Bars
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°.  Line a 9"x13" baking pan with parchment paper.  In a large bowl, cream together butter and brown sugar until light and fluffy.  Add egg and vanilla; mix.  Add salt and flour slowly until everything is well mixed.  Spread batter evenly across bottom of prepared baking pan.  Bake on center rack of oven until edges begin to pull away from sides of pan, about 15 minutes.

Meanwhile, combine chocolate chips adn peanut butter and microwave on high for 20 seconds at a time until melted.  Blend well.  When cookie layer is completely ready, remove it from oven and cool 5 minutes.  Spread mixture over surface.  Sprinkle peanuts evenly over the top.  Cover with plastic wrap and chill until chocolate is firm.  Cool completely in pan before cutting into squares and enjoying.

Name: No-Mix Dump Cake
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 400°.  Drain juice from 1 quart of fruit; set aside juice for a different purpose.  Pour remaining fruit with juice plus drained fruit into a 9"x13" pan.  In a medium-size bowl, combine flour, sugars, baking powde and baking soda.  Sprinkle mixture evenly over fruit.  Arrange butter pats evenly over the top.  Bake until cake is browned, with crispy bits and little bubbles of juice filling popping up through the crusth, about 30 minutes.  Spoon into bowls while still warm and serve with ice cream if you like.

If using store-bought fruit, you will need about 8 cups drained fruit with about 2 cups liquid.  You can experiment with different kinds of fruit.

Name: Cheddar-Pear Pie
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 400°.  Press crust into 8" or 9" pie pan.  In a large bowl, combine pears, sugar, cornstarch and salt.  Pour into pie crust.  In a medium-size bowl, combine topping ingredients until crumbly.  Sprinkle evenly over filling.  Bake until crust is golden and cheese is melted, 25 to 35 minutes.  Let cool on a wire rack for 10 minutes.  Serve warm.  Store any leftovers in the fridge.

If you want to do apples, bake an additional 10 minutes.

Name: Push-in Pie Crust
Instructions:
Place flour, sugar and salt in an 8" or 9" pie pan.  Mix with a fork.  Add oil and milk.  Mix again, until all ingredients are combined.  Press dough into the bottom and against the sides of pan with your fingertips.  If you are using this crust for a pudding-type pie, bake empty pie shell in a preheated 425° oven for 10 to 12 minutes.  Otherwise, bake for the amount of time recommended in your pie recipe.

For a quiche, decrease the sugar to 1 tsp.

Name: Apple Crisp with Oat and Brown Sugar Topping
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 375°.  Peel, core and thinly slice apples.  Spread sliceds over the bottom of a 9"x13" or two 8" square casserole dish(es).  In a small bowl, soften butter until a little melted but not totally liquid.  Combine flour, oats, brown sugar, cinnamon, cloves and salt in a medium-size bowl.  Add butter and mix with a spoon or your hands until dry ingredients start to clump together and butter is dispersed.  Sprinkle crumb topping over apples.  If you used 2 smaller dishes, at this point you can cover and freeze 1 of the pans to bake later. 

Bake crsip until the topping is light to medium brown and you can see a little bubble juice at the edges of pan, 25 to 30 minutes.  Serve warm or cool, with whipped topping or ice cream if desired.

Name: Chocolate Zucchini Cake
Instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  Grease and flour a 9"x13" baking pan, tapping excess flour out.  Combine flour, wheat germ, sugar, cocoa powder, baking soda, baking powder, cinnamon and salt in a medium-size bowl.  Add eggs and beat for 1 minute then add oil and mix well.  Fold in zucchini and nuts until evenly distributed.  Pour batter into prepared pan.  Bake until a knife comes out clean, 50 to 60 minutes.  Cool cake completely in pan on a wire rack.

Name: Vanilla Pudding
Instructions:
Combine sugar, cornstarch and salt in a medium-size saucepan.  Whisk in about 1 cup milk, stirring until smooth.  Whisk in remaining 1 cup milk until well combined.  Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly and gently, until mixture begins to thicken.  Reduce heat to low and continue to cook 2 to 3 more minutes, stirring gently.  

Remove from heat and add vanilla and butter, stirring until butter is melted.  Pour pudding into serving dishes.  Cover with plastic wrap, laying right on the surface of the pudding to keep a skin from forming.  Chill until cool and set, about 1 hour.

Chocolate Pudding: increase cornstarch to 1/4 cup, decrease vanilla to 1 tsp and add 1/4 cup unsweetened cocoa powder along with sugar, cornstach and salt.

Name: Stuffed French Toast Strata
Instructions:
Cut bread loaf roughly into 3/4" cubes (about 12 cups bread cubes).  Cut cream cheese into small cubes.  Grease a 9"x13" baking pan.  Place half of bread cubes in prepared pan.  Top with cream cheese cubes, then remaining bread cubes.

Whisk together eggs, milk, butter, syrup, cinnamon and vanilla until well combined.  Pour egg mixture evely over bread and cheese cubes.  Using a metal spatula, slightly press down layers to moisten all bread.  Cover pan with plastic wrap and refrigerate at least 2 hours or up to 24 hours.  Preheat oven to 325°.  Remove plastic from pan and bake strata until the center appears to be set and eggs are golden, 40 to 45 minutes.  Let stand 10 minutes before slicing.

Name: Homemade Pancake Syrup
Instructions: In a medium-size saucepan, combine sugar, swater and corn syrup; bring to a boil over medium heat.  Boil until slightly thickened, about 7 minutes.  Remove from heat; stir in salt, vanilla and maple flavoring.  Cool for 15 minutes before using or cool entirely before storing in a tightly covered bottle in cupboard.

Name: Spaghetti Seasoning Mix
Instructions: Place all ingredients in a medium-size container with a tight-fitting lid; shake well until combined.  Divide equally among 6 snack-size zip-top plastic bags or store in a jar and scoop out 1/3 cup for every quart of crushed tomatoes that you use.

Name: Berbere
Instructions: Place all ingredients in a small container with a tight-fitting lid and shake well until combined.

Name: Blue-Ribbon Pancake/Waffle Mix
Instructions: Mix all ingredients together and store in an airtight container at room temperature for up to 1 year.

Name: Biscuit Mix
Instructions:
Combine dry ingredients.  Add shortening and mix by hand or with a pastry blender until well combined.  Store, tightly covered, in an airtight container in refrigerator up to 3 months.

To make biscuits:  Combine 2 cups biscuit mix with 1/3 cup milk and 1 Tbs white vinegar to make a soft but not sticky dough.  If dough is too sticky, add a little flour until dough has good texture.  Turn out on a floured counter.  Roll out about 3/4" thick.  Cut with a large glass or biscuit cutter.  Place on ungreased baking sheet.  Bake in preheated 400° oven until biscuits are golden, 12 to 15 minutes.  Each batch makes aobut eight 3" biscuits.

Name: Cream of Anything Soup Mix
Description: equivalent to twelve 10.75 oz. cans condensed soup
Instructions:
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.  Store, tightly covered, in an airtight container at room temperature up to 1 year.

To make soup:  In a medium-size saucepan, combine 1/2 cup dry soup mix with 1-1/4 cups water, 1 Tbs butter and the following flavorings to make the specific soup you need.  Blend well and bring to a boil, cooking 2 to 3 minutes.  This mixture will thicken as it cools.

Cream of Chicken:  Prepare as directed above
Cream of Mushroom:  Add 1/2 cup minced mushrooms

Name: Pot Roast
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 450°.  Spray the inside and lid of a cast-iron Dutch oven with oil.  Peel the onions, if using fresh, and drop them into the pot with the potatoes.  Mix and lightly season with salt and pepper.  Add the meat and again season with salt and pepper.

In a small bowl, whisk together the tomato paste, broth and Worcestershire sauce until fully incorporated.  Pour half of the mixture over the meat.  Add layers of carrots, green beans and mushrooms and pour in the rest of the sauce.

Cover and bake for 48 minutes for medium/well-done meat and crunchy vegetables, 53 minutes for more well-done meat and softer vegetables, or until the aroma of a fully cooked meal escapes the oven.  Serve immediately.

Variations:
Rub meat with crushed red pepper flakes and white pepper before arranging in the pot.

Add 1 Tbs. prepared horseradish and 1 Tbs Dijon mustard to the broth mixture.

Omit the Worcestershire sauce and instead add 1/2 tsp. each of dried marjoram and dried thyme.

Leave out the entire broth mixture and instead place 3 to 4 sprigs of fresh rosemary in the pot.  Be sure to remove sprigs before serving.

Name: Pasta with Meatballs
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 450°.  Spray inside and lid of Dutch oven with olive oil.  Scatter the pasta in the pot.  Add 2/3 cup water and olive oil and stir to make an even layer.  

In a medium bowl, mix the groudn meat with the egg, bread crumbs, salt and parsley.  Shape the mixture into balls, about 2 Tbs each, and drop into the pot.  Cover with half of the marinara sauce.

Layer in carrtos, zucchini and bell pepper; then lightly season with salt.  Pour the rest of the marinara sauce over all.  Cover and bake for about 45 minutes or until 3 minutes after the aroma of a fully cooked meal escapes the oven.  Serve immediately.

Name: Pasta Tricolore
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 450°.  Spray inside and lid of Dutch oven with olive oil.  Scatter the pasta in the pot.  Drain the liquid from the tomatoes into a measuring cup.  If necessary, add enough water to make 2/3 cup liquid.  Reserve the tomatoes.

Add 1/3 of the garlic, a little salt and pepper and the olive oil to the tomato liquid.  Pour the liquid into the pot and stir to make the pasta an even layer.

Mix the tomatoes with the rest of the garlic, onion, basil and oregano, spinach and ground meat in a medium bowl.  Season with salt and pepper to taste.  Drop forkfuls of the tomato-meat mixture evenly over the pasta without mixing together.  Cover and bake for 45 minutes or until 3 minutes after the aroma of a fully cooked meal escapes the oven.  Serve immediately.

Name: Sausage and Quinoa
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 450°.  Spray inside of lid of Dutch oven with olive oil.  Pour the quinoa into the pot, add the liquid and stir to coat the grains and make an even layer.

Add the sausages to the pot in a single layer, if possible.  Scatter the bell peppers on top and lighly season with salt.  Top with tomato wedges.  Cover and bake for about 45 minutes or until 3 minutes after the aroma of a fully cooked meal escapes the oven.  Fluff the quinoa with a fork when serving.  Serve immediately.

Name: Chicken Satay
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 450°.  Coat the inside and lid of a Dutch oven with oil.  In a small bowl, whisk the scallion, peanut butter, soy sauce, brown sugar, ginger, garlic and 2 Tbs of broth.  Whisk until the sugar is dissolved and peanut butter is emulsified.  

Rinse the rice in a strainer under cold water until water runs clear.  Tip the rice into the pot.  Add the remaining broth and 1/4 cup water and stir to make an even layer.  Add the chicken and drizzle with 1/3 of the peanut sauce.

Arrange cabbage on top and pour half of the remaining sauce over it.  Add the snow peas and mushroom in another layer and pour the rest of the sauce over all.  Cover and bake for 45 minutes or until 3 minutes after the aroma of a fully cooked meal escapes the oven.  Serve immediately.  If the rice is still crunchy, fluff with a fork and replace the lid.  Let sit for another 3 to 5 mintues before serving.

Name: Greek Chicken
Instructions: Preheat oven to 450°.  Spray inside and lid of Dutch oven with oil.  Pour the couscous into the pot.  Add the liquid and stir to coat all the grains and make an even layer.  Place the chicken on top of the couscous and season lightly with salt and pepper.  Sprinkle with garlic, capers and half of the parsley.  Add the olives, zucchini and tomatoes.  Sprinkle with the rest of the parsley and lightly season again with salt and pepper.  Cover and bake for 45 minutes or until 3 minutes after the aroma of a fully cooked meal escapes the oven.  Serve immediately.

Name: Red Curry Chicken
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 450°.  Spray inside and lid of Dutch oven with oil.  Rinse the rice in a strainer under cold water until the water runs clear.  Spread the rice in the pot in an even layer.  Place the chicken on the rice.  

In a medium bowl, whisk to coconut milk, red curry paste, fish sauce, brown sugar, lime zest and basil.  Pour half the mixture over the chicken.  Scatter the carrots and then the chickpeas in the pot.  Top with spinach and pour the rest of coconut mixture over all.

Cover and bake for 45 minutes or until 3 minutes after the aroma of a fully cooked meal escapes the oven.  Serve immediately.  If the rice is still a bit crunchy, quickly fluff with a fork and replace lid.  Let sit for another 3 to 5 minutes before serving.

Name: Simply Chicken
Instructions: Preheat oven to 450°.  Spray inside and lid of Dutch oven with oil.  Put the chicken pieces in the pot, trying not to overlap them, and lightly season with salt and pepper.  Add the potatoes and carrots and again lightly season with salt and pepper.  Scatter the mushrooms in the pot, then pour in the peas.  Cover and bake for 40 to 45 minutes or until 3 minutes after the aroma of a fully cooked meal escapes the oven.  Serve immediately.

Name: Scarborough Fair Chicken
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 450°.  Spray inside and lid of Dutch oven with oil.  Rinse the rice in a strainer under cold water until water runs clear.  Pour the rice and liquid into the pot.  Stir to make an even layer.  Place the chicken on the rice and season lightly with salt and pepper.  Sprinkle with the garlic and shallots.

Add the zucchini and squash.  Scatter on the parsley and sage and tuck the thyme sprigs in crevices.  Cover and bake 45 minutes or until 3 minutes after the aroma of a fully cooked meal escapes the oven.  Serve immediately.

Name: Spinach and Artichoke Dip
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  Put the artichoke hearts into the stoneware.  Scrunch the spinach and chop it the best you can-you're mostly trying to get the long stems off.  Add it to the cooker and put in sour cream, cream cheese and jalapenos.  Top with 1/2 cup each shredded mozzarella and Parmesan.  Cover and cook on low for 2 hours or on high for 1 hour.  Stir.  The spinach should begin to wilt.  If it hasn't, cook some more.  When the spinach is totally wilted, add the remaining 1/2 cup of mozzarella and Parmesan cheeses and let them melt, with the lid off and allow moisture to evaporate.  Serve with your favorite chips, sliced veggies or bread cubes.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Apple Butter
Instructions: Use a 6-quart slow cooker.  This is a two-day process.  Peel, core and quarter each apple.  Put the apples into your crock and add vanilla.  Cover and cook on low for 8 hours.  When the cooking is done, mash the apples with a fork.  Stir in the sugars, cinnamon and cloves.  Cover again and cook on low for 6 hours.  If you prefer your apple butter to be velvety smooth, blend with a handheld immersion blender or in small batches in a traditional blender.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Apple Oatmeal
Instructions: Use a 2-quart slow cooker.  Put the oats, chopped apple and milk into the stoneware.  Add the brown sugar, vanilla and salt and mix to combine.  Cover and cook on low for 2 to 3 hours or on high for 1 to 2 hours.  Check the consistency of the oats.  Garnish with cinnamon.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Baked Oatmeal
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  Put the dry ingredients into the stoneware and add the dried fruit, milk, butter, vanilla and eggs.  Stir well to combine.  Cover and cook on low for 3 to 5 hours, checking after 90 minutes.  The oatmeal is done when the edges are brown and are beginning to crust, the center is set and a knife comes out clean.  Let sit in the cooling cooker for at least an hour before cutting.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Breakfast Risotto
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  Turn cooker to high and add butter so it can begin melting.  Wash and cut up apples.  Set aside.  Add the rice to the butter and stir to coat.  Add apples, spices and salt.  Stir in the juice and milk.  Cover and cook on high for 3 to 5 hours or on low for 6 hours.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Egg, Feta and Mushroom Breakfast Casserole
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  Saute the mushrooms and bell pepper in a large frying pan over medium heat in a bit of olive oil or butter until wilted and tender.  Spray inside of stoneware with cooking spray and add sauteed mushrooms, bell pepper and any mushroom juice.  Crumble in the entire block of feta cheese.  In a large bowl, whisk the eggs with a fork.  Add the pepper to the eggs and mix.  Pour the eggs on top of the feta and veggies.  Cover and cook on high for 2 to 4 hours or until eggs have fully set and begun to brown on the top and pull away from the sides.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Hash Brown Breakfast Casserole
Instructions: Use a 6-quart slow cooker.  Spray the inside with cooking spray.  Dump the hash browns in.  Spread them out with your fingers to break up any clumps.  In a mixing bowl, combine the eggs with the milk, salt, pepper, cheese, sausage and diced vegetables.  Pour everything on top of the hash browns.  Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or on high for 3 to 4 hours.  The casserole is done when the eggs are fully cooked and the edges start to brown a bit.  If you want the cheese to brown and get crispy, cook it longer.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Overnight Breakfast Casserole
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  Put vegetables and diced potato into the stoneware.  Add the sausage.  In a separate bowl, beat the eggs, milk and cheese together and pour on top of the other ingredients.  Cover and cook on low for 8 hours or on high for 4 hours.  The casserole is finished when the eggs are fully cooked and edges have begun to brown.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Overnight Breakfast Potatoes and Sausage
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  Put the potatoes, onion, olive oil, salt and pepper into your stoneware.  Toss well to coat evenly.  Lay the breakfast sausage on top.  If you are using precooked sausage, feel free to slice it.  Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Overnight Grits
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  Combine all the ingredients.  Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours.  Stir well and top with desired topping.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Strawberry Jam
Instructions: Use a 6-quart slow cooker.  Wash all strawberries and discard stems.  Quarter the berries and throw into stoneware.  Use a potato masher to squish the strawberries and create some liquid.  Add sugar and pectin and smash some more.  Cover and cook on low for 10 to 12 hours.  Let cool to room temperature then pour into plastic or glass containers to store in fridge or freezer.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Banana Bread
Instructions: Use an oval 6-quart slow cooker and a 9"x5"x3" metal or glass loaf pan.  Combine all ingredients into a batter in a bowl with mixer.  Spray loaf pan with cooking spray and pour in the batter.  Place the pan inside your slow cooker.  Do not add water.  Put on the lid but prop open with a chopstick or wooden spoon.  Cook on high for 4 hours or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Carefully remove the hot pan from the stoneware and let cool before inverting, unmolding and slicin the bread.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Cornbread
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  In a mixing bowl, combine the dry ingredients and stir in the milk, egg and butter.  Coat stoneware with cooking spray and pour in the batter.  Cover and cook on high for 2 to 4 hours or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Honey Cake
Instructions: Use a 4-quart round slow cooker.  Coat the inside with cooking spray then flour.  In a large mixing bowl, combine all of the dry ingredients and then add the wet.  Mix on high speed with a handheld or stand mixer for 2 minutes.  Pour the batter into stoneware.  Cover the cooker but vent with chopstick or wooden spoon.  Cook on high for 2 hours, then check.  When the cake begins to pull away from the sides of crock, uncover and continue to cook on high, checking every 20 minutes.  The cake will be moist but a toothpick should come out clean.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Pound Cake
Instructions: Use a 2-quart slow cooker or a large slow cooker with an oven-safe dish or 9"x5"x3" metal or glass loaf pan.  Pour melted butter into a large mixing bowl.  Whisk in the eggs and vanilla.  Add the dry ingredients and mix with mixer until ingredients are well incorporated.  Pour the batter into a greased 1 to 2 quart crock or similar sized pan.  Cover the cooker but prop the lid open with a chopstick or wooden spoon and cook on high for 2 to 4 hours or until a toothpick comes out clean.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Acorn Squash
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  Cut the squash into quarters and scoop out the seeds and stringy pulp.  Put 1/2 Tbs butter and 1/2 Tbs brown sugar into each quarter.  Sprinkle 1/2 tsp. cinnaom onto each brown sugar pile.  Add a small pinch of salt to each quarter.  Place the squash into your slow cooker.  Cover and cook on low for 3 to 4 hours or on high for about 2 hours.  The squash is finished when it is fork-tender and peels away form the skin easily.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Baked Potatoes
Instructions: Use a 6-quart slow cooker.  Wash potatoes well and dry.  Use a fork to prick the skin of each potato.  Wrap individually in aluminum foil.  Put the foil-wrapped potatoes into stoneware.  Do not add water.  Cover and cook on low for 10 hours or on high for about 6.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Broccoli Casserole
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  In a large mixing bowl, combine the flour, salt, pepper and dry mustard.  Toss the broccoli in the mixture.  Dump everything into your slow cooker.  Cover with 1 cup shredded cheese.  Add the milk and broth.  Top with Parmesan cheese.  Cover and cook on low for about 4 to 6 hours or on high for 2 to 4 hours.  The casserole is done when the broccoli reaches the desired tenderness and begins to brown a bit around the edges.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Potatoes Au Gratin
Instructions: Use a 6-quart slow cooker.  Put the potates, parsnips and onion into your slow cooker and set aside.  Melt the butter in a saucepan over medium heat and add flour to create a roux.  Stir continuously while slowly adding cream and thyme, mustard, salt and pepper.  Pour the cream and butter mixture over the potatoes, parsnips and onion.  Toss gently with a large spoon.  Cook on low for 8 to 9 hours or on high for 4 to 5 hours.  Before serving, stir in cheddar cheese until it disappears.  Garnish with green onion.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Corn on the Cob
Instructions: Use a 6-quart oval slow cooker.  Wrap each ear of corn completely in a piece of aluminum foil, twisting the ends to seal.  Pile the corn into the crock.  Do not add water.  Cover and cook on high for 2 hours or until corn is tender.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Corn Risotto
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  Put the olive oil into the stoneware and swirl the rice and the onion flakes around in it.  Add the garlic, salt and cayenne.  Stir in the frozen corn and broth.  Drop in the butter.  Cover and cook on high for 2 hours, checking every 45 minutes.  Unplug cooker and add the cream and Parmesan.  Cover for 5 minutes or until cheese melts completely.  Serve immediately.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Creamed Spinach
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  Put the milk, cream cheese, shredded cheeses, butter and nutmeg into the stoneware.  Cover and cook on low 3 to 4 hours, stirring a few times to keep cheeses from clumping.  When everything is hot and melted, add baby spinach.  Cover and cook on high for 30 minutes.  Stir.  Spinach will wilt and incorporate into the sauce.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Jalapeno Corn Pudding
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  Spray the inside of your stoneware with cooking spray.  Add butter, milk, eggs, salt, sugar, flour and baking powder.  Whisk ingredients together.  Stir in corn kernels, cheese and jalapenos.  Cover and cook on low for 3 to 5 hours.  The corn pudding is done when the edges brown and begin to pull from the sides and center is set.  Remove the lid for 20 to 30 minutes when the pudding is set and continue to cook on low to get rid of any condensation.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Mashed Potatoes with Sour cream and Cream Cheese
Instructions:
Use a 6-quart slow cooker.  Wash and peel potatoes, leaving skin on some if desired.  Cut the potatoes into quarters to speed up boiling time.  Put the potatoes inot a large pot and cover completely with water.  Bring to a rapid boil on stovetop for 10 to 20 minutes or until potatoes are fork-tender.

Scoop out 1/2 cup water from pot; add the bouillon cube to reserved water.  Drain potatoes and return them to the pot.  Put cream cheese into pot with potatoes.  Add sour cream.  Pour in bouillon-water along with parsley and garlic powder.  Mash with a potato masher.  After mashing well, scoop the potatoes out of the pot and place into slow cooker.  Cook on high for 2 hours or on low for 4 hours.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Boston Baked Beans
Instructions: Use a 2-quart slow cooker.  Drain and rinse beans and put inot stoneware.  Add the onion and brown sugar.  Pour in molasses and ketchup.  Add salt, mustard and pepper.  Stir to combine.  Lay slices of uncooked bacon over top of beans.  Cover and cook on low for 5 to 7 hours or on high for about 4 hours.  Remove bacon, dice and return to pot.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Barbecued Chicken and Cornbread Casserole
Instructions:
Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  Spray inside of stoneware with cooking spray.  Add chicken and sweet potato to crock.  Add corn and onion.  Empty contents of barbecue sauce bottle then add water to bottle to empty completely.  Mix well with spoon.  

In mixing bowl, mix together conbread topping with a fork.  Spread onto the chicken mixture.  Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or until cornbread has browned and starts to pull away from sides.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Chicken and Brown Rice Casserole
Instructions:
Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  Combine the broth and 1/2 cup milk in a saucepan and heat over medium heat on the stovetop.  In a separate bowl, whisk the remaining 1 cup of milk with 3/4 cup flour.  When the broth and milk have begun to boil, reduce heat and slowly stir in the milk and flour mixture.  When everything is fully incorporated, set the saucepan aside to cool.

Spray the inside of your stoneware with cooking spray.  Add the rice and seasonings.  Add the onion and mushrooms.  Stir in the broth, flour and milk mixture.  The rice will turn a bit red from the paprika.  Lay the chicken pieces on top.  Cover and cook on high for 4 hours or low for about 8 hours.  When you take off lid, stir rice.  If rice is fully cooked and you have extra liquid, keep lid off for 15 minutes.  The liquid will absorb quickly.  Season with salt to taste.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Creamy Beef Over Noodles
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  Put meat into crock; frozen is fine.  Add butter, milk, Worcestershire sauce, onion, broth, salt, pepper and herbes de Provence.  Cook on low 10 to 12 hours or until the meat is tender.  Stir in the cream cheese.  Serve over hot buttered noodles.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Macaroni and Cheese
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  Spray crock well with cooking spray.  In a mixing bowl, whisk egg and milk together.  Stir in seasonings.  Add the cheese and noodles and stir well to combine.  Pour the mixture into the slow cooker.  It will have a lot of liquid.  Cover and cook on low for 2 to 5 hours or on high for 1 to 3 hours, stirring every 30 to 45 minutes.  Watch carefully-can burn easily.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Quinoa Casserole
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  Rinse the quinoa in a fine-mesh strainer under cold running water until the water runs clear.  Put quinoa into the crock.  Add olive oil and mix around.  Pour in the chicken broth and add salt and cinnamon.  Stir in almonds and cranberries.  Cover and cook on low for 4 to 6 hours or on high for 2 to 4 hours.  The quinoa is done when you can fluff it with a fork and it is tender.  The liquid should be pretty well absorbed.  Add tomatoes and cheese.  Stir gingerly to mix.  Add a large handful of baby spinach to top of crock and close lid.  Cook on high for about 20 minutes or until the spinach has wilted.  Stir again to distribute the spinach.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Broccoli and Three Cheese Soup
Instructions: Use a 6-quart slow cooker.  Dice the onion into really small pieces and put into the cooker.  Pour in milk and broth and add pepper, salt and nutmeg.  Stir in frozen broccoli.  Cook on low for 7 to 9 hours or on high for 4 to 6 hours.  The broth is done when onion is soft and translucent.  Stir in shredded cheese 20 minutes before serving.  You can use a blender to make smooth.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Butternut Squash Soup
Instructions:
Use a 6-quart slow cooker.  Cut the squash in half lengthwise.  Scoop out seeds and stringy pulp.  Brush the olive oil on inside of squash and roast in oven cut side up at 400° for 15 minutes or until skin peels away from flesh.

Plug in slow cooker and turn on high.  Add broth, onions and apples.  Stir in salt, pepper and spices.  Cover to let heat.  When squash has finished roasting, add to pot.  Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or on high for about 4 hours.  Carefully blend with handheld immersion blender.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Cabbage Soup
Instructions: Use a 6-quart slow cooker.  Chop all vegetables into bite-size pieces and put into cooker.  Pour in liquid.  Stir in garlic, seasoning blend and pepper flakes.  Cover and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours.  Season with Tobasco sauce, if desired.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Chicken and Dumplings Soup
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  Put the chicken and vegetables into bottom of stoneware.  Add the cream of soups.  Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or on high for 4 to 5 hours.  An hour before serving, shred chicken with forks and drop in biscuit dough.  Cover and cook on high for another hour.  The dumplings are done when a knife is easily inserted and comes out clean.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Chicken and Rice Soup
Instructions: Use a 6-quart slow cooker.  Wash and trim vegetables and put in blender or food processor to puree.  Place in slow cooker.  Add chicken, broth, water, rice, herbes de Provence, salt and pepper.  Cover and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Chicken Broth
Instructions:
Use at least a 6-quart cooker.  Put carcass into slow cooker.  Nestle the vegetables with bones.  Add garlic cloves, bay leaves, seasoning and water.  Cover and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours. 

Remove stoneware from cooker and let cool completely.  Take out chicken bones and bay leaves.  Scoop liquid and vegetables inot blender.  Pour broth into freezer bags in manageable portions (1 cup servings).
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Cream of Mushroom Soup
Instructions: Use a 6-quart slow cooker.  Wash mushrooms well and cut into quarters.  Put into stoneware and add salt, pepper, onion, seasoning and lemon juice.  Pour in broth and water.  Cover and cook on low for 8 hours.  Carefully blend with blender until soupy.  Stir in milk.  Let cool on counter for a few hours then pour into freezer bags or plastic containers in 2-cup portions and freeze.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Beef Stew
Instructions: Use a 6-quart slow cooker.  Put all vegetables into cooker.  Dredge meat in flour and add to crock.  Discard any remaining flour.  Add seasonings, Worcestershire sauce, wine and broth.  Cover and cook on low for 8 to 12 hours.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Turkey and Wild Rice Soup
Instructions: Use a 6-quart slow cooker.  Put carcass inot slow cooker and add water.  Cover and cook on low overnight or 8 to 10 hours.  Drain the broth into a large pot, pick off meat and add to broth.  Rinse out stoneware and put in vegetables.  Return broth and meat to stoneware and add rice, sage, bouillon cube and balsamic vinegar.  Stir.  Add baby spinach.  Cover and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours or on high for 4 to 6 hours.  Soup is done when vegetables are tender.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Apple, Cheddar and Turkey Meatballs
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  In a large mixing bowl, mix turkey with egg, seasonings, apple, cheese and cranberries.  Make golf-ball size meatballs and place in stoneware, stagger-stacking.  Cover and cook on low for 5 to 8 hours or on high for 4 to 6 hours.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Applesauce Chicken
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  Put chicken pieces into stoneware.  Add onion (if using dried, add to applesauce).  In a small bowl, mix applesauce, vinegar, garlic and spices.  Pour on top of chicken.  Cover and cook on low for 5 to 7 hours or high for 3 to 4 hours.  Serve with rice or quinoa.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Apricot Chicken
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  Put chicken into stoneware.  In a small bowl, combine the other ingredients and pour evenly over chicken.  Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or high for 3 to 4 hours.  Serve with rice.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Bacon and Cheese Chicken
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  Pour the olive oil into bottom of crock and spread around.  Place chicken pieces on top of oil (if using fattier pieces, you might want to omit oil).  In a small bowl, combine the teriyaki sauce with ranch dressing.  Pour sauce over top of chicken.  Add cheese and bacon between chicken pieces, if you can.  Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or high for 3 to 4.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Balsamic Chicken with Spring Vegetables
Instructions: Use a 6-quart slow cooker.  Place chicken into stoneware.  Put vegetables into large mixing bowl with garlic.  Toss with balsamic vinegar and Worcestershire sauce.  Add salt and pepper to tast.  Pour over chicken. Cover and cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or high for 4 to 6 hours.  Serve with rice or quinoa.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Cream Cheese Chicken
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  Put chicken into crock.  Combine seasonings and sugar in small dish and pour on top.  Add mushroom soup.  Cook on low for 6 to 8 hours or until chicken is cooked through.  Shred with forks and mix in cream cheese.  Switch cooker to high and cook for another 30 minutes or until cream cheese has fully melted.  Serve over pasta.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Rotisserie-Style Chicken
Instructions: Use a 6-quart slow cooker.  Skin the chicken and get rid of neck and other innards.  In a bowl, combine salt, paprika, onion powder, thyme, Italian seasoning and peppers.  Rub mixture all over bird, inside and out.  If desired, put cloves and onion inside bird.  Put chicken breast-side down into slow cooker.  Do not add water.  Cover and cook on high for 4 to 5 hours or on low for 8 hours.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Barbecued Pulled Pork
Instructions: Use a 6-quart slow cooker.  Trim the meat and place into stoneware.  Add onion and ketchup.  Pour 1/2 cup warm water into ketchup bottle and shake to loosen any extra.  Add vinegar, brown sugar, Worcestershire sauce, Tabasco and salt.  Cover and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours or until meat shreds easily with a fork.  Serve over rice or make sandwiches.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Corned Beef
Instructions: Use a 6-quart slow cooker.  Cut vegetables into 2" pieces and put on bottom of stoneware.  Trim fat off meat and put meat on top.  Add seasoning packet and water.  Cover and cook on low for 8 to 10 hours or on high for 4 to 6 hours.  Corned beef is much more tender when cooked slowly.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Roast Beef
Instructions: Use a 6-quart slow cooker.  Spread onion slices on bottom of stoneware.  Trim excess fat off meat and make six slits with knife.  Insert cloves.  Add dry ingredients to a plastic ziploc bag with meat.  Seal well and shake.  Place meat on onion.  Add Worcestershire sauce and broth.  Cover and cook on high for 4 hours or on low for 6 to 8 hours.  Let meat stand for 15 minutes before slicing.  Can make gravy with dripping.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Applesauce
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  Put apples into stoneware.  Add juice and water.  Pour in vanilla, cinnamon and brown sugar.  Cover and cook on low for 4 to 6 hours.  When the apples are very tender, mash with potato masher or large fork.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Chex Party Mix
Instructions: Use a 6-quart slow cooker.  Put butter into stoneware and turn cooker to low.  Add onion powder, seasoned salt and Worcestershire sauce.  Add dry ingredients.  Toss to coat.  Cover and cook on low for 2 to 3 hours, stirring every 45 minutes or so.  Put on baking sheet to cool.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Cracker Jack
Instructions: Use a 6-quart slow cooker.  Put sugar, corn syrup, molasses and butter into cooker and set on high for 1-3 hours or until mixture is hot and bubbly.  While waiting, pop popcorn.  Spread out long pieces of parchment paper on countertop or table.  When sugar mixture is ready, carefully mix in popcorn and peanuts.  Spread popcorn and peanuts out on parchment paper and sprinkle with salt.  Store in airtight container.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Bread Pudding
Instructions: Use a 2-quart slow cooker.  In a mixing bowl, whisk eggs, milk, brown sugar, vanilla and cinnamon.  Add bread cubes.  Stir in dried fruit.  Pour mixture into greased stoneware.  Cover and cook on low for 3 to 5 hours or on high for 2 to 3 hours.  When top has browned, add sugar on top and caramelize with kitchen torch.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Cheesecake
Instructions: Use a 6-quart slow cooker and heat-resistant dish that can fit in slow cooker.  In plastic ziplock bag, beat crackers into crumbs with rolling pin.  Put a cup of crumbs into medium bowl and add butter and brown sugar.  Stir until mixture is wet and crumbly.  Press crumbs in bottom of dish.  In separate bowl, cream cheese, sugar, eggs, flour, cream and vanilla with mixer.  Pour cheese mixture on top of crust.  Add 1/2 to 1 cup of water to bottom of slow cooker to make a water bath.  Lower dish into stoneware.  Cover and cook on high for 2 to 3 hours, checking after 1 hour.  Cheesecake is done when edges are no longer shiny and have set.  Unplug cooker.  Let cheesecake sit in cooling cooker for an hour before removing and transferring to refrigerator.  Chill in refrigerator about 2 hours before cutting and serving.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Tapioca Pudding
Instructions: Use a 4-quart slow cooker.  Combine milk, sugar and tapioca in stoneware.  Stir well to mix.  Cover and cook on high for 2 to 5 hours.  Tapioca will be soft but won't get thick.  In a mixing bowl, whisk eggs with vanilla.  Measure out 1/2 cup hot tapioca mixture and whisk into eggs.  Add another 1/2 cup and whisk in.  Add another.  Pour contents of bowl into stoneware and whisk until thoroughly combined.  Cover and cook on high for 30 to 45 minutes or until tapoca is pudding-like in consistency.  Unplug cooker and let pudding sit for around an hour to cool.  Laddle in bowls and chill.
Source: Make it Fast, Cook it Slow

Name: Brownie Mix
Instructions: In a large bowl, combine flour, baking powder, salt, sugar and cocoa.  Stir with a wire whisk until evenly distributed.  Put in a large airtight container.  Label with date and contents.  Store in a cool, dry place.  Use within 10 to 12 weeks.

Name: Chewy Chocolate Cookies
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 375°.  Grease baking sheets.  Combine butter, eggs and water in a medium bowl.  Beat with a fork until blended.  Stir in Brownie Mix, baking soda, flour and vanilla.  Add additional water, if needed.  Blend well.  

Drop by teaspoonfuls 2" apart on prepared baking sheets.  Put a walnut in center of each cookie.  Bake 10 to 12 minutes, until edges are browned.  Cool.

Name: Brownie
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°.  Grease and flour an 8" square pan.  Combine butter, eggs, vanilla and Brownie Mix.  Beat until smooth.  Stir in nuts.  Pour into prepared pan.  Bake 30 to 35 minutes or until edges separate from pan.  Sprinkle or frost with Brownie Topper of your choice.  Cut into 2" bars when cool.

Brownie Toppers:

Chocolate Topper:  Sprinkle 6 oz. package chocolate chips over warm brownies.  Warm in oven until melted.  Spread evenly.  Sprinkle with more chopped nuts.

Bittersweet Frosting:  Combine 1-1/2 cups powdered sugar, 1/2 cup butter and 1/2 cup evaporated milk.  Cook 7 to 10 minutes, until temperature reaches 230°.  Cool.  Beat until stiff; spread on cooled brownies.  Melt 2 oz unsweetened chocolate and spread over topping.

Marshmallow Surprise:  Prepare 1/2 recipe Chocolate Icing (below).  Sprinkle with 1-1/2 cups miniature marshmallows over warm brownies.  Warm until melted, about 2 to 3 minutes.  Cool.  Frost with icing.

Chocolate Icing:  Put 1-3/4 cups powdered sugar in a medium bowl.  In a small saucpan, combine 1/4 cup butter, 3 Tbs evaporated milk and 2 Tbs unsweetened cocoa powder.  Bring to a boil, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat.  Immediately add to powdered sugar.  Beat until smooth.

Name: Texas Sheet Cake
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 375°.  Grease a 15"x10" or larger baking pan.  Put Brownie Mix in a large bowl.  In a small saucpan, bring butter and water to a boil.  Add to Brownie Mix.  Add sour cream, eggs and baking soda.  Blend well.  Pour into prepared pan. 

Bake 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Prepare Cocoa Icing.  Frost cake while still hot. 

Cocoa Icing:  In a small saucepan, bring milk, butter and cocoa to a boil, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat.  Place powdered sugar in a bowl, add cocoa mixture.  Beat.  Stir in nuts and vanilla.

Name: Corn Bread Mix
Instructions: In a large bowl, combine all ingredients.  Stir with a wire whisk to incorporated evenly.  Pour into a 10-cup container with a tight-fitting lid.  Seal container with a tight-fitting lid.  Seal container.  Label with date and contents.  Store in a cool, dry place.  Use within 10 to 12 weeks.

Name: Corn bread
Instructions: Preheat oven to 425°.  Butter a 5"x3" loaf pan.  In a bowl, beat together egg, water and butter.  Stir in Corn Bread Mix until moistened.  Batter will be lumpy.  Pour into prepared pan.  Bake 20 to 25 minutes.

Name: Corn Dogs
Instructions:
Pour 2" to 3" of vegetable oil in a deep-fryer or medium-size heavy saucepan.  Heat.  Dry frankfurters with paper towels; set aside.  In a pie plate, combine Corn Bread Mix, flour, dry mustard and paprika.  Stir in egg and water until thoroughly combined.  Batter will be stiff.  

Roll frankfurters in batter, covering completely.  Use tongs to lower into hot oil.  Turning once, fry until golden brown, 2 to 3 minutes.  Drain on paper towels.

Name: Hot Roll Mix
Instructions:
Combine all ingredients in large bowl.  Stir together to distribute evenly.  Put in a large airtight container.  Label with date and contents.  Store in a cool, dry place.  Use within 6 to 8 months.

Variation:  Use 9 cups whole-wheat flour and 8 cups flour instead of 20 cups flour.  Decrease sugar to 1 cup.

Name: Swedish Cinnamon Twists
Instructions:
In a cup, dissolve yeast and sugar in water.  Set aside.  Bring buttermilk to a boil; it should curdle.  Add baking soda and 1/4 cup butter.  Add eggs.  When mixture is lukewarm, add dissolved yeast.  Stir in 4 cups Hot Roll Mix until soft dough forms a ball.  On a floured surface, knead 5 minutes.  Add more Hot Roll Mix if necessary to make a soft dough.  Lightly butter bowl.  Put dough in bowl and turn to butter top.  Cover and let rise until doubled, about 1 hour.

Grease 2 baking sheets.  Combine brown sugar, ground cinnamon and nuts.  Punch down dough.  Roll out to 12"x10".  Brush dough with melted butter.  Sprinkle cinnamon filling lengthwise over half of dough to within 1/2" of long edge.  Fold half lengthwise to cover filing.  Seal edges.  Cut dough into 18 strips about 3/4" wide.  Twist each strip twice and place 1" apart on prepared baking sheets.

Cover; let rise until doubled, 30 to 40 minutes.  Preheat oven to 375°.  Bake 10 to 12 minutes.  In a small bowl, combine 1-1/2 cups sifted powdered sugar, 1/2 Tbs melted butter and 2 Tbs hot water.  Brush on warm rolls.

Name: Cinnamon Rolls
Instructions:
In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in water.  Blend in eggs and oil.  Add 5 cups Hot Roll Mix.  Stir well.  Add more Hot Roll Mix to make a soft dough.  Knead about 5 minutes, until dough is smooth.  Lightly butter bowl.  Put dough in bowl and turn to butter top.  Cover dough with a damp towell and let rise in a warm place until doubled, about 1 hour.

Grease 2 baking sheets.  Punch down dough.  Let stand 10 minutes.  On a lightly floured surface, roll out dough to 12"x24" aobut 1/4" thick.  Brush surface with butter.  Sprinkle brown sugar, cinnamon and raisins and nuts, if desired.  Roll dough like a jelly roll and cut into 24 1" slices.  Place on prepared baking sheets.  Cover with a damp towel and let rise in a warm place until doubled, 30 to 60 minutes.  Preheat oven to 375°.  Bake 20 to 25 minutes, until golden brown.  In a small bowl, combine powdered sugar, vanilla and enough milk to make a thin mixture.  Brush on warm rolls.

Name: Cream Cheese Swirls
Instructions:
In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in water.  Blend in eggs and oil.  Add 5 cups Hot Roll Mix.  Stir well.  Add Hot Roll Mix to make a soft, but not too sticky, dough.  Knead about 5 minutes, until dough is smooth.  Lightly butter bowl.  Put dough in bowl and turn to butter top.  Cover dough with a damp towel and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour.  Generously grease 2 baking sheets.

In a bowl, combine 8 oz. softened cream cheese, 6 Tbs sugar, 1 slightly beaten egg and 1/2 tsp. lemon extract.  Punch dough down.  Let stand 10 minutes.  On a floured surface, roll dough to 12"x24", about 1/4" thick.  Brush with melted butter.  Sprinkle brown sugar and cinnamon over butter.  Roll dough like a jelly roll.  Cut into 1" slices.  Place on prepared baking sheets.  Cover with a damp towel and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, 30 to 60 minutes.

Preheat oven to 375°.  With a tablespoon, press a deep indentation in the center of each bun.  Fill each indentation with 3 Tbs. Cream Cheese Filling.  Bake 20 to 25 minutes, until golden brown.  In a bowl, combine 2 cups sifted powdered sugar, 1/2 tsp. vanilla or lemon extract and enough milk to make thin.  Drizzle glaze over warm buns.

Name: Pluckit
Instructions:
In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in water.  Blend in eggs and oil.  Add 5 cups of Hot Roll Mix.  Stir well.  Add more Hot Roll Mix to make a soft dough.  Knead about 5 minutes, undil dough is smooth.  Lightly butter bowl.  Put dough in bowl and turn to butter top.  Cover dough with a damp towel and let rise in a warm place until doubled, about 1 hour.

Punch down dough.  Roll dough into walnut-size balls.  Combine cinnamon and sugar in a bowl.  Dip balls in melted butter and roll in cinnamon-sugar mixture.  Pile loosely in an ungreased tube pan.  Let rise until doubled, about 30 minutes.

Preheat oven to 400°.  Bake about 10 minutes.  Lower temperature to 350° and continue baking 30 minutes until golden.  Loosen edges with a knife and turn out onto a plate.  Rolls can be plucked off one at a time.

Name: French Bread
Instructions:
In a bowl, stir yeast into water until softened.  Stir in eggs.  Beat in 5 cups Hot Roll Mix until blended.  Let rest 2 minutes.  Stir in enough of the remaining mix to make a soft dough.  Knead until smooth, 7 to 10 minutes.  Grease bowl.  Place dough in bowl, turning to grease all sides.  Cover with a damp towel.  Let rise in a warm draft-free place until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour.

Generously grease 2 baking sheets.  Sprinkle with cornmeal; set aside.  Punch down dough.  On a lightly oiled surface, divide dough into 2 balls.  Roll out each ball to one 10"x3" rectangle.  Roll up firmly, jelly-roll fashion, starting with one long side.  Pinch to seal edges.  Place rolled loves seam-side down on prepared baking sheets.  Make 5 diagonal slashes across top of each loaf.  Brush with water.  Let rise until doubled in bulk.

Preheat oven to 375°.  Brush loaves again with water.  Sprinkle with sesame seeds, if desired.  Place a baking pan filled with water on lowest shelf of oven.  Place loaves on a rack in center of oven.  Bake 30 to 35 minutes in preheated oven until golden brown.  Cool on a rack.

Name: Pan Rolls
Instructions:
In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in lukewarm water.  Blend in eggs and oil.  Add 5 cups Hot Roll Mix.  Blend well.  Add additional Hot Roll Mix to make a soft, but not too sticky, dough.  Knead about 5 minutes, until dough is smooth.  Lightly butter bowl.  Put dough in bowl and turn to butter top.  Cover dough with a damp towel and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour.

Grease a 13"x9" baking pan or two 9" round pans.  Punch down dough.  Let rest 10 minutes.  Divide into 24 to 30 balls.  Place in prepared pans.  Cover and let rise until about doubled in bulk.  Preheat oven to 375°.  Bake 20 to 25 minutes until browned.  Brush tops with butter.

Name: Crescent Rolls
Instructions:
In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in water.  Blend in eggs and oil.  Add 5 cups Hot Roll Mix.  Blend well.  Add more Hot Roll Mix to make soft, but not too sticky, dough.  Knead 5 minutes, until dough is smooth.  Lightly butter bowl.  Put dough in bowl and turn to butter top.  Cover dough with a damp towel and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour.  Generously grease baking sheets.  Punch down dough.  Divide in half.  Let stand 10 minutes.

On a lightly floured surface, roll out each half to a 12" circle.  Brush each circle with 1 Tbs soft butter.  Cut each circle into 16 pie-shaped wedges.  Roll up each wedge from the wide end.  Place point-side down in a crescent shape on prepared baking sheets.  Cover and let rise again until doubled in bulk, 45 to 60 minutes.  Preheat oven to 400°.  Bake 15 to 20 minutes, until golden.

For a variation, brush orange marmalade on top of buttered wedges before rolling into crescents.

Name: Tomato-Rosemary Bread
Instructions:
In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in water.  When yeast starts to bubble, add egg, tomato juice, oil, rosemary and tomatoes.  Blend well.  Add Hot Roll Mix 1 cup at a time until dough is stiff.  On a lightly floured surface, knead dough 5 to 7 minutes, until smooth.  Lightly butter bowl.  Put dough in bowl and turn to butter top.  Cover with damp towel and let rise in a warm draft-free place until doubled in bulk, 45 to 60 minutes.

Punch down dough.  Let stand 10 minutes.  Shape into 1 loaf.  Grease a 9"x5" loaf pan.  Place dough in pan, seam-side down.  Cover and let rise again until slightly rounded above top of pan, 30 to 40 minutes.  Preheat oven to 350°.  Bake 30 to 40 minutes, until deep golden brown.  Remove from oven and brush top with butter if desired.  Remove from pan and cool on a wire rack.

Name: Bread Basket Bowls
Instructions:
In a bowl, dissolve yeast in water.  When yeast bubbles, stir in egg and oil.  Gradually stir in 3 cups Hot Roll Mix until blended.  Add additional Hot Roll Mix to make a stiff dough.  Turn out on a floured surface.  Knead until smooth, about 10 minutes.  Add more flour as needed.  Grease bowl.  Place dough in greased bowl, turning to grease all sides.  Cover and leat rise in a warm place until doubled, about 1 hour. 

While dough is rising, grease the outsides and bottoms of eight 10-oz. custard cups; set aside.  Punch down dough.  Turn out on floured surface.  Knead about 5 times.  Divide dough into 8 pieces.

Shape into smooth balls.  Roll 1 ball into a 6" circle.  Lay over 1 inverted and greased custard cup.  Mold dough to cover cup.  Repeat with other balls of dough.  Place cups on 2 ungreased baking sheets, about 2" apart.  Let stand uncovered 10 minutes.  Preheat oven to 375°.  Bake 20 minutes.  Beat egg with water.  Remove custard cups from oven.  Brush bread bowls with egg-water mixture.  Bake 5 minutes longer.  Remove from oven.

Turn right side up; remove custard cups.  Brush inside of each bread bowl with egg-water mixture.  Bake 10 to 15 minutes longer until lightly browned.  Cool.

Name: White Bread
Instructions:
In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in water.  When yeast starts to bubble, add eggs, water and oil.  Blend well.  Add Hot Roll Mix 1 cup at a time until dough is stiff.  On a lightly floured surface, knead dough 5 to 7 minutes, until smooth and satiny.  Lightly butter bowl.  Put dough in bowl and turn to butter top.  Cover with a damp towel and let rise in a draft-free place until doubled in bulk, 45 to 60 minutes.  Punch down dough.  Let stand 10 minutes.  Shape into 2 loaves.

Grease two 9"x5" loaf pans.  Place 1 loaf of dough in each pan, seam-side down.  Cover and let rise again until slightly rounded above top of pan, 30 to 40 minutes.  Preheat oven to 350°.  Bake 30 to 40 minutes, until deep golden brown.  Remove from oven and brush tops with butter if desired.  Remove from pans and cool.

Name: Soft Pretzels
Instructions: Preheat oven to 425°.  Lightly grease 2 large baking sheets.  In a bowl, dissolve yeast in water.  Blend in 2 eggs and oil.  Add 5 cups Hot Roll Mix.  Stir well.  Add more Hot Roll Mix to make a soft dough.  Knead about 5 minutes, until dough is smooth.  Roll dough into ropes about 1/2" in diameter and 18 to 24" long.  Form into pretzels.  For sticks, cut dough into 5" to 6" lengths.  Place on prepared baking sheets.  Brush with beaten egg and sprinkle with salt.  Bake immediately 12 to 15 minutes, until brown and crisp.

Name: English Muffins
Instructions:
In a large bowl, dissolve yeast in water.  When yeast bubbles, add butter and 3 cups Hot Roll Mix.  Blend well.  Add more Hot Roll Mix until dough is firm.  On a lightly floured surface, knead dough 5 minutes, until smooth.  Lightly butter bowl.  Put dough in bowl and turn to butter top.  Cover with a damp towel and let rise in a warm place until doubled in bulk, about 30 minutes.

Sprinkle 2 baking sheets lightly with cornmeal.  DO NOT PUNCH DOWN DOUGH.  On a lightly floured surface roll out dough to 1/2" thickness.  Cut with 3" to 4" round cookie cutters or muffin rings.  Place cut dough on cornmeal.  Turn and pat cornmeal into surface.  Cover with waxed paper.  Let rise until doubled, about 30 minutes.

Heat an electric skillet or griddle to 325°.  Butter skillet.  With a spatula, place muffins on hot surface.  Cook each side 8 to 10 minutes, until golden.  Cool.

Name: Whole-Wheat Hot-Roll Mix
Instructions: In a large bowl, combine whole-wheat flour, all-purpose flour, milk powder and salt.  Stir with a wire whisk until evenly distributed.  Press brown sugar through a coarse sieve to remove any lumps.  Stir brown sugar or granulated sugar into flour mixture.  Pour into an 18-cup container with a tight-fitting lid.  Attach lid.  Label container with date and contents.  Store in a cool, dry place and use within a week, in a refrigerator 10 to 12 weeks or in a freezer up to 6 months.

Name: Country French Bread
Instructions:
In a bowl, stir yeast into water until softened.  Stir in eggs.  Beat in 5 cups Whole-Wheat Hot Roll Mix until blended.  Let rest 2 minutes.  Stir in more mix to make a soft dough.  Knead 7 to 10 minutes until smooth.  Grease bowl.  Place dough in bowl, turning to grease all sides.  Cover with a damp towel.  Let rise in warm place until doubled in bulk, about 1 hour.  Punch down dough.  Let rest 10 minutes.

Grease 2 large baking sheets.  Sprinkle with cornmeal; set aside.  On a lightly oiled surface, divide dough in half.  Shape each into a ball.  Roll each ball to a 10"x3" rectangle.  Roll up firmly starting with one long side.  Pinch to seal edges.  Place loaves seam-side down on prepared sheets.  Make 5 diagonal slashes across top of each loaf.  Brush with water.  Let rise until almost doubled.

Preheat oven to 375°.  Brush loaves with water again.  Place a baking pan on lower oven shelf.  Pour 1" warm water in pan.  Place loaves in center of oven.  Bake 30 to 35 minutes until golden brown.  Brush with butter, if desired.

Name: Whole Wheat Cinnamon Rolls
Instructions:
In a bowl, dissolve yeast in water.  Blend in eggs and oil.  Add 5 cups Whole-Wheat Hot Roll Mix.  Stir well; let rest 2 minutes.  Add more mix to make a soft dough.  Knead 7 to 10 minutes.  Put dough in buttered bowl and turn to butter top.  Cover with damp towel and let rise until doubled, about 1 hour.

Combine butter, cinnamon, brown sugar, raisins and nuts.  Set aside.  Combine cream, brown sugar and nuts.  Spread in 15" x 10" baking sheet.  Punch down dough.  Let rest 10 minutes.  On a floured surface, roll dough to 12"x20" about 1" thick.  Spread with cinnamon butter.  Roll dough tightly.  Cut into 20 slices.  Place on prepared baking sheets.  Cover.  Let rise until doubled, 30 to 50 minutes.  Preheat oven to 375°.  Bake 20 to 25 minutes.  Cool.  Invert rolls onto platter.  Serve warm.

Name: Muffin Mix
Instructions: In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, baking powder, salt, cinnamon and nutmeg.  Mix well.  Put in a large airtight container.  Label with date and contents.  Store in a cool, dry place.  Use within 6 to 8 months.

Name: Melt-in-your-mouth Muffins
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 400°.  Put Muffin Mix into a medium bowl.  Combine egg, milk and butter in a small bowl.  Add all at once to Muffin Mix.  Stir until mix is just moistened; batter should be lumpy.  Fill muffin pans 3/4 full.  Bake 18 to 20 minutes, until golden brown.

Variations:
 Cornmeal Muffins: Decrease Muffin Mix to 2-1/4 cups.  Add 1/2 cup cornmeal.

Butterscotch-Pecan Muffins:  Melt 6 Tbs butter in saucepan.  Stir in 6 Tbs brown sugar.  Place 1 Tbs of brown sugar mixture and 2 to 3 pecans in bottom of each muffin cup.  Fill cups 3/4 full with batter.

Dried Fruit Muffins:  Add 1 cup chopped dried fruit to liquid ingredients.

Fresh Peach: Gently fold 1 cup diced fresh peaches into batter before filling pans

Banana Muffins:  Mash 1 banana (1/2 cup) and add to liquid ingredients.

Blueberry Muffins:  Gently fold 1 cup fresh, frozen or drained canned blueberries before filling pans.

Name: Apple Muffins
Instructions: Preheat oven to 400°.  In a medium bowl, combine Muffin Mix, nuts and cloves.  Combine apples, egg, butter and milk in a medium bowl.  Add all at once to dry ingredients.  Stir until just moistened; batter should be lumpy.  Fill muffin pans 3/4 full.  Bake 18 to 20 minutes until golden brown.

Name: Lemon-Poppy Seed Muffins
Description: Use Muffin Mix.  Can be frozen
Instructions:
Preheat oven ot 400°.  In a medium bowl, combine Muffin Mix, pudding mix, poppy seeds and lemon peel.  Combine milk, eggs and oil in a medium bowl.  Add all at once to dry ingredients.  Stir until moistened; batter should be lumpy.  Fill pans 3/4 full.  Bake in preheated oven 12 to 15 minutes until golden brown.  Prepare lemon glaze: 1 cup powdered sugar, 1 Tbs lemon juice.  Drizzle glaze on warm muffins.

To freeze, line muffin cups with paper liners.  Fill with batter. Put pan in freezer.  When frozen , remove muffins from pan and transfer to freezer container.  When ready to bake, place frozen muffins into pan and place in preheated oven.  Increase baking time 3 to 6 minutes.

Name: Cranberry Cakes with Butter Sauce
Instructions: Preheat oven to 400°.  Generously grease muffin pans.  In a medium bowl, combine cranberries and sugar.  Let stand a few minutes.  Put Muffin Mix in a medium bowl.  Combine sour cream, egg and oil with cranberry mixture.  Blend well.  Add mixture all at once to Muffin Mix.  Stir until just moistened; batter should be lumpy.  Fill pans 3/4 full.  Bake 18 to 20 minutes, until golden brown.  Prepare butter sauce:  Combine butter, sugar and cream in small saucepan.  Cook over medium heat 3 to 5 minutes or until butter melts and sugar dissolves.  Do not boil.  Remove from heat.  Add nutmeg.  Serve warm on side.

Name: Zucchini Muffins
Instructions: Preheat oven to 400°.  In a medium bowl, combine Muffin Mix, sugar, nuts and cinnamon.  Combine zucchini, egg, butter and vanilla in medium bowl.  Add all at once to dry ingredients.  Stir until just moistened; better should be lumpy.  Fill pans 3/4 full.  Bake 20 to 25 minutes until golden brown.

Name: Gran Muffins
Description: Use Muffin Mix and Granola Mix
Instructions: Preheat oven to 425°.  In a bowl, combine Muffin Mix and Granola Mix.  In a bowl, combine egg, butter and milk.  Add all at once to dry ingredients.  Stir until moistened.  Fill pans 2/3 full.  Bake 15 to 20 minutes.

Name: Granola Mix
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 300°.  In a large bowl combine oats, wheat germ, coconut, sunflower seeds, sesame seeds and nuts.  Blend well.  In a large saucepan, combine brown sugar, water, oil, honey, molasses, salt, cinnamon and vanilla.  Heat until sugar is dissolved but do not boil.  Pour syrup over dry ingredients and stir until well-coated.  Spread into five 13"x9" baking pans or cookie sheets with sides.

Bake 20 to 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Bake 15 minutes longer for crunchier texture.  Cool.  Add raisins or other dried fruit, if desired.  Put in airtight containers.  Label with date and contents.  Store in a cool, dry place.  Use within 6 months.

Name: Energy Bars
Instructions:
Butter a 9" square baking pan; set aside.  In a saucepan, combine brown sugar and corn syrup.  Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture comes to a boil.  Remove from heat.  Stir in peanut butter until blended.  Stir in Granola Mix and peanuts until coated.

Press into prepared pan.  Cool to room temperature.  Cut into 3"x1" pieces.

Name: Sweet Quick-Bread Mix
Instructions: In a large bowl, stir all ingredients with wire whisk until blended.  Spoon into a 24-cup container with tight-fitting lid.  Seal container.  Label with date and contents.  Store in a cool, dry place.  Use within 6 months.

Name: Pumpkin Bread
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°.  Grease one 9"x5" loaf pan or two 7"x3" loaf pans; set aside.  In a bowl, combine Sweet Quick-Bread Mix, oil, pumpkin, eggs, milk, cinnamon, nutmeg and cloves until blended.  Add nuts and raisins.  Pour into pan.

Bake 55 to 60 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool 5 minutes.  Turn out of pan.  Cool right-side up on rack.  Prepare topping:  In medium bowl, whip cream until soft peaks form.  Gently stir in cinnamon and powdered sugar.  Refrigerate until served.  To serve, cut into 1/2" slices; spread each with whipped topping.

Name: Spicy Applesauce Bread
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 325°.  Grease one 9"x5" loaf pan or two 7"x3" loaf pans; set aside.  In a medium bowl, combine all ingredients except cream cheese, stirring to blend.  Pour into prepared pan or pans.

Bake 60 to 70 minutes, until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool on a rack 5 minutes.  Turn out pan.  Cool right-side up on rack.  Spread cooled slices with cream cheese.

Name: Zucchini Bread
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 325°.  Grease one 9"x5" loaf pan or two 7"x3" loaf pans; set aside.  In a medium bowl, combine all ingredients, stirring to blend.  Do not overmix.  Pour into pans.

Bake 60 to 75 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool on rack for 5 minutes.  Turn out pan.  Cool right-side up on rack.

Name: Poppy Seed-Lemon Bread
Instructions: Preheat oven to 325°.  Grease one 9"x5" loaf pan or two 7"x3" loaf pans; set aside.  In a medium bowl, combine first 7 ingredients stirring to blend.  Pour into prepared pans.  Bake 60 to 75 minutes until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool on a rack 5 minutes.  Turn out of pan.  Cool right-side up on rack.  Combine powdered sugar and lemon juice and stir until smooth.  Spoon Lemon Glaze over bread.

Name: Quick Mix
Instructions:
In a large bowl, sift together all dry ingredients.  Blend well.  With pastry blender, cut in shortening until mixture resembles cornmeal in texture.  Put in airtight container.  Label with date and contents.  Store in a cool, dry place.  Use within 10 to 12 weeks.

Variation:  Use 4-1/4 cups all-purpose flour and 4-1/4 cups whole-wheat flour.  Increase baking powder to 5 tablespoons.

Name: Doughnuts
Instructions:
In a deep-fryer, heat oil to 375°.  In a medium bowl, combine Quick Mix, sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg.  Blend well.  In a small bowl, mix together vanilla, egg and milk.  Add all at once to dry ingredients.  Stir until well blended.  On a lightly floured surface, knead dough about 10 minutes.  Roll out 1/2" thickness and cut with a floured doughnut cutter.  

Fry in oil about 1 minute on each side until golden brown.  Drain on paper towels.  While doughnuts cool slightly, prepare Vanilla Glaze:  Combine powdered sugar, milk and vanilla.  Dip warm doughnuts in glaze.

Name: Morning Muffins
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 425°.  Generously butter muffin pans.  Place Quick Mix in a medium bowl.  Add sugar and mix well.  In a bowl, combine egg and milk.  Add all at once to dry ingredients.  Stir until just blended.  Fill pans 2/3 full.  Bake 15 to 20 minutes until golden brown.  Serve with butter and honey, if desired.

Variations: 
Blueberry Muffins:  Gently fold 1 cup fresh, frozen or drained blueberries into batter before putting into muffin pans.
