Oatmeal or Bran Muffins:  Reduce Quick Mix to 1-3/4 cups.  Add 3/4 cup quick rolled oats or all-bran cereal to dry ingredients before adding liquid ingredients.

Apple Muffins:  Fold 1 cup grated raw apple into muffin batter before putting into muffin pans and increase baking time to 20 to 25 minutes

Fresh Peach Muffins:  Fold 1 cup diced fresh peaches into batter before putting into muffin pans and increase baking time to 20 to 25 minutes.

Cranberry Muffins:  Gently fold 2/3 cup chopped cranberries into muffin batter before putting into muffin pans.

Name: Pancakes
Instructions: Combine Quick Mix and sugar in a medium bowl.  Mix well.  Combine egg and milk in a small bowl.  Add all at once to dry ingredients.  Blend well.  Let stand 5 to10 minutes.  Cook on griddle 3 to 4 minutes until browned.

Name: Corn Bread
Instructions:
Combine Honey Butter (end of ingredients):  1 cup butter, honey and egg yolk.  Beat with mixer for 10 minutes and refrigerate.

Preheat oven to 350°.  Butter a 9" square pan.  Put Quick Mix, cornmeal and sugar in a medium bowl and stir to blend.  Combine eggs with milk in a small bowl.  Add all at once to dry ingredients.  Blend.  Add melted butter and stir to blend.  Fill pan.  Bake 35-40 minutes until golden brown.  Cut into 2-1/2" squares.  Serve hot with Honey Butter

Corn Muffins:  Fill pans 3/4 full with batter.  Bake 15 to 20 minutes until golden brown.  Makes 8 to 10 muffins.

Name: Breadsticks
Instructions: Preheat oven to 400°.  Lightly grease baking sheet.  In a medium bowl, combine Quick Mix, cornmeal and salt.  Add milk to form dough.  Knead about 12 times until dough is smooth.  Divide into 12 balls of dough.  Shape into pencil-like strands 1/2" thick.  Roll in seeds if desired.  Bake about 20 minutes until brown and crisp.  For extra crispness, turn off oven and leave in oven 5 to 10 more minutes.

Name: Biscuits
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 450°.  Grease a baking sheet.  Combine Quick Mix and milk in a medium bowl.  Stir until just blended.  Drop dough by Tbs onto baking sheet.  Bake 10 to 12 minutes until golden brown.

Variations:
Cheese and Herb: Add 1/3 cup grated Cheddar cheese and chopped parsley, chives or herbs to taste while stirring dough.

Buttermilk:  Substitute 3/4 cup buttermilk for milk

Country Dumplings:  Drop dough by Tbs. over top of boiling beef or chicken stew.  Boil gently 10 minutes uncovered.  Cover and cook over medium-high heat 10 more minutes until completely cooked.  Makes 12 dumplings.

Fruit Cobbler:  Spoon dough over top of hot, sweetened fruit or berries and bake in an 8" square pan about 20 to 25 minutes until golden brown.

Name: Rolled Biscuits
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 450°.  Combine Quick Mix and milk in a medium bowl.  Blend.  Let dough stand 5 minutes.  On a lightly floured board, knead dough about 15 times.  Roll out to 1/2" thickness.  Cut with a floured biscuit cutter.  Place about 2" apart on ungreased baking sheet.  Bake 10 to 12 minutes until golden brown.

Variations:
Cinnamon Rolls: Preheat oven to 400°.  Roll out dough to a rectangle.  Brush with melted butter.  Sprinkle with brown sugar and cinnamon.  Rolld dough jelly-roll style and cut into 1/2" slices.  Bake 10 to 15 minutes.  Glaze with mixture of powdered sugar and a few drops water.

Pizza:  Use dough as crust for 12 individual pizzas or two 12" pizzas.  Pat dough to 1/8" thickness.  Top with sauce, spices, cheese and toppings.

Meat Pinwheels: Preheat oven to 450°.  Roll out dough to a rectangle.  Chop cooked meat and combine with gravy.  Spread over dough.  Roll dough like a jelly roll and cut into 12 1" slices.  Bake 10 to 12 minutes.  Serve with gravy, soup or cheese sauce.

Pot Pie:  Use as a top crust of a chicken or meat pot pie.

Name: Self-Crust Cheese Tart
Instructions: Preheat oven to 325°.  Generously butter a 9" pie plate.  Sprinkle bottom and sides of prepared pie plate with paprika.  Layer cheese and bacon on bottom of pie plate.  Combine eggs, salt, nutmeg, milk, onion and Quick Mix in a blender.  Blend at medium speed about 1 minutes, until thoroughly mixed.  Pour over cheese and bacon in pie plate.  Bake 30 to 40 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Serve hot.

Name: Tuna-Cheese Swirls
Instructions: Preheat oven to 425°.  Butter a 1-1/2 quart casserole dish.  Combine tuna, peas, broth and rice in a medium bowl.  Pour into prepared dish.  In a small bowl, combine Quick Mix and milk.  Stir until blended.  On a lightly floured surface, knead dough gently 10 times.  Roll out to 6"x10", about 1/4" thick.  Sprinkle with cheese and roll like a jelly roll.  Seal edge.  Cut into 1/2" slices.  Place slices on top of casserole.  Bake 15 to 20 minutes until biscuits are golden brown.

Name: Hot-Fudge Pudding Cake
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°.  In an unbuttered 8" square pan, combine Quick Mix, sugar, 2 Tbs cocoa, nuts, milk and vanilla.  Blend well.  Combine brown sugar and 1/4 cup cocoa in a small bowl.  Sprinkle over top of cake mixture.  Gently pour boiling water over top of mixture.  Do not stir.  Bake 35 to 40 minutes until edges separate from pan.  Cool in pan 15 minutes before serving.

Variation:  Omit nuts and add 1 cup miniature marshmallows.

Name: Pineapple Upside Down Cake
Instructions:
Lightly grease a 13"x9" pan or two 8" square pans.  Prepare Brown Sugar Topping:  Combine brown sugar and butter.  Set aside.  Preheat oven to 350°.  Combine Quick Mix and sugar in a bowl.  Mix well.  In another bowl, combine milk, eggs and vanilla.  Add half of milk mixture to dry ingredients.  Beat 2 minutes until smooth.  Add remaining milk mixture; beat 2 to 3 minutes.

Distribute Brown Sugar Topping over bottom of pan.  Spoon pineapple smoothly over topping.  Spread batter over pineapple.  Bake 35 to 45 minutes until center is springy.  Cool in pan 10 minutes.  Invert on a serving plate.  Serve warm.

Variation:  Substitute other fruits for pineapple.  If using strawberries or raspberries, substitute granulated sugar for brown sugar.

Name: Impossible Pie
Instructions: Preheat oven to 400°.  Butter a 9" pie plate.  In a blender, combine sugar, eggs, milk, vanilla, butter, cinnamon and nutmeg.  Blend until smooth.  Add Quick Mix and blend 30 more seconds.  Pour into pie pan.  Bake 25 to 30 minutes until golden.  Cool.  Serve warm.

Name: Sunday Shortcake
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 400°.  Combine Quick Mix and sugar in a bowl.  Mix well.  In a small bowl, combine butter, milk and egg.  Add to dry ingredients.  Stir with a fork until just moistened.

On a lightly floured surface, knead 8 to 10 times.  Roll out dough to 1/2" thickness.  Cut with a lightly floured 3" round cutter.  Bake on an unbuttered baking sheet about 10 minutes until golden brown.  Cool.  Top with fruit as desired and whipped cream.

Name: All-Purpose Cake Mix
Instructions: In a large sifter, combine flour, sugar, cornstarch, baking powder and salt.  Sift in batches into a large bowl.  Use a pastry blender or heavy-duty mixer to blend in shortening until mixture resembles cornmeal in texture.  Spoon into a 20-cup container with a tight-fitting lid.  Seal container.  Label with date and contents.  Store in a cool, dry place.  Use within 10 to 12 weeks.

Name: Lemon Pound Cake
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°.  Generously grease and lightly flour one 12-cup Bundt pan; set aside.  In a large bowl, combine All-Purpose Cake Mix, shortening and sugar.  Beat with an elextric mixer.  Gradually add milk and continue beating.  Add eggs one at a time, beating well after each addition until batter is creamy.  Beat in lemon juice, lemon extract and vanilla until well blended.  Pour into pan.  Bake 1 hour and 20 to 25 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool on a rack 15 minutes.  Remove pan.

Variation:

Almond-Poppy Seed Pound Cake:  Substitute 1/4 cup milk for lemon juice.  Substitute almond extract for lemon extract.  Add 1/4 cup poppy seeds.

Name: Yellow Cake
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°.  Generously grease and lightly flour two 8" or 9" round cake pans or one 13"x9" pan; set aside.  In a large bowl, combine Mix, milk and vanilla.  Beat with electric mixer on high speed 1 minutes.  Scrape batter from side of bowl with a rubber spatula.  Beat on high 1 minutes longer.  Add eggs 1 at a time, beating well after each addition until batter is creamy.  Pour into pans.

Bake 30 to 35 minutes for 8" or 9" and bake 13"x9" for 35 to 40 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool on a rack for 10 minutes.  Invert onto rack and remove pan, if desired.  Frost when cake is completely cool.

Small Cake:  Use half the ingredients (using 2 egg yolks or whites) and bake in 8" square pan.

Variation:
White Cake:  Use only egg whites.

Name: Snack Cake Mix
Instructions: In a large bowl, combine all ingredients.  Stir with a wire whisk until blended.  Divide mixture into six portions, about 2-1/3 cups each.  Store in containers with tight-fitting lids.  Label with date and contents.  Store in a cool, dry place.  Use within 10 to 12 weeks.

Name: Applesauce Snack Cake
Instructions: Preheat oven to 325°.  Pour Mix into ungreased 8" or 9" square pan.  Set aside.  In a small bowl, combine egg, oil, applesauce, cinnamon, allspice and cloves, beating with a fork to blend.  Stir into Mix until smooth and blended.  Stir in nuts and raisins.  Bake 35 to 45 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool.

Name: Banana Snack Cake
Instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  Pour Mix into ungreased 8" or 9" square baking pan.  In a small bowl, combine remaining ingredients, beating with a fork to blend.  Stir into Mix until blended.  Bake 35 to 45 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool.

Name: Carrot Snack Cake
Instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  Pour Mix into an ungreased 8" or 9" square baking pan.  In a medium bowl, combine egg, oil, carrots, orange juice and cinnamon beating with a fork to blend.  Stir into Mix until blended.  Stir in nuts.  Bake 35 to 45 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool on rack.  In a small bowl, cream butter and cream cheese until light and fluffy.  Beat in powdered sugar and vanilla until smooth.  Set aside.  Spread frosting evenly over cooled cake.

Name: Gingerbread Snack Cake
Instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  Pour Mix into ungreased 8" or 9" square pan; set aside.  In a medium bowl, combine water, molasses, egg, oil, cinnamon, ginger and cloves.  Beat with a fork to blend.  Stir into Mix until blended.  Bake 35 to 45 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Prepare Hot Lemon Sauce:  Combine water and Mix into a small saucepan.  Bring to a boil over high heat, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat.  Add butter and stir to melt.  Serve over warm gingerbread.

Name: Oatmeal Spice Cake
Instructions: Preheat oven to 325°.  Pour rolled oats into a small bowl.  Stir in water; set aside.  Pour Mix in an ungreased 8" or 9" square pan; set aside.  In a medium bowl, combine egg, oil, cinnamon, nutmeg and vanilla.  Stir in nuts and raisins.  Beat with a fork to blend.  Stir in softened oat mixture.  Stir into Mix until evenly distributed.  Bake 45 minutes or until a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool.

Name: Peach Cobbler
Instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  In an 11"x7" pan put melted butter, peaches and nutmeg.  Stir to coat peaches.  In a medium mixing bowl, combine Mix, cinnamon, milk, oil, egg and extract.  Pour over fruit mixture in pan.  Bake for about 30 minutes or until cake is set.

Name: Double-Chocolate Snack Cake
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°.  In an ungreased 8" or 9" pan, combine Mix and cocoa powder.  In a medium bowl, combine water, egg, oil and vanilla.  Beat with a fork to blend.  Stir into cocoa mixture until smooth and blended.  Sprinkle chocolate chips and nuts evenly over top of batter.  Bake 35 to 45 minutes until surface springs back to touch.

Variation:
Bumpy-Road Snack Cake:  Omit unsweetened cocoa powder.  Substitute buttermilk for water.

Name: Buttermilk Pancake and Waffle Mix
Instructions: In a large bowl, combine all ingredients.  Stir with a wire whisk until evenly distributed.  Pour into a 12-cup container with a tight-fitting lid.  Seal container.  Label with date and contents.  Store in a cool, dry place.  Use within 6 months.

Name: Buttermilk Pancakes
Description: Use Buttermilk Pancake and Waffle Mix
Instructions: In a medium bowl, combine egg, oil and 1 cup water.  With a wire whisk, stir in Mix until blended.  Let stand 5 minutes.  Stir in additional water for a thinner batter.  Preheat griddle.  Lightly oil.  Cook pancakes.  Serve with Syrup.

Name: Buttermilk Waffles
Description: Use Buttermilk Pancake and Waffle Mix.
Instructions:
Preheat waffle maker.  In a large bowl, combine Mix, water, egg yolks and oil.  Beat with a wire whisk until just blended.  In a medium bowl, beat egg whites until stiff.  Fold into mixture.  Make waffles.

Variation:  Add 1/2 cup chopped pecans or dried blueberries to batter.

Name: Puff Pancakes
Description: Use Buttermilk Pancake and Waffle Mix
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 450°.  Put 2 Tbs. butter in each of two 9" pie plates.  Put in preheating oven to melt.  In a blender, combine eggs, milk and Mix.  Pour batter into pie plates.  Bake about 18 minutes until pancakes are puffy and browned.  DO NOT OPEN OVEN while pancakes are cooking.  Meanwhile, in a medium bowl, combine raspberries with pineapple and banana.  Spoon over pancakes.  Sprinkle with brown sugar.  Top with teaspoonfuls of sour cream.  Cut into wedges and serve immediately.

Variaton:  
Tart Lemon Topping--Sprinkle 1-1/2 tsp. lemon juice over top of each warm pancake.  Sprinkle powdered sugar over top.  Cut into wedges and serve immediately.

Name: Whole-Grain Pancake Mix
Instructions: In a large bowl, combine all ingredients.  Stir with a wire whisk until evenly distributed.  Pour into a 10-cup container with a tight-fitting lid.  Seal container.  Label with date and contents.  Store in a cool, dry place.  Use within 6 months.

Name: Whole-Grain Pancakes
Instructions: Put Mix in a small bowl.  Set aside.  In a small bowl, combine buttermilk, egg and butter.  Add all at once to dry ingredients.  Blend well.  Let stand 5 to 10 minutes.  Cook pancakes.

Name: Whole-Grain Waffles
Instructions: Preheat waffle maker.  In a large bowl, combine Mix, buttermilk, egg yolks and butter.  Beat with a wire whisk until just blended.  In a medium bowl, beat egg whites until stiff.  Fold into egg-yolk mixture.  Bake waffles.

Name: Chocolate Pudding & Pie-Filling Mix
Instructions: In a large bowl, combine all ingredients.  Stir with a wire whisk until evenly distributed.  Pour into a 6-cup container with a tight-fitting lid.  Seal container.  Label with date and contents.  Store in a cool, dry place.  Use within 3 to 4 months.

Name: Creamy Chocolate Pudding
Instructions: In a saucepan, combine Mix and milk.  Cook and stir until mixture thickens.  Remove from heat, stir in butter and vanilla.  Pour into 6 serving bowls.

Name: Chocolate Cream Pie
Instructions:
Prepare pie crust in a 9" pie plate; set aside to cool.  In a saucepan, combine Mix and milk.  Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture thickens and begins to bubble, 3 to 5 minutes.  Cook and stir 1 minute longer.

Remove from heat.  Stir in butter and vanill until blended.  Cool slightly.  Pour into pie crust; cover with plastic wrap.  Refrigerate 2 to 3 hours.  Serve with whipped cream if desired.

Variation:
Chocolate Banana Cream Pie:  Slice 2 bananas into pie crust.  Pour over mixture.

Name: Lemon Pie-Filling Mix
Instructions: In a medium bowl, combine all ingredients.  Mix well.  Put into a 1-quart airtight container.  Label with date and contents.  Store in a cool, dry place.  Use within 6 to 8 months.

Name: Lemon Pie
Instructions:
Prepare pie crust.  In a large saucepan combine Mix, 1/2 cup water and egg yolks.  Mix until smooth.  Add remaining water.  Cook over medium heat, 4 to 5 minutes, stirring constantly until mixture is thick and bubbly.

Remove from heat.  Add butter.  Stir until melted.  Cover and let cool 5 minutes.  Stir.  Pour into baked pie crust.  Cover and refrigerate 3 hours.  Top with cool whip before serving.

Variation:
Meringue Topping:  Omit cool whip.  In a deep metal or glass bowl, beat 3 egg whites until stiff, gradually adding 6 Tbs. sugar and 1/4 tsp cream of tartar.  Spread on top of warm pie, sealing to edges.  Preheat oven to 400°.  Bake 8 to 10 minutes until meringue is lightly browned.  Cool pie, then refrigerate.

Name: Vanilla Pudding & Pie-Filling Mix
Instructions: In a large bowl, combine all ingredients.  Stir with a wire whisk until blended.  Pour into a 4-cup container with a tight-fitting lid.  Seal container.  Label with date and contents.  MUST BE SHAKEN BEFORE USING FOR RECIPE.  Store in a cool, dry place.  Use within 4 months.

Name: Boston Cream Pie
Instructions:
Preheat oven ot 350°.  Prepare Yellow Cake as directed.  Bake 30 minutes until cake is lightly browned and a toothpick comes out clean.  Cool.  Cut cake in half horizontally.  Place bottom layer on a platter. 

Prepare Cream Filling: In a bowl, lightly beat egg yolk; set aside.  In a saucpan, combine Mix and milk.  Cook and stir until mixture thickens, 3 to 5 minutes.  Stirring vigorously, pour 1/2 hot milk mixture into beaten egg yolk.  Slowly stir egg mixture into remaining hot milk mixture.  Cook 1 minute longer.  Remove from heat.  Stir in butter and vanilla.  Cover with plastic wrap; cool.  Prepare Chocolate Frosting:  In a medium bowl, combine powdered sugar and water.  Beat in chocolate and butter until smooth.  Set aside.  Spread cooled filling over bottom cake layer.  Place top layer on top of filling.  Spread frosting over top.  Refrigerate 3 to 4 hours.

Name: Creamy Vanilla Pudding
Instructions:
In a medium bowl, beat egg yolks; set aside.  In a medium saucepan, combine Mix and milk.  Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture thickens and begins to bubble.  Stirring vigorously, pour about half of the hot mixture into beaten egg yolks.  Stir egg-yolk mixture into remaining hot mixture.  Cook and stir 1 minute longer.

Remove from heat.  Stir in butter and vanilla until blended.  Pour cooked pudding into 6 dessert or custard cups.  Cover each with plastic wrap and refrigerate 1 hour.

Variation:
Creamy Chocolate Pudding:  Substitute 1 cup Chocolate Pudding & Pie-Filling Mix for Vanilla.

Name: Vanilla Cream Pie
Instructions:
Prepare crust in a 9" pie plate; set aside to cool.  In a medium saucepan, combine Mix and milk.  Cook and stir over medium heat until mixture thickens and begins to bubble, 3 to 5 minutes.  Remove from heat.  Stir in butter and vanilla until blended.  Cover with plastic wrap.  Cool.

Pour into baked pie crust.  Cover and refrigerate about 2 hours.

Variations:
Banana Cream Pie:  Slice 2 ripe bananas into pie crust before adding filling.

Strawberry Cream Pie:  Stir 2 to 4 Tbs. sugar into 2 cups sliced strawberries.  Let stand 1 hour.  Drain off juice.  Spoon strawberries into pie crust.  Pour chilled filling over strawberries.  Top with cool whip.

Name: Cookie Mix
Instructions: In a large bowl, combine flour, sugar, brown sugar, salt and baking soda until well-blended.  With a pastry blender or heavy-duty mixer, cut in shortening until mixture resembles cornmeal in texture.  Put in a large airtight container.  Label with date and contents.  Store in a cool, dry place.  Use within 10 to 12 weeks.

Name: Snickerdoodles
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 400°.  In a medium bowl, combine Mix, baking soda, cream of tartar and egg.  Mix well.  Combine sugar and cinnamon in a small dish.

Shape dough into 1-1/2" balls.  Roll in sugar mixture and place 2" apart on ungreased baking sheets.  Flatten balls slightly.  Bake 8 to 10 minutes, until lightly browned with cracked tops.

Name: Chocolate-Chip Cookies
Instructions: Preheat oven to 375°.  Grease baking sheets.  In a large bowl, combine Mix, milk, vanilla and egg.  Blend well.  Stir in nuts and chocolate chips.  Drop by tsp. onto sheets.  Bake 10 to 15 minutes, until golden brown.

Name: Peanut-Butter Cookies
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 375°.  Lightly grease baking sheets.  Combine all ingredients in a medium bowl.  Blend well.  Shape dough into 1" balls.  Place on sheets and flatten with fork tines.  Bake 10 to 12 minutes, until edges are browned.

Variation:
Peanut Butter and Jelly Cookies:  On baking sheets, make indentation with thumb in center of balls.  Do not flatten.  Fill with grape jelly.

Name: Mueseli Oatmeal Mix
Instructions: Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.  Stir with a wire whisk until evenly distributed.  Pour into a 10-cup container with a tight-fitting lid.  Label with date and contents.  Store in a cool, dry place.  Use within 6 months.

Name: All-Purpose Ground-Meat Mix
Instructions:
In a large pot or Dutch oven, brown ground meat, stirring to break up meat.  Drain.  Stir in salt, celery, onion and green pepper.  Cover; simmer until vegetables are crisp-tender, about 10 minutes.  Remove from heat; set aside.

Ladle into six 2-cup freezer containers with tight-fitting lids, leaving 1/2" space at top of each.  With a knife cut through mixture in each dontainer several times to remove air pockets.  Attach lids.  Label with date and contents.  Store in freezer.  Use within 3 months.

Name: Stroganoff
Instructions: In a large saucepan, combine Mix, soups and milk.  Stir until well blended.  Simmer about 10 minutes.  Just before serving, add sour cream.  Simmer 2 minutes.  Serve over noodles.

Name: Enchilada Casserole
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 375°.  Lightly butter a 2-quart casserole.  Crush 1/2 cup of corn chips and reserve for top.  In a medium bowl, combine remaining chips, All-Purpose Ground-Meat Mix, Pinto Bean Mix and sauces.  Pour into prepared casserole.  Bake about 20 minutes, until heated through.  

Remove from oven.  Spread sour cream on top.  Sprinkle with cheese and reserved chips.  Bake 5 more minutes until cheese is melted.

Name: Mexican Delight
Instructions: Preheat oven to 400°.  Lightly butter a 13"x9" dish.  Spread beans in bottom of dish.  Spread Mix evenly over beans.  Sprinkle chiles over meat mixture.  Sprinkle with cheese.  Drizzle salsa over cheese.  Bake about 30 minutes until hot and bubbly.  Remove.  Spoon avacado onto center of casserole.  Spoon sour cream in circle around avacado.  Arrange olives on sour cream and avacado.  Tuck about 1/3 of corn chips around edge of dish with points up.  Serve with remaining corn chips.

Name: Chicken Mix
Instructions:
Combine all ingredients in a large Dutch oven.  Cover and cook over high heat until water boils.  Simmer until chicken is tender about 1-1/2 hours.  Remove from heat.  Strain broth and refrigerate until fat can be skimmed.

Cool chicken, remove and discard bones and skin.  Put chicken into six 1-pint freezer containers, leaving 1/2" space at top.  Pour skimmed chicken broth into six more 1-pint containers with 1/2" space at top.  Seal and label with date and contents.  Freeze.  Use within 3 months.  Makes 6 pints Chicken Mix and 6 pints Chicken Broth.

Name: Chicken Burgers
Instructions: Combine Mix and sauce in a medium saucepan.  Cook over medium heat about 10 minutes until heated through.  Serve over buns.

Name: Sweet and Sour Chicken
Instructions:
In a saucepan, combine 1/2 cup water, cornstarch, brown sugar and salt.  Stir until mixture is smooth.  Add reserved pineapple juice.  Cook over medium heat 5 to 7 minutes until mixture starts to thicken.  Add Mix, soy sauce and vinegar.  Cover and simmer 15 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Put chicken broth and 2 cups water in a large saucepan.  Add rice.  Cover and cook about 25 minutes.  Spray skillet with cooking spray and saute onion and green pepper until crisp-tender.  Add pineapple, onion and green onions to chicken mixture.  Cook until heated.  Before serving, stir in tomato wedges.  Serve over the hot, cooked rice.

Name: Chicken Continental
Description: Use Chicken Mix, Chicken Gravy Mix
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 375°.  Lightly butter a 2-quart casserole.  In a medium bowl, combine Chicken Gravy Mix, onion, salt, pepper, parsley, thyme and broth.  Stir until well-blended.  Add Chicken Mix and instant rice.  

Put in casserole dish.  Cover and bake about 30 minutes until rice is tender.

Name: Club Chicken Casserole
Instructions:
Lightly butter an 11"x7" baking pan.  Combine broth and rice in a saucepan.  Cook about 25 minutes until rice is tender.  Preheat oven to 350°.  Melt butter in a large saucepan.  Gradually stir in flour and salt.  Gradually add milk.  Cook over medium heat about 5 minutes, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens.  Add Mix, cooked rice, broccoli and mushrooms.  

Put in baking pan.  Top with almonds and paprika.  Bake 30 to 35 minutes, until bubbly.

Name: Mexican Chicken Bake
Description: Use Chicken Mix, Creamy Mushroom Sauce (White sauce variation) and Chicken Gravy
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°.  Lightly butter a 2-quart casserole.  In a medium bowl, combine Sauce, Gravy and milk.  Stir to blend well.  Add Mix, salt, onion, salsa and 2 cups cheese.  Layer tortilla pieces and chicken mixture alternately in prepared casserole ending with chicken mixture.  Top with remaining cheese.  Bake 35 to 45 minutes until bubbly.

For added spice, add 1/4 cup chopped, roasted green chiles.

Name: Cream of Chicken Soup
Description: Use White Sauce Mix and Chicken Mix
Instructions:
Dissolve cubes in hot water.  Combine White Sauce Mix and bouillon mixture in a large pot or Dutch oven.  Cook over low heat about 5 minutes, stirring constantly, until thick and smooth.  Add Mix, celery, onion, salt and garlic salt.  

Simmer 15 minutes, stirring constantly.  Blend in milk and egg yolk.  Simmer 5 more minutes.  Remove from heat.  Garnish with chopped chives, watercress or pimiento.

Name: Soft Chicken Taco
Instructions:
In a medium skillet over medium-high heat combine Mix, water, seasoning mix and peas.  Reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes, stirring occasionally.

Warm tortillas in microwave.  Place about 1/4 cup chicken mixture in each tortilla.  Fold in half.  Top with toppings.

Name: Five-Way Beef Mix
Description: Can be used as a meal
Instructions:
Spray cooking spray in skillet; add beef cubes and onions.  Cook until browned.  Add about 1 cup water to cubes.  Cover and simmer until tender, about 1 hour, adding more water if needed.  Or: Brown ground beef and onions in a large skillet; drain.  

Place potatoes and carrots in a 5-quart Dutch oven.  Add water to cover.  Bring to a boil.  Simmer vegetables until crisp-tender, about 15 minutes.  Stir cornstarch into 1/2 cup cold water.  Stir into vegetable mixture until slightly thickend.  Stir in remaining ingredients.  Stir in beef mixture.  Cool.

Ladle mix into four 6-cup freezer containers with tight-fitting lids, leaving 1/2" space.  Stir to remove air pockets.  Attach lids.  Label with date and contents.  Store in freezer.  Use within 2 months.

Name: Bread Basket Stew
Description: Use Five-Way Beef Mix (cubed beef) and Bread Basket Bowls.
Instructions: Prepare Bread Basket Bowls; set aside.  In a medium saucepan, combine Mix, tomato sauce, corn, mushrooms, Worcestershire sauce and bay leaf.  Bring to a boil over medium-high heat.  Cover and simmer over low heat 25 minutes.  Remove bay leaf.  Place each Bowl on a plate.  Ladle stew into bowls.

Name: Deep-Dish Pot Pie
Description: Use Five-Way Beef Mix (ground beef) and Single Freezer Pie Crust
Instructions: Preheat oven to 425°.  Turn Mix into an 8" or 9" square baking dish or a 2-1/2 quart casserole dish.  Roll out pastry to a 10" square or to fit casserole dish.  Place pastry over dish.  Trim, letting dough extend 1/2" beyond edge of dish.  Fold edge under; flute.  Cut slits in crust to let steam escape.  In a bowl, beat egg and oil with a fork or a whisk.  Brush evenly on crust with a pastry brush, covering entire crust.  Bake 45 to 60 minutes until deep golden brown.

Name: Hamburger Soup
Instructions:
In a large saucepan or Dutch oven, combine all ingredients except cheese.  Bring to a boil.  Cover; simmer 20 to 30 minutes.  Ladle into 6 to 8 soup bowls.  Garnish with Parmesan cheese.

Variation:  Substitute 2 cups water for 2 cups tomato juice.  Substitute 1 cup vermicelli for 1/4 cup rice or barley.

Name: Vegetable-Cheese Casserole
Instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  Butter a 2-1/2 quart casserole.  In a small skillet, melt butter over medium-low heat.  Stir in bread crumbs.  Cook and stir until crumbs are crisp and golden brown.  In dish, combine Mix, cheese and soup.  Top with browned crumbs.  Bake 30 minutes.

Name: Italian Cooking Sauce Mix
Instructions: Combine all ingredients in a large pot or Dutch oven.  Simmer 15 minutes.  Cool.  Put into six 2-cup freezer containers, leaving 1/2" space at top.  Seal and label containers.  Freeze.  Use within 6 months.

Name: Chicken Cacciatore
Instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  Heat oil in a skillet.  Combine flour, salt and pepper in plastic bag.  Add chicken pieces and shake to coat with mixture.  Brown chicken in oil until golden brown.  Put chicken in a 13"x9" dish.  Pour Mix over chicken.  Cover with foil.  Bake about 1 hour, until chicken is tender.

Name: Lasagna
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°.  Lightly butter a 13"x9" pan.  Spread 1/3 Mix in bottom of pan.  Cover with 1/3 noodles.  Add 1/3 ricotta cheese, thinned with water for easier spreading if necessary.  Add 1/3 mozz. cheese and 1/3 cheese mix.

Repeat layers twice, topping with Romano and Parmesan cheese.  Cover with foil.  Bake 30 to 35 minutes, until heated.  Let stand 10 minutes before serving.

Name: Spaghetti Casserole
Description: Use Italian Cooking Sauce Mix and All-Purpose Ground-Meat Mix
Instructions: Preheat oven to 300°.  Butter a 2-1/2 to 3 quart casserole dish.  Put half of spaghetti in bottom of prepared casserole.  Sprinkle with half the sugar, half the cheese, half the Meat Mix, half the cheese, then half the mushrooms.  Repeat layers.  In a small bowl, combine tomato soup and Italian Mix.  Pour over casserole.  Cover.  Bake 1-1/2 hours or until heated through.

Name: Meatball Mix
Instructions: Preheat oven to 375°.  Combine all ingredients.  Blend well.  Shape into 1-1/2 balls.  Place on ungreased baking sheet and bake 25 to 30 minutes, until browned.  Remove immediately and drain on paper towels.  When cooled, put about 20 meatballs each into four 1-quart freezer containers, leaving 1/2" space at top.  Seal and label with date and contents.  Freeze.  Use within 3 months.

Name: Swedish Meatballs
Description: Use Meatball Mix and White Sauce Mix
Instructions:
In a large saucepan combine White Sauce Mix and beef broth.  Cook over medium heat, stirring constantly, until mixture thickens.  Add mushrooms and nutmeg.  Stir in Meatball Mix and continue cooking until heated through.

While mixture is cooking, prepare noodles according to package directions.  Serve mixture over hot, drained noodles.

Name: Meatball Stew
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°.  In a medium saucepan, combine water, flour and bouillon.  Stir until well-blended.  Add tomatoes and cook about 5 minutes, until mixture thickens and boils, stirring constantly.

Add Meatball Mix, carrots, onions, celery and potatoes.  Cover and simmer 15 minutes.  Pour into a 3-quart casserole dish.  Cover and bake 1-1/2 hours.

Name: Sweet and Sour Meatballs
Instructions: In a large skillet, combine oil and pineapple juice, adding water if necessary to make 1 cup.  In a small bowl, combine cornstarch, soy sauce, vinegar, water and brown sugar.  Stir into juice mixture.  Cook over medium heat 5 to 7 minutes until thick, stirring constantly.  Add Mix, pineapple and green pepper.  Simmer 20 minutes until heated through.  Serve over rice.

Name: Cubed Pork Mix
Instructions:
Heat a large skillet, add pork cubes.  Cook until lightly browned, stirring occasionally.  Drain and reserve drippings.  Add onions.  Cook, stirring 10 to 15 minutes until onions are golden.  Sprinkle flour over pork mixture.  Stir gently until flour is absorbed, about 1 minute.  Add water to drippings to make 4 cups liquid.  Stir liquid, bouillon, salt and pepper into pork mixture.  Bring to a boil, stirring occasionally.  Cover, cook over low heat 2 hours longer or until pork is tender.

Remove from heat.  Cool.  Ladle mixture into five 2-cup freezer containers with tight-fitting lids, leaving 1/2" space at top of each.  Attach lids.  Label with date and contents.  Store in freezer.  Use within 6 months.

Name: Pork Curry
Description: Use All-Purpose Ground Meat Mix or Cubed Pork Mix
Instructions: In a large skillet, combine Mix, ketchup, water, mushrooms, curry powder, steak sauce and Worcestershire sauce.  Stirring occasionally, cook over medium heat until heated through, about 10 minutes.  Serve curry mixture over rice.  Top with chutney and peanuts.

Name: Sweet and Sour Pork
Instructions: Drain juice from pineapple into a large saucepan.  Stir in Mix, vinegar, soy sauce, brown sugar and ketchup.  Stir occasionally over medium heat about 10 minutes.  Stir in drained pineapple and pepper strips.  Simmer about 2 minutes until heated through.  Serve over rice.

Name: Cream-Cheese Pastry Mix
Instructions:
Cut eight 2" squares of plastic wrap and heavy-duty foil; set aside.  In a bowl, beat cream cheese and butter until blended.  Add flour all at once.  Knead in flour until evenly distributed.  Shape into a large ball.  Divide into 8 smaller balls.  Slightly flatten each ball.  Wrap each flattened ball in a piece of plastic wrap.  Place 1 wrapped ball on each piece of foil.  Fold foil tightly against dough, making an airtight seal.

Label each package with date and contents.  Store in freezer.  Use within 6 months.  This makes enough for 8 single-crust pies, 4 double-crust pies or 80 tart shells (10 shells per package).

Name: Almond Kringle
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°.  Roll out Mix to 14"x4".  Place rolled-out dough on a large baking sheet.  Crimp and shape sides of dough.  In a saucepan, combine water and butter.  Bring to a boil.  Add flour all at once, stir vigorously until mixture forms a ball and leaves side of pan.  Remove from heat.  Add eggs one at atime, beating well after each addition.  Beat in almond extract.  Spread mixture over pastry.  Bake 40 to 45 minutes until golden brown.  Cool 5 minutes. 

Meanwhile, prepare Kringle Icing:  Combine powdered sugar, cream, butter and almond extract and beat until smooth.  Spread over filling.  Sprinkle with almonds.  Cut inot 1-1/2" slices diagonally.

Name: Mini Fruit Tarts
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 400°.  Divide Mix into 40 pieces.  Shape into balls.  Place each ball in a mini-muffin cup.  With your thumb, press dough over bottom and sides of each cup, keeping dough an even thickness.  Bake for 10 minutes or until lightly browned.  Cool.

Cut fruit into various shapes as desired.  Prepare Fruit Glaze:  In a saucepan, combine rest of ingredients and boil 1 minute.  Cool.  Arrange fruits in tart shells.  Brush with glaze to prevent darkening or drying.  Chill until ready to serve.

Variation:
Cream Cheese Fruit Tarts:  In a small bowl, combine 6 oz. cream cheese and 2 Tbs sugar until smooth.  Stir in 6-oz container fruit-flavored yogurt.  Put a spoonful of filling into each shell before adding fruit.

Name: Lemon Tart Supreme
Description: Use Cream-Cheese Pastry Mix.  Variation from recipe, which calls for lime instead of lemon.
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 400°.  Divide Mix into 10 pieces.  Shape into balls.  Place each ball in a medium muffin cup.  With your thumbs, press dough over the bottom and sides of each cup, keeping dough at an even thickness.  Bake in preheated oven 10 minutes or until lightly browned.  Cool.

Prepare Lemon Filling: In a small bowl, beat eggs until light and pale.  Beat in sugar, juice and half of peel.  Pour into top of double boiler.  Add butter.  Cook and stir over hot water until thickened.  Remove from heat.  Stir in food coloring.  Refrigerate 1 hour.  Reserve 3 Tbs. whipped cream.  Fold remaining cream into chilled egg mixture.

Carefully remove cooled tart shells.  Spoon filling into shells.  Garnish with reserved cream and reserved lemon peel from filling.

Name: Pie-Crust Mix
Instructions:
Cut seven 12" squares of plastic wrap and heavy-duty foil; set aside.  In a bowl, combine flour and salt.  With a pastry blender or heavy duty mixer, cut in shortening until mixture resembles cornmeal in texture.  Add 1-1/4 cups water all at once.  Mix lightly with a fork until water is absorbed and mixture forms a ball.  If necessary add additional water.  

Divide dough into 7 portions.  Shape into balls.  Flatten each ball slightly.  Wrap each flattened ball in 1 pieces of plastic wrap.  Place 1 wrapped ball on each piece of foil.  Fold foil tightly against ball, making an airtight seal.

Label each package with date and contents.  Store in freezer.  Use within 10 months.  Makes enough for seven 8" or 9" single-crust pies.  If you use a 10" pie plate, divide the dough into 6 instead of 7 balls.

To Bake:  400° for 10 to 12 minutes until lightly browned.

Name: Cherry-Almond Pie
Instructions:
Drain canned cherries, reserving 1/2 cup juice.  In a medium bowl, combine fresh and canned cherries, sugar, flour, salt, butter, almond extract, 1/2 cup reserved cherry juice and food coloring.  Let stand 10 minutes.

Preheat oven to 425°.  Prepare bottom pie crust in a 9" pie plate.  Pour cherry mixture into unbaked crust.  Cover with top crust.  Cut slits in crust to let steam escape.  Trim and flute edges.  Bake about 40 minutes until evenly browned.  Prepare Almond Glaze:  In a small bowl, combine powdered sugar, almond extract and enough cream to make a thin mixture.  Brush top of hot pie with Almond Glaze.

Name: Peach Pie
Instructions:
Prepare pie crust in a 9" pie plate; set aside to cool.  In a medium saucepan, combine 1 cup crushed peaches and 1/3 cup water.  Stir constantly over medium heat until mixture begins to boil.  Cook and stir about 2 minutes longer.  Remove from heat.

In a medium bowl, combine sugar, cornstarch, salt, 1/4 cup water and lemon juice, beating with a wire whisk to blend.  Stir into cooked-peach mixture.  Cook and stir over medium heat until slightly thickened.  Stir in butter until melted.  Set aside to cool.

Arrange 3 to 4 cups sliced peaches in prepared pie crust.  Spoon cooled mixture over peaches.  Cover and refrigerate 2 hours.  To serve, cut in wedges and garnish each wdge with whipped cream.

Name: Apple Pie
Instructions:
Prepare bottom crust in a 9" pie plate.  Put apples in a large bowl.  Toss with lemon juice.  Set aside.  Preheat oven to 400°.  In a small bowl, combine flour, sugar, cinnamon and nutmeg.  Sprinkle about 1/4 cup of mixture on bottom pie crust and add the rest to the apples.  Stir to coat apples.  Fill pie crust heaping full of apple mixture.  Dot with butter.

Place top crust over fililng.  Press edges together and flute.  Cut slits in top crust to let steam escape.  Bake about 50 minutes, until crust is golden.  Serve with Hot Butter Sauce, if desired.

Hot Butter Sauce:  Combine 1/2 cup butter, 1 cup sugar and 1 cup cream or evaporated milk in a small saucepan.  Cook over medium heat 3 to 5 minutes, until butter melts and sugar dissolves.  Do not boil.  Remove from heat.  Add a dash of nutmeg.  Serve warm.

Name: Simplified Quiche
Instructions: Prepare pie crust in a 9" pie plate; set aside to cool.  Beat egg white and brush on bottom of pie crust.  Rerserve egg yolk.  Preheat oven to 375°.  In a small bowl, combine reserved egg yolk with 3 eggs, milk, salt, paprika and pepper.  Beat until blended but not frothy.  Put half of cheese in crust.  Top with bacon and onion.  Pour egg mixture over top.  Sprinkle with remaining cheese.  Bake 40 to 50 minutes or until a knife comes out clean.  Let stand 10 minutes before serving.  Serve with chicken gravy if desired.

Name: Turkey Dinner Pie
Description: Use Pie Crust Mix, Chicken Gravy (maybe)
Instructions: Prepare bottom crust in a 9" pie plate.  Preheat oven to 425°.  In a large bowl, combine turkey, gravy, carrots and peas, onions, salt, pepper, poultry seasoning and thyme.  Stir to distribute.  Pour into pastry shell.  Cover with top crust.  Trim and flute edges.  Cut slits in top crust to let steam escape.  Bake 35 to 40 minutes until golden brown.

Name: Slice & Bake Chocolate-Wafer Cookies
Description: Freezer cookies.  Can be used to make ice cream sandwiches or Chocolate-Wafer Pie Crust
Instructions:
Cut four 14"x12" pieces of waxed paper or plastic wrap; set aside.  In a bowl, cream butter, sugar, eggs and vanilla until light and fluffy.  In a bowl, combine flour, baking soda and cocoa powder.  Stir flour mixture into sugar mixture until evenly distributed.

Divide dough into 4 pieces.  Shape each piece into an 8"x10" woll.  Wrap each roll in waxed paper or plastic wrap.  Place in plastic freezer container with a tight-fitting lid or wrap airtight in a 14"x12" piece of heavy-duty foil.  Label with date and contents.  Store in freezer.  Use within 6 months.  Makes 4 rolls or about 12 dozen cookies.

To bake:  Preheat oven to 350°.  Lightly grease 2 large baking sheets.  Slice 1 roll dough into 1/4" slices.  Arrange slices on prepared baking sheets about 1/2" apart.  Bake 8 to 10 minutes until cookies are set on edges and slightly firm on top.  Remove cookies and cool on wire racks.  Makes about 36 cookies.

Name: Slice & Bake Gingersnap Cookies
Description: Freezer cookies.  Can be used to make gingerbread boys.
Instructions:
Cut four 14"x12" pieces of waxed paper or plastic wrap; set aside.  In a bowl, cream shortening and sugar.  Beat in egg and molasses; set aside.  In a bowl, combine flour, baking soda, salt, ginger and cinnamon.  Gradually stir flour mixture into egg mixture until blended. 

Divide dough into four pieces.  Shape each piece into a 8" to 10" roll.  Wrap rolls in waxed paper or plastic wrap.  Place in a plastic freezer container with a tight-fitting lid, or wrap airtight in a 14"x12" piece of heavy-duty foil.  Label with date and contents.  Store in freezer.  Use within 6 months.  Makes 4 rolls of dough, or about 12 dozen cookies.

To Bake:  Preheat oven to 350°.  Cut slightly thawed dough into 1-1/3" thick slices.  Cut each slice into fourths.  Roll each piece into a ball.  Roll each ball in sugar.  Place balls on an ungreased baking sheet about 1-1/2" apart.  Bake 8 to 10 minutes until set around edges with cracked tops.  Don't overbake.  Remove cookies from baking sheets and cool on wire racks.  Makes about 30 to 36 cookies.

Name: Slice and Bake Oatmeal Cookies
Description: Freezer Cookies.  Can substitute chocolate chips for raisins or just add.
Instructions:
Cut four 14"x12" pieces of waxed paper or plastic wrap.  Cream butter, sugar and brown sugar in a large bowl until smooth.  Beat in eggs and vanilla until light and fluffy.  In a medium bowl, combine flour, oats, salt, baking soda and baking powder.  Stir flour mixture into egg mixture until blended.  Stir in nuts and raisins.

Divide dough into four pieces.  Shape each piece into a 8" to 10" roll.  Wrap rolls in waxed paper or plastic wrap.  Place in a plastic freezer container with a tight-fitting lid, or wrap airtight in a 14"x12" piece of heavy-duty foil.  Label with date and contents.  Store in freezer.  Use within 6 months.  Makes 4 rolls of dough, or about 12 dozen cookies.

To Bake:  Preheat oven to 375°.  Lightly grease 2 large baking sheets; set aside.  Cut dough into 1/4" slices.  Place slices about 1" apart on prepared baking sheets.  Bake 10 to 12 minutes until edges are light brown and centers are slightly set.  Cool about 2 minutes on baking sheet.  Remove cookies and cool on wire racks.  Makes about 36 cookies.

Name: Slice & Bake Peanut-Butter Cookies
Instructions:
Cut four 14"x12" pieces of waxed paper or plastic wrap; set aside.  Cream shortening, sugar, brown sugar and peanut butter in a large bowl.  Beat in vanilla and eggs until light and fluffy.  In a large bowl, combine flour and baking soda.  Gradually stir flour mixture into egg mixture until blended.

Divide dough into four pieces.  Shape each piece into a 8" to 10" roll.  Wrap rolls in waxed paper or plastic wrap.  Place in a plastic freezer container with a tight-fitting lid, or wrap airtight in a 14"x12" piece of heavy-duty foil.  Label with date and contents.  Store in freezer.  Use within 6 months.  Makes 4 rolls of dough, or about 12 dozen cookies.

To Bake:  Preheat oven to 350°.  Cut dough into 1" thick slices.  Cut each slice into fourths.  Roll each piece inot a ball.  Place balls on an ungreased baking sheet about 1-1/2" apart.  Use fork tines to flatten coolies in a criss-cross design.  Bake 8 to 10 minutes until lightly browned around edges.  Remove cookies from baking sheets and cool on wire racks.  Makes about 36 cookies.

Name: Slice & Bake Sugar Cookies
Instructions:
Cut four 14"x12" pieces of waxed paper or plastic wrap; set aside.  In a large bowl, cream butter and sugar.  Beat in eggs, vanilla and lemon extract until light and fluffy.  In a large bowl, combine flour and baking soda.  Gradually stir flour mxiture into egg mixture until blended.

Divide dough into four pieces.  Shape each piece into a 8" to 10" roll.  Wrap rolls in waxed paper or plastic wrap.  Place in a plastic freezer container with a tight-fitting lid, or wrap airtight in a 14"x12" piece of heavy-duty foil.  Label with date and contents.  Store in freezer.  Use within 6 months.  Makes 4 rolls of dough, or about 12 dozen cookies.

To bake:  Preheat oven to 350°.  Lightly grease 2 large baking sheets.  Cut dough into 1/4" slices.  Place slices on sheets about 1/2" apart.  Sprinkle slices lightly with sugar, if desired.  Bake 8 to 10 minutes until edges start to brown.  Remove cookies from baking sheets and cool on wire racks.  Makes about 36 cookies.

Name: Beef Gravy Mix
Instructions:
Combine milk powder, flour, bouillon granules, thyme, onion powder and sage.  Stir with a wire whisk to blend.  Use a pastry blender or 2 knives to cut in butter until evenly distributed.  Drizzle brown sauce for gravy over mixture.  Stir with a wire whisk until blended.  Spoon into a 3-cup container with a tight-fitting lid.  Label with date and contents.  Store in refrigerator.  Use within 4 to 6 weeks.

To make Gravy:  Pour 1 cup cold water into a small saucepan.  Use a whisk to stir 1/2 cup Beef Gravy Mix into water.  Stir constantly over medium heat until gravy is smooth and slightly thickend, 2 to 3 minutes.  Makes about 1 cup.

Name: Cookie Crust Fruit Tart
Instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  Press thawed dough into a 12" quiche pan with removable bottom or pizza pan to 1/4" thickness.  Make rim around edge of cookie.  Bake 15 to 20 minutes until edges brown.  Cool.  Prepare Cream-Cheese Filling:  In a small bowl, mix cream cheese, sugar and vanilla until smooth.  Spread on top to within 1/2" of edges.  Prepare Fruit Glaze:  In a saucepan, combine cornstarch, orange juice, water, sugar and lemon juice and boil 1 minute.  Cool.  Set aside.  Top filling with concentric circles of assorted fruits.  Brush fruit with Fruit Glaze.  Cover with plastic wrap and chill.

Name: Tasty Beef Birds
Instructions:
In a medium bowl, combine breadcrumbs, cheese, butter and green onions.  Arrange steaks on a flat surface.  Spread evenly with breadcrumb mixture.  Roll up jelly-roll fashion.  Fasten with a wooden pick or skewer.  Heat oil in a medium skillet.  Add rolled steaks.  Cook over medium heat until browned.

In a small saucepan, blend Mix and water.  Stir over medium heat with a wire whisk until smooth and slightly thickened.  Pour gravy over steaks.  Cover and simmer 25 to 30 minutes until steaks are tender.

Name: Smothered Hamburger Patties
Description: Use Beef Gravy Mix and Creamy Mushroom Sauce
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°.  Form ground beef into 8 to 10 patties.  In a large skillet, melt shortening.  Dip each patty in flour, coating both sides.  Sear in hot shortening, turning once.  Arrange seared patties in a 13"x9" baking dish.

In a medium saucpan, combine sauce, water and Mix.  Stir with a wire whisk over medium heat until slightly thickened.  Pour evenly over meat.  Cover and bake 1 hour.

Name: Chicken Gravy Mix
Instructions:
Combine milk powder, flour, bouillon, sage, thyme and pepper.  Stir with a wire whisk until blended.  Use a pastry blender or 2 knives to cut in butter until evenly distributed.  Spoon into a 3-cup container with a tight-fitting lid.  Label with date and contents.  Store in refrigerator.  Use within 4 to 6 weeks.

Chicken Gravy:  Pour 1 cup cold water into a saucepan.  Use a whisk to stir in 1/2 cup Mix.  Stir constantly over medium heat until gravy is smooth and slightly thickened, 2 to 3 minutes.  Makes about 1 cup.

Name: White Sauce Mix
Instructions:
Combine dry milk, flour and salt.  Mix well.  With a pastry blender, cut in butter until mixture resembles fine crumbs.  Put in a large airtight container.  Label with date and contents.  Store in refrigerator.  Use within 2 months.

Basic White Sauce:  In a small saucepan, combine 1/2 cup White Sauce Mix and 1 cup cool water.  For thinner sauce, decrease Mix to 1/4 cup.  For thick sauce, increase mix to 3/4 cup.  Cook over low heat until smooth, stirring constantly.  Season with pepper, herbs and spices if desired.  Makes about 1-1/2 cups sauce.

Suggestions:  You could add 1 cup cooked vegetables and create your own cream soups.  Substitute milk, tomato juice or stock for all or part of water.

Variations:
Cheese Sauce:  Add 1/2 to 1 cup shredded Cheddar cheese after mixture thickens.  Stir until cheese is melted.

Mushroom Sauce:  Add 1/2 cup chopped fresh mushrooms and 1 tsp. Worcestershire sauce.

Name: Eastern Corn Chowder
Instructions:
Cook bacon until crisp.  Crumble and set aside.  Reserve 1 Tbs. bacon drippins in pan.  Add onion and cook until light brown.  Add potatoes and water to cover.  Cook 10 to 15 minutes, until potatoes are cooked.

Combine milk and Mix in a saucepan.  Stirring constantly, cook over low heat until thick and smooth.  Stir in corn, salt and pepper.  Add to potato mixture and heat through 10 minutes.  Top each serving with crumbled bacon and butter.

Name: New England Clam Chowder
Instructions: Drain clams, reserving juice.  In a large saucepan, combine clam juice, onions, celery and potatoes.  Add enough water to cover vegetables.  Cook about 15 minutes until tender.  While vegetables are cooking, combine Mix and milk in a large pot or Dutch oven.  Cook over low heat until thick and smooth, stirring constantly.  Add clams, undrained vegetables and sugar.  Heat about 15 minutes.  Add salt and pepper to taste.

Name: Broccoli Cheese Soup in Bread Bowls
Instructions:
In a 4-quart saucepan, put broccoli, potatoes, carrot and onion.  Add chicken broth to cover vegetables.  If more liquid is needed to cover vegetables, add water.  Cook over medium heat 15 to 20 minutes until vegetables are tender. 

In a medium bowl, combine Mix and milk.  Add mixture to cooked vegetables, stirring constantly, 2 to 3 minutes until thickened.  Stir in cheese until melted.  Add nutmeg, salt and pepper to taste.

Slice tops off of rolls.  Scoop out soft bread from inside of roll leaving crusty shell.  Spoon soup into bread bowls.  Replace top of bread or serve to side of soup.

Name: Chili Seasoning Mix
Instructions:
Combine all ingredients in a small bowl until evenly distributed.  Spoon mixture onto a 6" square of aluminum boil and fold to make aritight.  Label with date and contents.  Store in a cool, dry place.  Use within 6 months.  Makes 1 package or about 1/4 cup.

Chili:  In a skillet over medium heat, brown 1 pound ground beef.  Drain.  Add 31 oz. canned kidney beans (drained), 32 oz canned tomatoes and 1 pkg. Mix.  Cover, reduce heat and simmer 10 minutes.  Makes 4 to 6 servings.

Name: Spaghetti Seasoning Mix
Instructions:
Combine all ingredients in a small bowl until evenly distributed.  Spoon mixture onto a 6" square of aluminum foil and fold to make airtight.  Label with date and contents.  Store in a cool, dry place.  Use within 6 months.  Makes 1 package or 1/3 cup Mix.

Spaghetti Sauce:  Brown 1 pound ground beef in medium skillet over medium-high heat.  Drain.  Add 16 oz canned tomato sauce, 6 oz canned tomato paste and 2-3/4 cups tomato juice or water.  Stir in 1 pkg. Mix.  Reduce heat and simmer 30 minutes, stirring occasionally.  Makes 4 to 6 servings.

Name: Chicken Continental Seasoning Mix
Instructions:
Combine all ingredients in a large bowl.  Stir until evenly distributed.  Put mixture in foil packet or plastic bag.  Label with date and contents.  Store in a cool, dry place.  Use within 6 to 8 months.  Makes 1 package.

Chicken Continental Rice:  Combine 1 pkg. Mix, 2 cups cold water, 1 cup rice and 1 Tbs butter in a medium saucepan.  Bring to a boil over high heat.  Cover, reduce heat and cook 20 minutes or until liquid is absorbed.  Makes 4 to 6 servings.

Name: Pinto Bean Mix
Instructions:
Wash and sort beans.  In a large pot or Dutch oven, combine beans and enough water to cover.  Bring to a boil.  Boil 2 minutes.  Remove from heat; cover and let stand 1 hour.

Drain and discard soaking water from beans.  Rinse beans and return to cooking pot.  Add 10 cups water, onions, garlic, butter, salt and pepper.  Bring to a boil.  Reduce heat and simmer about 2 hours until beans are tender.  Cool.

Ladle into 3 or 4 cup freezer containers with tight-fitting lids.  Leave 1/2" space at top of each.  Cut through mixture with a knife several times to remove air pockets.  Label with date and contents.  Store in freezer.  Use within 6 months.

Name: Refried Beans
Instructions: Spray a medium skillet with cooking spray.  Drain any excess liquid from Mix and mash with fork or in a food processor until partially smooth.  Pour mashed bean mixture into heated skillet and stir until heated through.  Top with salsa.

Name: Cheesecake
Instructions:
Prepare Crust in springform pan, set aside ot cool.  Preheat oven to 325°.  Beat together cream cheese, sugar, eggs, vanilla, juice and peel until very smooth.  Spoon into cooled crust.  Place in oven and bake 1 hour 10 to 1 hour 20 minutes.

Prepare Sour Cream Topping:  Combine sour cream, sugar and vanilla.  Blend well.  Spread topping on cheesecake and continue to bake 7 to 10 minutes more or until topping is set.  Cool.  When completely cool, cover with plastic wrap and refrigerate 8 to 24 hours.  To serve, remove pan side.  Top cheesecake with pie filling.

Name: Whole Wheat Pizza Crust
Instructions:
In a large bowl, dissolve sugar in water.  Sprinkle yeast over top and let stand for 10 minutes until foamy.  Stir in oil and salt then mix in ww flour and 1 cup regular flour until dough starts to come together.  Tip dough out onto foured surface with remaining flour and knead until all of the flour has been absorbed and the ball becomes smooth, about 10 minutes.  Place dough in oiled bowl and turn to coat.  Cover loosely with a towel and let stand in a warm place until doubled in size, about 1 hour.

Tip dough onto lightly floured surface and divide into 2 pieces.  Form into a tight ball.  Let rise for about 45 minutes or until doubled.  Preheat oven to 425°.  Roll ball of dough with a rolling pin until it will not stretch any further.  With fists, gently pull edges outward while rotating crust.  When circle is desired size, place on a well-oiled pizza pan.  Top pizza with favorite toppings.  Bake 16 to 20 minutes until crust is crisp and golden at the edges and cheese is melted on top.

Name: Whole Wheat Bread
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 350°.  Mix yeast with 2 Tbs lukewarm water.  Set aside.  Mix 1-1/4 cup hot water with 1-3/4 cup flour.  To flour mixture, add oil, honey and 1/4 cup more flour and salt and mix.  Add yeast mixture.  Add 1 cup more whole wheat flour if needed.  Knead 10 minutes.  Place dough into loaf pans.  Let rise in a warm place about 35 minutes or 1/3 in bulk.  Bake for 35 to 40 minutes.

Note:  This is a modification from the original recipe, which made 4 loaves.  The measurements and modifications are as follows:

15 cups WW flour, 2/3 cup oil, 2 Tbs salt, 2 Tbs yeast, 2/3 cup honey.  Mix yeast with 1/2 cup lukewarm water.  Mix 5 cups hot water to 7 cups flour.  Add 1 more cup flour.  Add 4 or 5 cups more at end of mixing.

Name: Cheese Ball
Instructions:
Mix all ingredients together and form into round mound on plate or can be formed into holiday shapes.  Serve with crackers.

Note:  Can garnish with 1/4 cup pecans or walnuts (finely chopped)

Name: Cream Cheese Ball
Instructions: Mix cream cheese, juice, sauce and cheese well.  Add variety of onions, shredded cheeses and other desired ingredients.  Mix well again, shape into a ball and chill overnight.  Roll in crushed nuts or crushed cereal.

Name: Cheese Ball 2
Instructions: In small bowl, combine green pepper, onion and butter; cover.  Microwave at high for 30 to 45 seconds or until vegetables are tender-crisp, stirring once.  Place cream cheese in large bowl.  Stir in vegetables and remaining ingredients except pecans.  Shape into ball.  Wrap in plastic wrap.  Chill 2 to 3 hours.  Unwrap; roll in pecans.

Name: Cheese Puffs
Instructions: Bring water to a boil in small saucepan.  Keeping pan over heat, add butter.  After butter is melted, add flour and stir into a ball that sticks together.  Remove from heat and beat in eggs until mixture is smooth. Mix in grated cheese.  Drop by tsp. onto lightly-greased cookie sheet.  Each ball of dough should be about the size of a walnut.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes or until golden brown.  Remove from cookie sheet and cool completely.  Split open and fill with tuna, ham or chicken salad.

Name: Apple Dip
Instructions: Mix cream cheese, brown sugar and vanilla until smooth.  Serve apples with dip.

Name: Caramel Apple Dip
Instructions: Combine first 4 ingredients and beat well.  Rinse apple wedges in pineapple juice.  Arrange wedges around bowl to dip.

Name: Cheesecake Cream Dip
Instructions: Combine ingredients.  Serve with fresh fruit cut into bite-sized pieces for dipping.

Name: Artichoke Dip
Instructions: Mix well.  Bake in slightly greased casserole dish for 20 minutes at 325°.  Serve with Triscuits.

Name: Hot Beef Dip
Instructions: Mix everything together but dried beef.  After mixing, add dried beef.  Put in casserole dish.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.  Serve with crackers.

Name: Hot Carrot Dip
Instructions: Mix all ingredients and put into a 10" quiche dish.  Bake at 350° for 15 to 20 minutes, until hot and bubbly.  Serve with crackers.

Name: Guacamole
Instructions: Mash the avacado with juice and onion.  Stir in tomato and salt.

Name: Mexican Dip
Instructions: Blend cream cheese, cheddar cheese and sour cream until fluffy.  Add seasoning and eggs, one at a time, beating until fluffy.  Bake in 9"x13" pan or springorm pan for 40 minutes at 350°.  Cool 3 to 8 hours.  Top with sour cream and salsa.  Serve with chips.

Name: Taco Dip
Instructions: Brown beef and add seasoning.  Spread sour cream on botom of 8"x11" baking pan.  Layer beef over sour cream.  Sprinkle cheese on top.  Bake in 350° oven until cheese is thoroughly melted.  Serve hot with chips.

Name: Caramel Corn
Instructions: Heat oven to 250°.  Place popcorn on 10"x15" jellyroll pan.  In a large saucepan, combine brown sugar, butter and corn syrup.  Bring to a boil over medium heat.  Boil for 2 minutes, stirring constantly.  Remove from heat.  Add baking soda and vanilla; mix thoroughly.  Pour over popcorn; mix well.  Bake for 35 minutes.  Stir after baking 15 minutes.  Stir again after 30 minutes.  Remove from sheet.  Pour onto foil to cool.  Store in airtight container.

Name: Caramel Crunch
Instructions: Boil butter, brown sugar and syrup.  Remove from heat; add baking soda.  In brown paper sack, mix Crispix, pretzels and peanuts.  Add caramel mixture to brown bag and stir.  Microwave 4 minutes, stopping every minute to stir.  Spread on greased waxed paper to cool.

Name: Crispy Caramel Snack Mix
Instructions: Heat butter, syrup and sugar in microwave 2 minutes.  Stir, then heat 2 more minutes.  Mix in baking soda and vanilla.  Pour all cereal into large paper bag.  Pour the butter mixture over cereal; shake gently.  Add nuts, shake again.  Microwave mix in paper bag 3 minues, stopping to shake after every minute.  Spread on waxed paper for 12 hours, then store in an airtight container.

Name: Crispix Mix
Instructions: Boil butter, brown sugar and syrup for 1-1/2 minutes.  Add baking soda.  Divide Crispix into 2 brown grocery sacks.  Add 1 can peanuts to each.  Pour 1/2 of mixture over each.  Microwave for 4 minutes on high, shaking every minute.  Add M&Ms when cooled.

Name: Crispix Snack Mix
Instructions: Mix Crispix and peanuts in a large bowl.  Bring brown sugar, butter and corn syrup to a boil on stove.  Boil 2 minutes.  Remove from heat.  Add baking soda and stir until foamy.  Pour over cereal and peanuts.  Put in microwave for 5 minutes, stirring every 1-1/2 minutes.  Add M&Ms.  Spread out onto cookie sheet to cool, stirring occasionally.

Name: Cheesy Bacon Bites
Instructions: Preheat oven to 350°.  Combine cream cheese, bacon, onion and pepper in bowl.  Separate roll into 2 rectangles.  Pinch seams together.  Spread cheese mixture on each rectangle.  Roll up, starting at longest side and seal.  Cut each roll into 16 slices.  Place slices, cut-side down, on flat cookie sheet or baking stone.  Bake for 15 minutes or until golden brown.  Serve warm.

Name: Rosy Raspberry Fizz
Instructions: Mash raspberries with a fork in a large bowl until raspberries are blended with their juice.  Add pineapple juice, ice cream and sherbet.  Stir well.  Slowly pour cream soda into ice cream mixture.  Stir well.  Pour into glasses.

Name: Orange Julius
Instructions: Combine all ingredients in blender.  Blend until smooth.

Name: Frozen Fruit Slush
Instructions: Stir together and freeze in large bowl or individual cups.  Remove from freezer before serving so it is slushy.

Name: Fruit Cup Slush
Instructions: In a small saucepan, combine water and sugar.  Bring to boiling.  Cool.  Mix fruit, then add cooled syrup and ginger ale.  Freeze in serving cups.  Remove from freezer 1 hour before serving.  Makes 36 (1/2 cup) servings.

Name: Rise 'N Shine Shake
Instructions: In blender, combine strawberries, banana, milk, yogurt and honey.  Cover; blend until thick and smooth.  Pour into chilled glasses.

Name: Church Biscuit Mix
Instructions:
Sift dry ingredients together 3 times.  Cut in shortening until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.  Store in airtight container for 6 months.

To Bake:  Combine 3 cups Mix and 2/3 cup milk.  Bake at 450° for 10 minutes.  Makes 18 biscuits.

Name: Sourdough Biscuits
Description: Can be made in advance and put in fridge
Instructions:
Dissolve yeast in warm water.  Add oil, sugar and buttermilk.  In another bowl, sift together flour baking powder and salt.  Combine with liquid mixture.  If dough is not stiff enough to handle, you may add more flour.  Preheat oven to 400°.  Roll dough onto a slightly floured board and cut into round biscuits.  Bake for 20 minutes.  

Dough may be kept in refrigerator for up to 2 weeks.  Grease dough and place in greased bowl.  Cover and refrigerate.

Name: Almond Bread
Instructions:
Butter a bread pan.  Sprinkle with sugar.  Combine all ingredients except almonds and pour batter into bread pan.  Sprinkle almonds on top.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour or until done.

Glaze:  Combine 1/2 cup powdered sugar, 1 Tbs cream or milk and 1 tsp. almond extract.  Stir well.  Drizzle over cooled bread.

Name: Brown Bread
Instructions: Combine all ingredients except buttermilk.  Mix, using wire whisk.  Stir in raisins, then buttermilk all at once.  Knead 8 times.  Pat into 8" round on greased cookie sheet.  Cut a cross, across the top.  Brush with milk.  Bake at 475° for 40 minutes.

Name: Buttermilk Rolls
Instructions:
Warm buttermilk (do not boil) and melt butter in it.  Add baking soda.  Dissolve yeast in warm water.  Add all other ingredients including yeast.  Blend together using a mixer or by hand until all is thoroughly blended.  Cover dough in refrigerator overnight, leaving space for dough to rise.  Shape and place in greased pan.  Let rise until double.  Bake at 350° for 20 minutes.

May use for cinnamon rolls, dinner rolls or coffecakes.

Name: Chocolate Chip Banana Bread
Instructions: Cream butter and sugar.  Add eggs.  Stir in dry ingredients.  Add bananas.  Stir in chocolate chips.  Put in a greased loaf pan.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

Name: English Muffin Bread
Instructions: Combine 3 cups flour, yeast, sugar, salt and baking soda.  Heat the liquids until very warm.  Add to the dry mixture.  Beat well.  Stir in rest of flour to make a stiff batter.  Spoon into 2 (4-1/2"x8-1/2") pans that have been greased and sprinkled with cornmeal.  Sprinkle tops with cornmeal.  Cover and let rise in a warm spot for 45 minutes.  Bake in 400° oven for 25 minutes.  Remove from pans immediately and cool on a rack.

Name: Hawaiian Sweet Bread
Instructions: In a large bowl, stir yeast into juice until dissolved.  Let stand until foamy, 5 to 10 minutes.  Add sugar, potatoes, eggs, 1/4 cup butter, salt, vanilla, ginger and 2 to 2-1/2 cups flour.  Beat at medium speed 4 minutes.  Stir in enough flour to make stiff batter.  Cover with slightly-damp towel.  Let rise in warm place until double, about 1 hour.  Grease 2 loaf pans or 2 (2-quart) casserole dishes and set aside.  Stir down batter.  Turn into pans.  Butter fingers and 2 (12") squares of waxed paper.  Cover bread with waxed paper.  Let rise until double.  Preheat oven to 375°.  Bake 30 to 40 minutes or until it sounds hollow when tapped on bottom.  To brown bottom of loaf, remove from pan and place on rack 5 more minutes.

Name: Honey Whole-Wheat Bread
Instructions: Combine 1/2 cup water and yeast in bowl.  Stir in dissolved yeast.  Melt shortening in 6-quart pan.  Add honey and rest of water to shortening.  Mix WW flour, potatotes, dry milk and salt.  Add to pan and beat until smooth.  Add yeast mixture and beat until smooth.  With a wooden spoon, mix in enough white flour to make a dough that cleans the pan.  Knead on lightly floured board until smooth and satiny and small blisters appear, 8 to 10 minutes.  Place in greased bowl; turn dough to grease top.  Let rise until double, 1 to 1-1/2 hours.  Punch down; divide into thirds, cover, let rest for 5 minutes.  Shape into 3 loaves; place in pans and brush with melted butter.  Bake at 400° for 50 minutes.  Remove from pans and cool.

Name: Irish Soda Bread
Instructions:
In medium mixing bowl, stir together flour, baking powder, baking soda and salt.  Cut in butter until mixture resembles coarse crumbs.  Make a well in center of mixture.  In small mixing bowl, combine egg white and buttermilk.  Add all at once to dry mixture.  Stir just until moistened.  On a lightly floured surface, knead dough 10 to 20 strokes until nearly smooth.  Shape into 7" round loaf.  Spray baking sheet with cooking spray.  Place bread dough on baking sheet.  With sharp knife, make 2 slashes on top to form an X.  Bake in 375° oven about 30 minutes or until golden.  Serve warm.

WW Raisin Soda Bread:  Prepare as above except substitute 1 cup whole wheat flour for 1 cup all-purpose flour.  Add 1/4 cup raisins to flour mixture before adding liquid ingredients.

Name: Spoonbread
Instructions: Dissolve yeast into warm water with sugar.  Mix all ingredients together; let rise.   Bake 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.  Great for pizza, cinnamon rolls, rolls, etc.

Name: Monkey Bread
Instructions: Cut biscuits into quarters.  Combine 1 Tbs cinnamon and 2/3 cup sugar.  Coat biscuits with cinnamon-sugar mixture.  Place biscuit pies in 9"x13" pan.  Melt butter, 1 cup sugar and 1 Tbs sugar.  Pour over top of biscuits.  Bake at 350° for 30 to 35 minutes.  Turn upside-down on a cookie sheet to let topping drizzle down on biscuits.

Name: Almond Poppy Seed Bread
Instructions:
Mix ingredients together; beat 1 to 2 minutes.  Pour into greased loaf pans.  Bake 1 hour at 350°.  Cool a few minutes in pans.

Glaze:
1/2 tsp butter flavoring
1/2 tsp vanilla
1/2 tsp almond extract
3/4 cup powdered sugar
1/4 cup orange juice

Beat all ingredients together until smooth.  Poke warm loaves, using fork, all over tops.  Pour glaze over warm loaves.  Remove from pans and cool.

Name: Pumpkin Bread
Instructions: Sift together all dry ingredients and add oil, eggs, water and pumpkin.  Mix until smooth.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour.

Name: Pumpkin Bread 2
Instructions: Sift together dry ingredients into mixing bowl.  Make a well and add all remaining ingredients.  Mix until smooth.  Pour into loaf pan that has been greased and floured.  Bake at 350° for 1 hour or until done.

Name: Whole Wheat Bread
Instructions: Mix honey, butter and water in large bowl until dissolved.  Let stand until water cools to lukewarm.  Add yeast and stir.  Let stand 8 to 10 minutes to sponge.  Add wheat germ and all flour.  Knead together.  Place dough in greased bowl to rise.  Grease top of dough and cover lightly with plastic wrap.  Allow dough to rise for 1 hour then punch down.  Knead a little more then separate into 3 loaves.  Place each loaf in greased loaf pan; grease the top of dough and cover lightly with plastic wrap.  Allow dough to rise another 1 to 1-1/2 hours.  Bake 20 to 25 minutes at 350°.

Name: Whole Wheat Honey Bread
Instructions: Mix 3 cups flour and yeast.  Heat; stir milk, honey, shortening and salt, just until warm and shortening almost melts.  Add to flour mixture.  Beat on low speed for 30 seconds.  Stir in WW flour and as much remaining all-purpose flour as possible.  Turn out on a floured surface.  Knead in enogh remaining flour to make moderately-stiff dough that is smooth, 6 to 8 minutes.  Place in greased bowl; turn once.  Cover.  Let rise in warm place until double, 1 to 1-1/2 hours.  Punch down; divide in half.  Cover.  Let rest 10 minutes.  Shape into loaves.  Place into 2 greased 5"x9"x3" loaf pans.  Cover.  Let rise until nearly doubled, about 1 hour.  Bake in 375° for 35 to 40 minutes.

Name: Coffeecake
Instructions:
Mix sugar, butter and egg.  Stir in milk, flour, baking powder and salt.  Spread a little over half of batter in 9"x12" pan, then spread half of streusel mixture followed by remaining batter and remaining streusel.  Bake 25 to 30 minutes at 350°.  When cake is cool, glaze with 3/4 cup powdered sugar mixed with enough water to spread.

Streusel Mixture: 
2/3 cup brown sugar
1/4 cup flour
1 Tbs cinnamon
1/4 cup butter, softened

Mix.  Should be crumbly.

Name: Sour Cream Coffeecake
Instructions: Sift together flour, sugar, baking powder and salt.  In a separate bowl, mix together eggs, baking soda and sour cream.  Add to the flour mixture.  Bake in a 6"x10" pan at 350° for 25 to 30 minutes.  Mix topping ingredients.  After removing the cake from the oven, add the topping while the cake is still warm.

Name: Sour Cream Coffeecake
Instructions: Cream butter, sugar, eggs and vanilla.  Sift flour, baking powder and salt.  Add to creamed mixture.  Fold in sour cream.  Pour half mixture into greased and floured bundt pan.  Make topping.  Top with half mixture of topping.  Repeat layers.  Swirl batter with knife.  Bake at 350° for 50 to 60 minutes.  Cool slightly and turn out of pan.

Name: Overnight Coffeecake
Instructions: Cream first 3 ingredients.  Add eggs; beat well.  Add baking powder, salt, baking soda, cinnamon and powdered milk.  Add buttermilk and flour.  Put in greased 9"x13" pan.  Blend last 3 ingredients and sprinkle over top of cake.  Refrigerate overnight.  Bake at 350° for 35 minutes.

Name: Doughnuts
Instructions: Dissolve yeast in 1/2 cup warm water.  With mixer, mix 6 cups flour with rest of ingredients, except hot water.  Add water and rest of flour to make a stiff dough.  Knead; let rise until double in bulk.  Roll and cut out for doughnuts.  Let rise until light and fry.

Name: Dutch Letters
Instructions: Mix lard, butter and flour together.  Let set overnight.  Make 14 piles of dough.  Roll out each pile with a rolling pin.  Wet edges of dough so they'll stick.  Top with filling and fold in half lengthwise.  Prick top with fork and brush with some egg whites and sugar mixed together.  Place on greased cookie sheet.  Bake at 350° for 30 minutes.

Name: English Muffins
Instructions: Scald milk.  Stir in sugar, salt and oil.  Set aside to cool to 105° to 115°.  Sprinkle yeast into warm water.  Stir to dissolve.  Add yeast and water to milk mixture.  Add flour.  Knead and place in greased bowl, turning dough to grease top.  Cover with damp cloth and place in warm place until dough has doubled in bulk.  Punch down.  Divide dough in half.  Roll out dough on a floured surface to a 1/2" thickness.  Cut into 3" circles with biscuit cutter or large glass.  Place about an inch apart on baking sheets which have been sprinkled with cornmeal.  Let the muffins rise 20 to 30 minutes or until they have doubled in size.  Remove from baking sheets and cook on a skillet sprinkled with cornmeal and heated to 350° to 375°.  Do not use cooking oil in pan.  Heat about 5 minutes on each side.

Name: MacIntosh Muffins
Instructions: Just barely mix all ingredients together at the same time.  Fill cups 2/3 full.  Bake at 350° for 25 minutes or until golden.

Name: Raspberry Muffins
Instructions:
Preheat oven to 400°.  Mix flour, baking soda, salt, cinnamon and sugar.  Make a well in the center and stir in undrained berries and eggs.  Mix in oil and pecans; mix well.  Spoon batter into muffin tins.  Bake 15 to 20 minutes.

Note:  Can also be baked at 350° in 5"x9" loaf pans for 1 hour or until toothpick comes out clean.

Name: Refrigerator Muffins
Instructions: Pour boiling water over cereals.  Cool to lukewarm.  Do not stir.  Cream oil and sugar.  Add eggs and buttermilk and oatmeal.  Sift flours, baking soda, salt and wheat germ.  Add to creamed mixture and stir.  Add to cereal mixture and stir only until blended.  Bake at 400° for 18 to 20 minutes in muffin pan; use cupcake liners. Can be refrigerated for up to 1 month.

Name: Buttermilk Pancakes
Instructions: Mix together just until all flour is mixed in.  Bake on preheated and greased griddle.

Name: Cream Pancakes
Instructions: Sift together 1 cup flour, baking powder, salt and sugar.  Mix egg, cream and milk together and add to sifted ingredients.  Make pancakes.

Name: Quick Cinnamon Rolls
Instructions: Mix first 4 ingredients and set aside.  Mix next 3 ingredients and blend wet and dry mixtures.  Knead by hand 10 times on floured sufrace.  Divide in half and roll out one-half at a time.  Spread butter thinly and sprinkle with cinnamon and brown sugar.  Roll up and cut into 1/2" to 1" slices.  Place on greased pan and bake 8 to 10 minutes at 400°.

Name: Oatmeal Rolls
Instructions: Cook first 3 ingredients together and cool.  Dissolve yeast in warm water and add to oatmeal mixture.  Add sugars and salt to mixture.  Add flour and knead.  Let rise, then form into balls.  Place on greased baking sheet.  Let rise again.  Bake in 350° oven to 20 to 30 minutes.

Name: Cream of Broccoli Soup
Instructions: Cook broccoli, onion, broth and water 15 minutes or until broccoli is tender.  Blend 1/2 at a time in blender until smooth.  Return to pan and heat thoroughly.  Add salt, pepper and sour cream.  Keep on low until ready to serve.

Name: Cream of Broccoli Soup 2
Instructions: Wash and chop broccoli into tiny pieces.  Place in 6 to 10 quart pot and cover with broth.  Simmer.  Chop and saute onion in butter.  When tender, add flour and stir well.  Add milk to onion and stir until milk starts to thicken.  Add milk mixture to broccoli and simmer 5 to 10 minutes.

Name: Potato Cheddar Chowder
Instructions: Combine potatoes, onion, salt and water.  Simmer, covered, for 10 minutes.  Set aside (don't drain).  In another pan, melt butter.  Stir in flour until smooth.  Gradually add milk.  Blend until smooth, stirring constantly until thickened.  Remove from heat.  Add cheese and stir until melted.  Add undrained vegetables and Worcestershire sauce.  Heat through, but do not boil.

Name: Potato Soup
Instructions: Combine potatoes, onion, carrots, celery and bacon drippings.  Cover.  Cook on low, 20 minutes or until potatoes are tender.  Stir in milk and pepper.  Bring to a boil.  Stir together sour cream, flour and paprika.  Gradually stir hot mixture into the sour cream.  Return to saucepan.  Cook until mixture bubbles to the top with bacon pieces.

Name: Potato Soup
Instructions: Put all ingredients except milk and butter in crock pot.  Cover and cook on low for 10 to 12 hours or on high for 3 to 4 hours.  Stir in milk and butter during last hour.

Name: Quick Vegetable Soup
Instructions: In large pot, brown meat and onion.  Drain.  Salt and pepper to taste.  Stir in remaining ingredients.  Bring to a boil; reduce heat.  Cover and simmer 15 minutes or until noodles are tender.

Name: Beef Barley Stew
Instructions: Put all in crock pot and cook overnight on high, then low until dinner.

Name: French Oven Stew
Instructions: Cover and bake at 250° for 4 hours.

Name: After-Turkey Stew
Instructions: Place turkey in a Dutch oven with lid and fill with enough water to totally cover carcass.  Add garlic powder, salt, pepper, thyme, parsley, bay leaves and 3 bouillon cubes.  Bring to a boil then simmer, covered, for 3 to 4 hours until meat falls from bones.  Strain bones and cartilage out.  Add 3 more cubes, rice, water, carrots and any other desired vegetables.  Simmer until rice is cooked.

Name: Hamburger Biscuits
Instructions: Brown beef and onions.  Drain.  Add sauce, onion and brown sugar.  Spray muffin pans and spread biscuits in cups, covering completely.  Put meat in biscuits and top with cheese.  Bake at 350° for 10 minutes.

Name: Cheeseburger Pie
Instructions: Brown beef and drain.  Add salt, pepper, chili powder and tomato sauce.  Mix and set aside.  Pat 1 pkg. rolls into pie pan like a pie crust.  Fill with meat mixture and top with both cheeses.  Cover with second pkg forming a top crust.  Brush top with milk.  Bake 20 minutes at 400°.  Serve with sour cream.
